loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja reside en Estados Unidos, vive solo con sus tres hijos.

María, desde que se fue su esposo hace cinco años, se ha dedicado a vender y comprar ropa, se dedico a este negocio para apoyar a su pareja.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, de esa manera siempre tendrá los ingresos necesarios, para darles lo que necesitan sus hijos y mejorara su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, es terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos y seguir trabajando con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and has no formal education. She has a partner, who lives in the US. María lives with her three children.

Since her husband left five years ago, María has made a living buying and selling clothing. She does this work in order to support her partner.

María needs this loan in order to buy clothes for men, women and children, allowing her to earn the necessary income that her children need and to improve her quality of life.

María's dream is to finish providing her children with an education and to continue working with CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children.

loans.name: Jori

texts.ru: 62 летный мужчина Чори. Он отец четверых детей. Дети взрослые семейные. Им 32, 28, 24 и 20 лет. Чори сильный и авторитетный дехканин. Он 20 лет своей жизни продвигает на земле. Чори занимается  растениеводством. Он трудится на земли и зарабатывает на жизнь. Растениеводство является единственным источником дохода. Чори тоже хорошо воспитывал  своих детей, они сейчас тоже занимаются земледелием и животноводством. В селах и районах Республики люди трудятся на земле и выращивают животных. И у каждого из них есть свой источник доход. Чори нуждается в кредит для купли минеральных удобрений. Для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ему не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по этой причине Чори обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: This 62 year old man is Jori. He is the father of four children. His children are grown up and married. They are 32, 28, 24 and 20 years old. Jori is a strong and authoritative farmer. He has spent 20 years of his life farming. Jori grows crops. He works the ground and earns a living. Growing crops is his only source of income. Jori has taught his sons well, and now they also grow crops and rear animals. In the villages and regions of the Republic, people work the earth and rear animals. Each of them has their own source of income. Jori needs a loan to buy mineral fertilizer. He lacks part of the money he needs in order to buy a sufficient quantity of fertilizer, and for this reason Jori has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and treat his land with it.

loans.name: Tulganoy

texts.ru: Ее зовут Тулганой, Ей 50 лет. Она вместе с семьей живет на районе Вахш. Тулганой замужем и имеет две дочки которым 16 и 17 лет. Тулганой возле дома имеет не большой участок земли где, занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Тулганой планирует собрать урожай и посадить новый. Для этого ей нужно купить минеральные удобрения и горючего для трактора. Денежных средств ей не хватает и она обратилась за кредитом. Тулганой надеется, что Вы ее поддержите.
texts.en: This lady is called Tulganoy. She is 50 years old. She and her family live in the Vakhsh region. Tulganoy is married and has two daughters who are 16 and 17 years old. Tulganoy has a small plot of land by her house where she grows crops. Tulganoy plans to gather her harvest and plant a new crop. For this she needs to buy mineral fertilizer and tractor fuel. She does not have sufficient funds and she has applied for a loan. Tulganoy hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: to acquire mineral fertilizer and tractor fuel.

loans.name: Mugwathi Poultry Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
James, the gentleman raising his hand in the photograph, is 69 years old and married with six children. His economic activity is farming maize and beans as well as dairy farming. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013 and has received training on enterprise development and financial planning, which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as manure and pesticides. This will help him boost his business and increase his income. Therefore, he will be able to support his family with ease.

James is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as manure and pesticides that will increase productivity.

loans.name: Tumaini Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Nancy. She is 38 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training, especially enterprise development.

Nancy practices dairy and poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed and more chickens to increase production. She will earn more income to provide basic needs for her family, e.g. food and clothing.

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and chickens, hence increasing her dairy and poultry production for increased income to provide basic needs to her family such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Yescenia Aurora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Damas Positivas.
En este lugar vive la señora Yescenia, tiene  37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 19 y 10 años que estudian en universidad y en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Yescenia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos para salir adelante junto a su familia,  ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres  en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, pollo, carnes, granos, embutidos y productos de bazar y papelería para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes  que a diario acuden a su local, ella comparte su tiempo en la atención a sus clientes y a sus hijos cuando ellos la necesitan, lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual es parte de su vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio, va a comprar más variedad de víveres. Lleva más de 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, Manabí's capital, known for many years as the city of royal tamarinds, every fortnight the members of the "Damas Positivas" loan group meets.

And it is her that 37-year-old Yescenia lives. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 10 years old; they are studying at university and school respectively. Yescenia's husband is a taxi driver.

Yescenia likes to look after herself and to earn her own income to move forward with her family. Yescenia has her own grocery store in her house. There she sells all types of supplies: chicken, meat, grains, cold meats, miscellaneous products and stationery. She sells these products to satisfy the needs of the customers who come to her shop. Yescenia splits her time looking after her customers and her children when they need her. She has had the business for 15 years and it is part of her life.

Yescenia will use this loan to stock up her business; she will buy a greater variety of supplies to sell. Yescenia has been part of the loan group for more than ten years and likes it because she started the business with the loans.

Yescenia's dreams are to offer the best possible to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Suiunbubu

texts.ru: Суйунбубу, 61 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, сейчас на пенсии, много лет проработала в школе учителем, уже 20 лет Суйунбубу занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 13 коров, 5 овец, лошадь, также земельный надел мерою 4,41 ГА, где Суйунбубу выращивает клевер. Дети и супруг с радостью помогают Суйунбубу в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход Суйунбубу от ведения бизнеса около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Суйунбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей накопить на приобретение земельного участка.
texts.en: Suiunbubu is 61 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education. She is retired now, having spent many years working as a school teacher. Suiunbubu has been farming for 20 years now. She has 13 cows, five sheep, a horse, and also a 4.41 hectare plot of land where Suiunbubu grows clover. Her children and husband happily help Suiunbubu in running her business. They have all the conditions for keeping livestock. Suiunbubu's monthly income from running the business is about 10,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep. Suiunbubu plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing the size of her flock, which will enable her to save up to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep in order to increase the size of her flock.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Нигора жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй живёт в сельской местности. Сама Нигор работает швеёй. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье.
 В данное время Нигора вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Нигора обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для утепления дома. Она также хочет установить пластиковые окна и двери.  Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Nigora is a happy and responsible woman.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She lives with her family in the countryside and works as a seamstress.  Nigora and her husband truly love their children and they work very hard to give them the best possible education.  Unfortunately, their salaries are not sufficient to cover all the needs of the family.  At the moment, Nigora and her husband want to renovate their house in order to improve their living conditions, but they don't have the personal resources to do so.  For this reason, Nigora has turned to MDO Arvand; she would like to receive a loan to buy  construction materials in order to provide heat to her house.  She also wants to install plastic doors and windows.  She is looking forward to a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to install plastic windows and heating materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy livestock.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Lucas se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de cacao así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Lucas espera ofrecer un cacao de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucas is 41 years old and lives with his partners and children in a house that he owns and that is made with rustic materials. Lucas lives in the Pomahuaca district of the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern highlands. Life here is quiet, and the locals mainly make a living in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

Lucas makes a living in farming, specifically growing cacao. He has eight years' experience in the field, and very good personal and professional references locally.

Lucas will use this loan to buy manure and fertilisers to look after his cacao crops and to hire labourers for the harvest season. Lucas hopes that this loan will allow him to offer better quality cacao to his customers. This will have a positive impact on his income and will therefore improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to look after his cacao crops and to hire labourers for the harvest season.

loans.name: Tanyi Jaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Damas Positivas.
En este vive la señora Tanyi, tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 18 y 7 años de edad,  los dos estudian en universidad y en escuela. Su esposo es empleado público. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Tanyi es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, hace más de 20 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí ella confecciona, sabanas,  prendas para damas y niños, los mismos que elabora por encargos o para vender, también vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y casi todo el día en sus ocupaciones las mismas que le dejan muy buenos beneficios en su vida personal. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar materiales para la costura, perfumes cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the communal bank Damas Positivas meet in the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known for many years as the city of the "Royal Tamarind" trees.

This is where Tanyi, 41, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 7, who attend university and grade school, respectively.  Her husband is a public employee.  Several years ago, Tanyi learned sewing at an academy in her town.  She has always enjoyed working to earn an income.  Some 20 years ago she set up a sewing shop in her home where she makes sheets and women's and children's clothing either on an order basis or for retail sales.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day, nearly all day, in the activities that give her a good profit in her personal life.

She will use this loan to buy sewing materials, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She has been in the group since its beginnings and lies the fact that the loans help her get ahead.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 60 años, desde niña sintió inclinación por la culinaria y soñaba con tener su restaurant, sueño que consolidó y llevo a cabo con unos ahorros. Poco a poco su negocio se fue cotizando y sus comensales se encargaron de darle el good will por sus exquisitos platos, en la actualidad cuenta con 40 años de ofrecerle a los Soleños desayunos típicos y almuerzos corrientes.  Su esfuerzo y dedicación ha permitido que Alicia tenga éxito en su negocio, ella empieza su jornada laboral desde la madrugada a partir de las 4 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y como hoy en día su demanda se ha incrementado y necesita una inyección de capital, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en víveres como arroz, carnes, verduras y demás.   Su meta de prosperidad es ampliar su negocio y remodelarlo.
texts.en:
Alicia, 60, has had an inclination toward cooking since she was a little girl.  She used to dream about having a restaurant and was able to consolidate and realize her dreams with her savings.  Little by little her business grew and customers showed their good will toward her exquisite dishes.  Now she has 40 years' experience offering typical breakfasts and lunches to Soleños (people from Soledad).

Through her efforts and dedication Alicia has been successful in her business.  She starts work every day at 4:00 a.m. and works until 3:00 p.m.  Since demand has increased she needs to increase capital and is requesting her first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy food ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and other goods.  Her goal toward prosperity is to expand and remodel her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and other goods.

loans.name: Vilma Concepción

texts.es:
Vilma, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada, su esposo se encuentra en Estados Unidos, tuvo seis hijos, pero solo tres están casados, los otros tres están con ella.

Vilma, desde que se caso se ha dedicado a vender pupusas en el centro de su domicilio, su madre fue quien le enseño ese negocio, ahora tiene bastantes clientes y una hija vende dos días por semana sábado y domingo.
 
Vilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer pupusas y para cubrir otros gastos que tiene que realizar, de esa forma lograra mejorar su negocio y obtendrá mejores ingresos económicos. 

El sueño de Vilma, es mantener su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Vilma, 49 years old, studied until the 2nd grade of elementary school. She is married, her husband is in the United States, and she has six children: three who are married and the other three live with her.  

Vilma has had a business in her home selling tortillas and pupusas since she got married. Her mother was the one who taught her the trade and now she has sufficient customers.  One of her daughters sells two days a week, Saturday and Sunday.

Vilma is in need of a loan to buy materials to make pupusas and to cover costs she has.  This will improve her business and increase her income.

Her dream is to keep her business running and to improve profits.

loans.use: To buy materials to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 36 лет, она замужем, мать 3 детей дошкольного возраста, старшая дочь Сабиры ходит в детский сад. У Сабиры среднее образования. Сабира очень доброжелательный человек, она ответственная, целеустремленная, знает конкретно чего хочет и всегда стремится к своим целям. На протяжении многих лет Сабира занимается торговлей фруктов на рынке города. Свой бизнес она начала с 50,000 сом (KGS), и смогла развить торговлю, увеличив прибыль от бизнеса до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Все накопленные средства Сабира старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в магазине, за счет покупки фруктов. Сабира считает, что инвестирование средств в летний сезон позволит ей в дальнейшем развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и закончить строительство дома.
texts.en:
Sabira is 36 years old, married, and has three children of preschool age. Sabira's oldest daughter is going to kindergarten. Sabira has secondary education. Sabira is a very friendly person. She is responsible, goal-oriented, and knows exactly what she wants. She is always striving towards her goals. 

For many years, Sabira has sold fruits at the city market. She started her business with 50,000 som (KGS), and managed to develop her trade, having increased her business profit to up to 20,000 som (KGS) a month. Sabira tries to invest all the accumulated funds in the development of her business. 

She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to increase her shop turnover by buying fruits. Sabira believes that investing funds in the summer will allow her to develop her business further, to improve the well-being of her family, and to finish constructing her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits in order to invest in her business and increase turnover in her shop.

loans.name: Manuela Mirella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva California de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Ignacio De Loyola. 
En este lugar vive la señora Manuela, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Manuela con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, ropa interior y productos de Avon y Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale en sus ratos libres más que todo en horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora sus hijos estudian y se le hace más fácil salir, pero si sus clientes necesitan algo ellos la buscan en su casa, lleva más de 8  años en su negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por ella misma y así ayudar a su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y cosméticos. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la institución les brinda muy buenos  servicios. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the communal bank San Ignacio de Loyola meet in the community of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the Manabi capital that has been known for many years as the city of the "Royal Tamarind" trees.

This is where Manuela, 40, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 10, who attend junior high and elementary school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

To earn her own income Manuela works as a merchant.  She sells all kinds of clothing, shoes, underwear, and Avon and Belcorp products (perfumes, creams, jewelry, etc.).  She works door-to-door, going out in her free time in the morning which is when her children are in school.  But if her customers need something they go to her house.  She has been in business for eight years and earns enough to help support the family.

She will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing, shoes and cosmetics.  Manuela has been a member of the communal bank for ten years and she likes the services provided by the institution.  Her dream is to continue improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dalinda Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva California de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Ignacio De Loyola. 
En este lugar vive la señora Dalinda, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 18 y 8 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Dalinda es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y cosméticos, ella sale a vender en sus ratos mas desocupados, ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en su negocio, el vende todo tipo de accesorios para carros, limpia parabrisas, películas, alfombras para el piso de los autos entre otras cosas,  el trabaja casi todo el día y se traslada a otras ciudad a vender. De esta forma sacan adelante a sus hijos dándoles una buena educación que les sirva para su futuro.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cosméticos y accesorios para autos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños es darles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the communal bank San Ignacio de Loyola meet in the community of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo. It is the Manabi capital that has been known for many years as the city of the "Royal Tamarind" trees.

This is where Dalinda, 40, lives.  She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 8, who attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Dalinda is a woman who loves to work and help her husband with the household expenses.  She is a merchant and sells clothing and cosmetics.  In her free time is when she goes out to sell.  Part of the loan will be used for her husband in his business selling all kinds of auto accessories, windshield wipers, screens, rugs, etc.  He works all day and travels to other cities to sell.  This is how the couple raise their children, giving them a good education for the future.

The loan will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics and auto accessories.  Dalinda has been a member of the group for ten years and she likes the fact that the loans are granted quickly.

Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and auto accessories.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru: Ойша успешно погасила прежний кредит. Она закупила большую партию миндаля и продав её с наценкой она смогла увеличить семейный бюджет. Ойша очень довольна, потому что её жизнь резко изменилась в лучшую сторону. Она очень благодарна всем кредиторам, которые подержали её в нужный момент. Сейчас торговлей заниматься её невестка, а сама Ойша начала заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у неё есть три барана, однако это мало для расширения бизнеса. Ойша желает купить несколько голов телят, расширит свой бизнес и обеспечить свою семью всеми молочными продуктами. Ойша верит, что и на этот раз также с Вашей помощью она сможет добиться успеха.
texts.en:
Oysha has successfully repaid her previous loan. She bought a large batch of almonds, and after selling them for a profit, she managed to increase her family budget. Oysha is very satisfied, because her life has distinctly changed for the better. She is very thankful to all creditors who supported her in her time of need. 

Now her daughter-in-law is working for the business, and Oysha has started working in animal husbandry. Currently, she has three sheep, however this is not enough to develop her business. Oysha wants to buy a few heads of calves to expand her business and provide her family with all milk products. Oysha believes that this time as well, with your help, she will be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of calves.

loans.name: Zaytuna

texts.ru: Зайтуна молодая женщина из городка Куляб. Ей всего 30 лет. Она после развода с мужем переехала жить обратно к родителям. Родители Зайтуны пенсионеры. Отцу 73, а матери 66 лет. Зайтуна ухаживает за родителями и параллельно работает. Родители получают пособие, но размер пособия очень маленькое и Зайтуна должна выйти на работу. Она занимается продажей готовой пищи. Она сама готовит еду и вывозит на продажу (на свою лавку). Зайтуна любит свою работу и у нее есть поклонники ее готовки. Зайтуна хочет увеличить ассортимент ее товара и изменить меню. Для этого Зайтуна просит помочь. Она на заемные деньги приобретет продукты и совершит задуманный план.
texts.en:
Zaytuna is a young woman from Kulob city. She is only 30 years old. After divorcing her husband, she moved back in with her parents. Zaytuna's parents are retired. Her father is 73, and her mother is 66. Zaytuna takes care of her parents and working at the same time. Her parents receive a pension, however the size of the pension is very small and Zaytuna must go to work. She sells cooked food. 

On her own, she prepares the food and transports it to her store to sell. Zaytuna loves her work and she has fans of her cooking. Zaytuna wants to increase the variety of her store's products and change the menu. Zaytuna requests for help with this. She will obtain groceries and fulfill her plan with the borrowed money.

loans.use: to buy food products and prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: tor the purchase of seeds and manure.

loans.name: Ángela Narcisa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva California de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Ignacio De Loyola. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 13 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es guardia d seguridad. Hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible para obtener ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera mantener el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, hace mas de 10 años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza, allí ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar esmaltes, tintes y ciertas herramientas que necesita. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta el trato de la promotora y los beneficios que recibe de la fundación. Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, members of the Credit Group San Ignacio De Loyola meet in the residential community Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí Province and known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees". Ángela lives here; she is 43 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, aged 19 and 13, who are studying at university and high school. Her husband is a security guard and, some years ago, she studied to be a beautician at a local academy.

Ángela is a very hard-working woman who does everything she can to generate income, so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and the cost of their children's studies. She set up a beauty salon in her house over 10 years ago, where she pffers hair colouring, haircuts and nail painting amongst other services. She works everyday from 8am until 8pm, and sometimes later if her clients require her services.

She is going to use this loan to buy nail polish, hair colour and some tools that she needs. This is Ángela's second loan with the Credit Group; she likes the loan officer's behaviour and the benefits she receives from the foundation. Her dream is to have a large beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, hair colour and tools

loans.name: Carla Ivonne

texts.es:
Veinte años han pasado desde el día que Carla decidió vender comida por primera vez, aún lo recuerda como si hubiese sido ayer, estaba en su casa con su dos hijos de corta de edad, veía las carencias de su hogar y sabía que necesitaba hacer algo para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos económicos de su casa. Por ello, sin más que pensar y con ayuda de su marido, decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida.
 Con el tiempo los clientes fueron aumentando porque la calidad y el sabor, solo su comidería lo ofrecía.  Por esta razón, Carla solicita un crédito para comprar una vitrina y una cocina industrial que le permita ofrecer higiénicamente sus alimentos, a la vez, podrá preparar la comida con mayor rapidez y abundancia. Cabe destacar, que ella planea expandir su negocio con las ganancias.
texts.en:
It is 20 years since Carla first decided to sell food and she still remembers it like it was yesterday: she was in her house with her two young children, saw their home's shortcomings and knew that she needed to do something to support her husband with the household income. So, after some thought and with help from her husband, she decided to make a living selling food. 

Over time her customers increased as only her eatery was offering this quality and flavour. For this reason, Carla is requesting a loan to buy a display cabinet and an industrial stove, so that she can offer her food more hygienically and also prepare more food more quickly. It is worth emphasising that Carla plans to expand her business with the profits.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and an industrial stove

loans.name: Edith María

texts.es: Edith de 65 años es una mujer muy activa, ella se dedica a la venta de mercancías varias y desde su casa ofrece bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, víveres y carnes frías.  Desde joven ella se dedicó al comercio; viajaba a Maicao y traía diferentes artículos por encargos, como tendidos de cama, electrodomésticos y demás, pero con el pasar del tiempo la oferta de productos ya no era tan tentadora y decidió comprar en almacenes de Barranquilla.  Todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. ella se dedica a sus negocios, los cuales le han permitido tener bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida.  Como su finalidad ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un almacén misceláneo, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una vitrina grande donde pueda exhibir nuevo surtido de ropa y complementar su stock de carnes frías.  Edith es madre de seis hijos a quien aún tiende su mano y les ayuda en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Edith is 65 years old and is a very active woman. She works selling various goods and at her home she offers fizzy drinks, beers, food staples and cold meats. She has worked in trade since she was young; she used to travel to Maicao and bring back different orders, such as bed linen, electrical appliances and other items, but with time the products on offer became less attractive, and she decided to buy in stores in Barranquilla. 

She works every day from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. in her businesses, which have allowed her to improve her well-being and quality of life. As her end goal is to expand her business into a general store, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a large display case where she can display new clothing stock and supplement her stock of cold meats. 

Edith is mother to six children, who she still supports and helps in whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy a large display case where she can display new clothing stock and supplement her stock of cold meats.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a farmer from German village, Ungheni region in Moldova. She is married. Maria has two children: a 1-year-old boy and a 3-year-old girl. Her husband, Ion, works periodically in Russia as a constructor.

Ion helps Maria to manage this farm. Maria has one greenhouse of 60 square meters and she raises tomatoes, peppers and eggplants.

She wants to expand the surface of the greenhouse for producing more tomatoes, to be self employed and sell more of her own vegetables.

Maria will use the loan to build a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Reyna Dinora

texts.es: Reyna de 20 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su grupo familiar, ella es una mujer luchadora que desde hace varios años ha instalado en su casa de habita con un negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz y gracias a su amabilidad, carisma y su buen servicio a logrado atraer mucha clientela, las cuales admiran su dedicación y entusiasmo, es por ello que con el propósito de seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de productos ella ha tomado la decisión de adquirir este crédito en FUSAI con el propósito de continuar invirtiendo en la materia prima para la elaboración de las ricas tortillas de maíz y así gracias a los ingresos que obtiene seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado el piensa invertir en la compra de maíz y gas propano.
texts.en: Reyna is twenty years old and lives in her own house along with her family. She is a determined woman who opened a business from her home several years ago, preparing and selling corn tortillas. Thanks to her friendliness, charisma, and good service, she has attracted many customers, who admire her dedication and enthusiasm. In order to continue fulfilling the demand for her products, she has decided to obtain this loan from FUSAI so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her delicious corn tortillas and, thanks to the income that she receives, continue contributing to the household economy. Therefore, with the requested amount of the loan, she plans to buy corn flour and propane.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, propane, and everything she needs to prepare corn tortillas.

loans.name: Wendano Wa Aka Musandukuni W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is ELizabeth. She is 45 years old, married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She is a fruit vendor, selling mangoes, papayas, and bananas. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables, hence to earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables and hence to earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, married and a father of four.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March, 2014, and received training on enterprise management and financial planning. The training has equipped him with skills on effectively managing his enterprise of maize and beans farming.

Joseph requires a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. These will help him to increase his harvest and thus boost his income. He will therefore be able to improve the living standards of his family in areas such as housing and medical care.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will improve his crop yield.

loans.name: Eliut

texts.en:
Eliut is a 37-year-old beekeeper from Calakmul. He started working as an apiarist 11 years ago and has been doing so ever since. He also builds and sells wooden boxes in which the beehives are kept.

Eliut lives in a community called Nuevo Becal inside of the Mayan Rainforest, one of the most important lungs of the American continent, rich in biodiversity and natural resources. Contradictorily, most of its inhabitants are poor and marginalized.

Environmentally, apiculture is an extremely important activity. Bees offer, through pollination, one of the most important natural services for the conservation and regeneration of biodiversity. This becomes especially important in the Yucatan peninsula, where the rainforest’s resources have been exploited by non- environmentally friendly activities.

With this loan, Eliut will be able to buy materials for the production of beehives and inputs with which he’ll increase his production of bee honey for the final productive season of the year. He will also buy an engine and blades to build wooden boxes for his own beehives and to sell to other beekeepers.

As a result, he will earn more money, improve the living conditions of his family and make a larger contribution to the conservation of this invaluable site.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of beehives.

loans.name: Kiuukuni Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Haida, 33 years old, married and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training on enterprise development.

Haida practices mixed farming. She grows maize and beans and keeps goats and indigenous chicken.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chickens for increased income to pay school fees for her two children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more indigenous chickens for increased income to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.name: New Jerusalem Mukalala Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josephne, 53 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She operates a green grocery store where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables, e.g. kales, tomatoes, onions and sweet potatoes.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, hence adding stock for an increased income. This will enable her pay for the family's expenses, e.g. food and clothing.

Josephne is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to earn more income to pay for the family's expenses, e.g. food and clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Esther, 56 years old, married with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and because of the training she underwent, Esther has been able to run and manage her business well.

She does maize, bean and tomato farming; she is therefore borrowing from Kiva to buy top dressing fertilizer to boost her crop yield. This will further increase her income, hence being in a position to provide her children with food, shelter, clothing and education.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy top dressing fertilizer to boost her crop yield. This will increase income, thus meeting family needs with ease.

loans.name: Puente De Vida Group

texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Chichicastenango, Guatemala, 10 women meet with the mutual goals of contributing to the development of their community while simultaneously increasing their quality of life. Together, these 10 women are from the tenacious trust bank known as “Puente de Vida” or, “Life Bridge”.

The main source of employment for the members of “Puente de Vida” is the production of textiles but, there are exceptions to that. Candelaria, the group's secretary, is a 27-year-old, married mother of two who makes a living by selling sandals for men, women and children.

Candelaria reports with enthusiasm and excitement that the demand for the sandals she sells has been increasing and for that reason, she is applying for another loan with Kiva. With the loan she receives, Candelaria hopes to invest in the purchasing of more new sandals so that she may have a larger of variety for her clients to choose from.

In addition to her main business, Candelaria receives extra income from selling her hand-made huipiles (traditional Guatemalan wear) and planting various fruit trees to be sold later.

Candelaria, along with her fellow members, are in incredible appreciation for the many investors of Kiva worldwide, for having confidence in their personal development. Thank you Kiva investors for your undying support in helping make Guatemala a better place.

loans.use: to purchase more new sandals to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary, 36 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell and earn more income. She hopes the Kiva loan will improve her living standards by enabling her pay school fees for her children and provide food for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes for sale for more income thereby enabling her pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Olas De Atitlan Group

texts.en:
Located on the shores of Lake Atitlan you can find a picturesque town called Santiago Atitlan. Among the town’s residents resides a group of women that come together to form the trust bank “Olas de Atitlan” or, “Waves of Atitlan”, who are descendants of the Mayan ethnicity Tz'utujil. The women of the town are known for preserving and wearing their traditional clothing, while the men have kept very little of their traditional typical clothing.

At 21 years old, Cervelia, a member of the communal bank, took advantage of the opportunity given to her by her family and has completed 9 years of formal education. Cervelia’s trial to get to this point has engrained hard work in to her life, which has translated to the way she runs her business as the owner of a small meat shop.

Cervelia is applying for a loan which she plans to reinvest into purchasing three pigs to increase sales and thus further increase her capital. Aside from selling meat, Cervelia is also involved in the sale of vegetables and spices to increase the flavor of meats, which is an added benefit for her primary meat shop.

The majority of the trust bank members did not have the same opportunity as Cervelia in receiving nine years of formal education; this has not stopped them from being successful in their respective businesses, however. The other members own and operate a variety of different business that include: weaving and bordering huipiles, producing elaborate and detailed ornaments, cosmetic sales, and other things. At the end of the day, the eight women of “Olas de Atitlan” are proof of how far women of Guatemala can go when given the right resources.

These women are sure that, with the loan from Kiva, they will be able to accomplish any goal that they set their minds to. Thank you Kiva for all of you support and confidence.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs to increase meat sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair gel, toothpaste, sweets, deodorants, cosmetics, soap and hair accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase potatoes, yucca, plantains, salt, plastic bags, coconut, and everything necessary to improve her business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su madre de 65 años y  sus dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente. Anabel es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz la cual realiza en su casa de habitación ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella posee una gran clientela ya que es el único negocio de este tipo en su comunidad y además ofrece este servicio desde hace más de cinco años, es por ello que con el deseo de incrementar la producción de su producto ha decidido adquirir un crédito en FUSAI el cual piensa utilizar en la compra de los insumos y gastos necesarios para hacer crecer su negocio. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado ella invertirá en: maíz, gas propano, pago de molino, etc.
texts.en: Anabel is 41 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 65 year old mother and her two children, 20 and 16 years old, who are currently studying. Anabel is a hardworking woman, who works in the business of making and selling corn tortillas. She works from her own house, and has been able to raise her family and pay for household expenses with this business. She has many customers because it is the only business of this type in her community, and also because she has done this service for more than five years.  Because she wants to increase the production of this product, she has decided to apply for a loan in FUSAI which she plans to use to buy ingredients and in the needed expenses to make her business grow. For this she will use the requested loan amount to buy corn, propane gas, to pay for the mill, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane gas, to pay for the mil, etc., for the production of corn tortillas.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Clara está en su ciclo 7 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que cada una conozca su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marina es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer entusiasta que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante, ella es Docente Jubilada y además se dedica a la elaboración y venta de manualidades. Su esposo también es docente jubilado y ambos se ayudan de esa forma.
La Sra. Marina solicita  este préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las manualidades, como ser telas, alambres, hilos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Clara group is in its seventh loan cycle with the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination tool so that each one knows their life situation and according to that they can continue improving their quality of life.

One of the members is Marina who is the president of this group. She is an enthusiastic woman who struggles to be able to grow and get ahead. She is a retired teacher and in addition she works making and selling crafts. Her husband is also a retired teacher and they both help each other in this way.

Marina asks for this loan to purchase materials to make her crafts such as fabric, wire, thread and more, so as to be able able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, wire, thread and other supplies to make crafts.

loans.name: Mehylin Anabell

texts.es: Mahylin de 43 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su esposo y su hija de 17 años quien se dedica a estudiar. Mahylin posee una tienda de productos básicos de primera necesidad desde hace cuatro años por lo que ha logrado adquirir una gran experiencia en las ventas y administración del negocio, ella es una mujer amable y brinda un buen servicio además brinda todo a un precio accesible al bolsillo de las personas por lo que tiene una gran clientela. Mahylin con el deseo de incrementar el inventario de su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en productos como: huevos. Jabón, golosinas, especias, sueros, café, shampoo, etc.
texts.en: Mahylin, 43 years old, lives in a house she owns alongside her husband and her 17-year-old daughter who is a student. Mahylin has owned a store of basic products for the past four years, through which she has managed to get a lot of experience in sales and business administration. She is a friendly woman and provides good service, in addition to offering everything at an accessible price for people's wallets, so she has a large customer base. Mahylin, with the desire to increase her business's inventory and offer a wider variety of products to her customers, has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to be able to invest in products such as eggs, soap, sweets, spices, syrups, coffee, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sweets, spices, syurps, coffee, shampoo, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Joyline

texts.en:
Joyline is 23 years old married to Hillary and blessed with one child eight old.She is a musical performer and has been singing for three years now.She earns a monthly income of KES.15,000. 

Joyline has applied for KES.70,000,as her first loan with VFK Kapsabet and plans to buy a key-board and one speaker for her performance.

The expanded profits from her business will be used to pay back the loan. Her dreams are to open up a musical studio.

loans.use: to purchase a key-board and speakers for her musical performances

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 29 years old and deals in produce like rice, groundnuts and maize. She used the previous loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell. Her family dream is educating her children to university as her business dream is expanding her business into new market areas, thus increasing her sales and profits. Despite her dreams,she meets a difficulty of high transportation costs of her products to her customers.

She is acquiring credit to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 39 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Butebe Tweterane Group

texts.en:
Margret with a raised hand is a member of Butebe Tweterane group where members guarantee each other for a loan. She has 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. 

She sells fresh foods a business which she started with a hope of developing herself to a bigger income base to be in line to look after her family. Margret has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods for sell. Her business is affected by lack of a preservative machine that can prevent her products from going bad.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana lives with her father and brother in Ararat region.
People of the region work mainly in farming, cattle-raising and trade. Diana herself makes a living cultivating crops and vegetables and grape. Her business is located in her own home. She has ten years' experience with the agribusiness and very good personal and professional references locally. Diana will use this loan to purchase new land to expand land cultivation works. 

This is Diana's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and Diana faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her family's hard work during recent times, she and her brother were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Diana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support Diana with her loan and help her to sustain her farm.

loans.use: to pay for new land to expand cultivation

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Tol's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Tol is 40 years old and a married mother of two children. She has been growing rice on two hectares area of farmland for 21 years to earn the main income. Occasionally, she works for others for a fee to supplement income. Rice crop was destroyed severely. 

Now, Tol is leading a group of two members to apply for a new loan and it is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was paid back completely and it enabled her to renovate her house much better and comfortable than before. Tol, the group leader, will use her loan to purchase good rice seeds and organic fertilizers to increase crop yields. She hopes she have enough capital to expand her business bigger.

loans.use: to purchase good rice seeds and organic fertilizers to increase crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is the age of 37 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of four children. 
Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. This restaurant has been supporting his whole family for many years. Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valuable customers, so that he can grow his income.

Rubina is requesting a loan for the restaurant establishment. Her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc.   She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause to generate more profit and savings, as well.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt, etc for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana has been a seamstress for 10 years.  She wants to produce more children's clothes and so has asked for another loan to be able to buy fabrics.
She has two sons and lives with her parents.  She is healthy.

Susana wants to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making children's clothes

loans.name: 30 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité 30 de agosto se encuentra en el primer ciclo, es un grupo nuevo donde todas están luchando para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos. El grupo se formó en una compañía de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona rural, bastante alejada de la capital del país. El grupo está conformado por 17 integrantes todas con actividades independientes.
La señora Ana se dedica a la cría de animales, ella vende sus productos en una feria dos veces por semana cuenta con mucha clientela debido a su buena atención y a la buena calidad de sus productos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría como gallinas, cerdos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 30 de agosto committee is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group where they are all struggling to be able to get ahead and help their loved ones. The group was formed in a company in the city of Santaní, a rural zone, rather distant from the country's capital. The group is made up of 17 members, all with independent businesses. 

Ana works raising animals. She sells her products at a fair two times per week and has a large customer base due to her good service and the good quality of her products. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who wants to get ahead.

She asks for this loan to purchase animals to raise such as hens, pigs, and more, so to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing and struggle to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise such as hens, pigs, and more.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y están contentas por formar parte de este programa, ya que será una gran oportunidad para ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien vende joyas de platas,  y ya tiene muy buena clientela ya que tiene de todo y con ello ayudar a su familia. Mirna comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero que con su lucha ha podido mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar joyas variadas para la venta, y con ello poder cumplir con sus clientes y con los pedidos que tiene. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y está contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
This group is in the poverty elimination program. They want to improve their living conditions and are happy to be part of this program, which will be a great opportunity for them.

One of the members is Mirna who sells silver jewelry and has a good customer base already since she has everything, and with this she helps her family.

Mirna says that at first it was very difficult but that with a struggle, she has been able to improve.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of jewelry for sale, and with this be able to satisfy her customers and the orders she has. She is a very self-sacrificing person and is happy for this opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se formaron para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
La Sra. Carolina, es una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de lencería, ella está muy contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder acceder al préstamo para poder mejorar sus ingresos a través de su emprendimiento.
Carolina pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencerías varias para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres en Acción is in its third loan cycle with the women's committee program. They are very hard-working women who formed a group to be able to help their loved ones.

Carolina is one of the members of this group. She works selling lingerie. She is very happy for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to access the loan to be able to improve her income through her work.

Carolina asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of lingerie to be able to continue with her sales and in this way have the mans to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is aged 63 years old.He has 3 children to support,he has been in the business for the last 10 years and the business has been earning him an income of KES 30,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds and add a dairy cow for milk production for sell to his clients. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and add a dairy cow for milk production for sell to his clients.

loans.name: Muázu

texts.en:
Muázu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Jaki Village. Muázu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past,  Muázu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Muázu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting30 bags of maize this year,  Muázu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Sol De Atitlan Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlan is a gem of a town in Guatemala, located on the shores of the unforgettable Lake Atitlan where the majority of its inhabitants speak a variety of indigenous languages. In this specific area, the economy is majorly made up of agriculture, the production and sale of artisan goods, and the production and sale of ornaments and beaded jewelry. 

There, on the shores of Lake Atitlan, an innovative group of 8 women form the trust bank “Sol de Atitlan” or, “The Sun of Atitlan”, a name in reference to the beautiful light that brings life and energy to the beautiful town. 

Rosalia, a 35 year old member of “Sol de Atitlan”, runs a variety of business but, mainly, she works by making and selling tortillas. Rosalia is currently applying for another loan so that she may amplify her business and buy various bushels of corn, lime, and wood with the final goal to satisfy the demands of her many clients. Other than her tortilla shop, Rosalia designs and makes necklaces, purses, jewelry, and ornaments to sell so that she may have the extra income to increase her family’s quality of life. The extra work that Rosalia does is meant to “help my 2 children of 15 and 19 years continue in their studies”, Rosalia says. 

The women of the trust bank “Sol de Atitlan”, have various business all of which are worth mentioning: bordering and sale of huipiles, production of fabrics, production of many different artisan goods, animal farming, sale of food, and small restaurants. The average number of children for the group is 3; and the average amount of education among the women is one year of schooling. Thank you to all of those who have invested and believed in the development of Guatemalan women and the country in whole!

loans.use: To buy various bushels of corn, lime, and wood for her tortilla (food) business

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Alegres es un grupo nuevo, de una zona rural, donde todas se dedican a actividades rural de cría de animales y venta de los mismos, son luchadoras que pese a su condición humilde luchan por poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Hilda es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se caracteriza por su carisma y laboriosidad, cuenta con una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named Mujeres Alegres is a new group in a rural zone, where they all work in rural activities such as raising animals and selling them. They are determined woman who, despite their humble condition, struggle to be able to grow and get ahead. 

Hilda is one of the members of the committee. She is characterized by her charisma and hard work. She has a well-stocked store in which she works every day from very early in the morning. She is a very hard-working woman who little by little has made her way.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her store such as vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, and more, so to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, meat, baked goods, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, underwear, skirts, and other products.

loans.name: Blanca Guadalupe

texts.es:
invertir en la copra de: camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, faldas y otros productos más.
Blanca de 31 años de edad, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer que se dedica al comercio mediante la venta de artículos varios de primera necesidad para el hogar: como jabón, pasta para dientes, pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos, especias, entre otros productos más los cuales tiene en su tienda que está ubicada en su lugar de residencia. gracias a este negocio es como Blanca ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y suplir las necesidades del hogar, es por ello con el deseo de continuar invirtiendo en su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar una variedad de productos como: verduras, lácteos, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas, etc., para de esta manera incrementar su inventario que le permitan aumentar las ventas y generar mejores ganancias para poder así mejorar cada vez más sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Blanca is 31 years old, and lives with her family formed of her husband and their children. She is a woman who makes a living in commerce selling various essential items for the home: such as soap, toothpaste, bread, eggs, milk, basic grains, and spices, among other products which she has in her store that is located in her place of residence. Thanks to this business Blanca has managed to raise her family and meet the household needs. This is why she desires to continue investing in her business and is requesting this loan from Fusai to be able to purchase a variety of products such as: vegetables, dairy, meats, sweets, drinks, etc., for in this way she increases her inventory which enables her to increase her sales and generate better profits to be able to increasingly improve their living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, dairy, meats, sweets, drinks, etc., to increase her inventory of basic products.

loans.name: Plan B  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Plan B es un grupo formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse para mejorar sus negocios con los créditos por lo cual están muy contentos en el grupo, se reúnen en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Jessica, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad, el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la ciudad.
Doña Jessica es una joven  mujer muy trabajadora que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa, zapatos y productos Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a vender en las mañanas ya que a esa hora es más fresco y su hijo está en clases ya en la tarde ella tiene que ayudarlo a realizar sus tareas,  también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito  y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 5 años con esta actividad la cual le ha permitido ganar algo lo cual lo invierte en su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y todo de lo que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su  negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The Plan B loan group is a group formed of 11 women and 2 men who a while ago decided to get together to improve their businesses with the loans, for which they are very happy in the group. They meet in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited frequently all year round, for its cuisine and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

One of the members of this group is Jessica. She is 22 years old, married, and in this relationship has a 5-year-old son, who is a student. Her husband works in a factory in the city. 

Jessica is a very hard-working young woman who, to help her husband with the household expenses, works in sales. She sells clothing, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories). She sells from door to door. She goes out to sell in the mornings since at this time it is cooler and her son is in class and in the afternoon she has to help him do his homework. In addition, she sells from her house where her best known customers come. She leaves her products on credit and collects each week. She has been doing this work for over 5 years, which has allowed her to earn something which she invests in her son. 

This loan is to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and everything that she sells. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her with her business. Her dream is to give her little one the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Kanini Kaseo Self Helpgroup-Mamba

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Alice; she is a widow and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has been trained on enterprise development and financial management. She does goat keeping as her main economic activity.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more goats and feeds to expand her goat enterprise. She anticipates to get more income which will enable her cater for her basic needs by ensuring better food, medical care and assist in paying school fees for her grandchild.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promise to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale and earn more income for better medicare and school fees for her children

loans.name: Yaqueline Arely

texts.es: Yaqueline tiene 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos a los cuales trata de darles siempre lo mejor. Ella a diario se dedica desde hace un buen tiempo a la venta de verduras la cual la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales calles del mercado y sus alrededores, y es así como con las ganancias que obtiene de dicho negocio y la  ayuda monetaria que le brinda su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la albañilería  ella logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Yaqueline con el deseo de reparar el techo de su vivienda y mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita a FUSAI este crédito el cual invertirá en: lamina, polines y pines.
texts.en:
Yaqueline, age 25, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her life partner and their two children, and she always tries to give them the best. She has been selling vegetables every day for a good amount of time. She sells in an itinerant manner on the main streets of the market and surrounding areas. This is how, with the earnings she gets from her business and the help of her life partner, a bricklayer, she manages to pay for their household expenses.

Yaqueline wishes to repair the roof of her house and improve their living conditions. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy corrugated metal sheeting, beams, metal fasteners

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, and metal fasteners in order to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Karla Gertrudis

texts.es:
Karla es madre de 3 hijos, ella junto a su esposo han luchado por ofrecerle lo mejor de sí mismos a ellos. Por ello, decidió vender productos Avon para generar un ingreso extra en su hogar; sin embargo, esto no era suficiente para poder vivir cómodamente. Por esta razón, Karla comenzó a ahorrar las ganancias para poner una pulpería en su hogar; en la actualidad, gracias a estas entradas de dinero, han podido ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
No obstante, Karla solicita un crédito para comprar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras, gaseosas, golosinas, papel higiénico, detergentes, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá surtir su pulpería y ofrecerá todos los productos que sus clientes demandan, en consiguiente aumentaran sus ingresos y podrá ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla is the mother of 3 children. She, along with her husband, has struggled to offer the best of herself to them. For this, she decided to sell Avon products to generate extra income in the house. However, this was not enough to be able to live comfortably. For this reason, Karla began to save her earnings to establish a store in her home. Currently, thanks to this income, they have been able to offer their children a better future.

However, Karla asks for a loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, soft drinks, sweets, toilet paper, detergents, etc. This will be helpful for her because she will be able to stock her store and offer all the products that her customers want and then her income will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, vegetables, soft drinks, sweets, toilet paper, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with four children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sheilo Marie

texts.en:
Sheilo Marie is 25 years old and single.

Sheilo Marie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Sheilo Marie requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sheilo Marie has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sheilo Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is 57 years old and married.

Simeona is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Simeona has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Simeona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, de 60 años de edad, es comerciante de aretes y joyas, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo, su nuera y su nieto.

Guillermina, tiene muchos años de vender aretes y joyas, ella lo hace casa por casa y en los principales mercados del pueblo, tiene una clientela muy reconocida que le compran por la calidad de sus productos y su amabilidad.

Guillermina, necesita el crédito para comprar más aretes que están saliendo de moda, porque son solicitados por sus clientes.- Además, quiere comprar algunas joyas que tiene como encargo de dichos clientes. 

Ella sueña con colocar una pequeña joyería en el mercado del pueblo.
texts.en:
Guillermina, 60 years old, is an earring and jewelry saleswoman. She is a single mother and lives with her only son, her daughter-in-law and her grandson.

Guillermina has sold earrings and jewelry for many years. She does it house by house and in the principal markets of the town. She has a very well-known customer base which purchases from her due to the quality of her products and her friendliness.

Guillermina needs the loan to purchase more earrings that are becoming fashionable because they are requested by her customers. In addition, she wants to purchase some jewelry that she has ordered by these customers.

She dreams of establishing a small jewelry shop in the town market.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings that are becoming fashionable.

loans.name: Evelyn Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 25 años de edad, está casada, tiene un hijo y ella se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos salvadoreños.

Evelyn, tiene tres años de experiencia en la venta de platillos típicos salvadoreños, son muy demandados por sus clientes, debido a un toque culinario especial que ella posee.

Ella, necesita el crédito para compra una nueva cocina, para preparar los platillos con una mejor afinidad y calidad en los productos.

Evelyn, desea comprar un carretón para salir a vender por todo el pueblo y que sus platillos sean más reconocido y vendibles por los habitantes de diferentes lugares.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 25 years old, is married, has a child, and works selling traditional Salvadoran dishes.

Evelyn has three years of experience in the sale of traditional Salvadoran dishes. They are in high demand by her customers due to the special culinary touch she has. 

She needs the loan to purchase a new range to prepare the dishes with better consistency and quality of the products.
