Evelyn wants to purchase a cart to go out and sell throughout the town so that her dishes are more known and sellable to the residents in other places.

loans.use: to purchase a new range to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick’s father is a Vietnam veteran who sustained multiple injuries during the war. When Frederick first started taking care of him, he realized that there were few options available for individuals with disabilities to comfortably take baths and showers. He was inspired to come up with an invention to reduce the amount of effort required for showering. 

Five years in the making, Frederick has developed a shower tool that includes an automated soap applicator and a scrubbing system for all parts of the body. The tool also includes a hot air body dryer as an alternative to having to dry off with a towel. 

Frederick will use his Kiva loan to obtain a patent for his handy shower tool and to pay for the startup fee to work with an inventor service company.

loans.use: to purchase a patent and to pay for the startup fee to work with an inventor service company

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel, tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara,  junto a su hijo. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café. La producción de café la vende en café húmedo, seco o en uva en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y en limpieza de su cultivo de café, con el fin de que su finca produzca mejor esta próxima cosecha. Tiene como meta lograr solvencia económica y que la finca sea la herencia de su hijo.
texts.en: Don Migual is 47 years old, single, and lives in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara, together with his son. All of his life he has made a living in agriculture with the cultivation of corn, beans and coffee. The production of coffee he sells as wet coffee, dry, or in the grape in the local market. He has decided to request a loan for 10,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizers and cleaning for his cultivation of coffee, so that his farm can product better this next harvest. He has a goal to achieve economic solvency and that his farm is inherited by his son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cleaning for his cultivation of coffee.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bernadita is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Bernadita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Bernadita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Bernadita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Bernadita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Violeta dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Renalyn is in the aquaculture business, farming oysters in the Philippines. Renalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binder and other equipment to use in her oyster culture business.

Renalyn has been farming oysters for eight years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Renalyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binder and other equipment to use in her oyster cultivation.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and has one child who is in school. For the past 15 years, Susan has run a personal products business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of personal products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of personal products to sell

loans.name: Denis Noe Antonio

texts.es:
Denis, de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador desde su infancia, está acompañado y tiene solo una hija.

Denis, anteriormente vendía granos básicos, pero ahora no solo vende eso, sino también vende ganado, cerdos y pollos. 

El necesita el préstamo para comprar más ganado, cerdos y granos básicos para la venta, porque conoce muy bien el mercado y es por ello que va a invertir más.

Sueña con darle a su hija todo lo que necesita para que estudie.
texts.en:
Denis, 27 years old, has been a very hard-working young man since his childhood. His is partnered and only has one daughter. 

Denis previously sold basic grains but now he sells not only this but also cattle, pigs and chickens.

He needs the loan to purchase more cattle, pigs and basic grains to sell, because he knows his market very well and for this he wants to invest more.

He dreams of giving his daughter everything she needs in order to get an education.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle, pigs, and basic grains to sell.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, de 25 años de edad, es un joven dedicado a apoyar a sus padres, porque ya son bastante mayores, se dedica a la agricultura por herencia de sus padres.

Walter, tiene más de 10 años de sembrar granos básicos con su padre, pero este año por la vejez de su padre, se ha dedicado solo él, para que la familia siga manteniendo la experiencia en las cosechas.

Walter, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, para preparar las tierras y darles mantenimiento adecuado para lograr una cosecha exitosa.

Walter, desea comprar una vaca, para engordarla y cuidarla para obtener una buena producción de leche.
texts.en:
Walter, 25 years old, is a young man dedicated to supporting his parents because they are now rather old. He works in agricultural by legacy of his parents.

Walter has more than 10 years of experience growing basic grains with his father but, this year, due to his father's advanced age, he works alone so that his family continues maintaining the experience of the harvests.

Walter needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to prepare the land and give it adequate care to have a successful harvest. 

Walter wants to purchase a cow to fatten it and care for it to have good milk production.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to prepare the land and give it adequate care to have a successful harvest.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, tiene tres hijos de 3, 5 y 7 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a vender verduras al igual que ella.

Maribel, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un carro, se han dedicado a este negocio junto a su esposo desde hace 5 años, decidieron dedicarse a este negocio, porque su esposo compro un carro y decidieron dedicarse a este negocio para desplazarse en el vehículo por los pueblos y el horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

Maribel, necesita el crédito para comprar verduras al por mayor e incrementar el capital de trabajo, ella piensa colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Los sueños de Maribel son, poder ampliar el negocio y poner una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 29, went to school through the sixth grade. She has three children; ages three, five, and seven. Her husband sells vegetables like she does. Maribel sells vegetables from a car. She has been in this business with her husband for five years. They decided to devote themselves to this business because her husband bought a car. They decided to work in this business in order to travel to towns in the vehicle. The schedules is from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

Maribel needs the loan to buy vegetables wholesale and to increase her working capital. She is planning on establishing a small store at her house. Maribel's dreams are to be able to expand the business and to set up a store at her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Jackson Alejandro

texts.es: Jackson, tiene 20 años de edad, esta soltero vive con su madre en una aldea de las Mercedes, Lempira. El inició con su propio negocio de cultivo de café hace 5 años y tuvo anteriormente también una mototaxi para transporte de personas. Su fuente de ingresos actualmente es la producción de café el cual vende en la misma zona y ayuda a su familia. El préstamo que solicita es por 3,000 lempiras para comprar abono y aplicarle a su finca de café, para obtener buena cosecha. Su plan es seguir ampliando el cultivo para el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Jackson is 20 years old and single. He lives with his mother in a village in Las Mercedes, Lempira.

He started his own coffee-growing business five years ago but previously had a motorcycle taxi to transport passengers.

Jackson's current income comes from growing coffee, which he sells locally and uses profits to help his family.

He is applying for a loan of 3000 Lempira in order to buy manure to apply to his coffee plantation and thus grow a good harvest.

Jackson's dream is to continue expanding his coffee crops for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy manure to apply to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio de 64 años de edad, habita en casa propia  a lado de su compañera de vida con quien llevan muchos años juntos. Él es un hombre muy dedicado y trabajador quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa ubicada en las cercanías de su vivienda, y es de esta manera como el obtiene los ingresos que le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su familia, además su esposa se dedica a la venta de pollos. Gregorio es un hombre que siempre busca una estabilidad en su hogar es por ello que al mismo con el motivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y gozar de un hogar más digno el ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de los materiales como: lamina, polines, pines y pago de mano de obra para poder de esta manera reparar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriores.
texts.en: Gregorio, 64 years old, lives in his own house alongside his life partner with whom he has been for many years. His a very dedicated and hard-working man who works as a security guard in a business located near his home. This is how he gets income which allows him to bring the daily bread to his family. In addition, his partner works selling chickens. Gregorio is a man who always seeks stability in his home. It is for this and also with the desire to improve his living conditions and enjoy a more dignified home that he has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to purchase materials such as metal sheeting, beams, pins and to pay labor costs to be able to repair the roof on his house, which is deteriorated.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, beams, pins and pay labor costs to be able to repair the roof on his house.

loans.name: Roiser

texts.es:
Roiser tiene 32 años de edad, vive con conyuge y un hijo de 2 años, vive en casa propia de material rustico ubicada en el C.P.M Condorhuasi ; es nacido y criado en C.P.M Condorhuasi, distrito Pimpingos, Provincia de Cutervo, Region Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Roiser es la venta de repuestos automotrises y mantenimiento de motos, actividad la realiza en su propia casa, actividad la realiza hace 1 año, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, porque anteriormente trabajo en un taller mecanico en la ciudad de Jaen. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros). El destino del crédito es para capital de trabajo, compra de repuestos, y de esta manera incrementar su inventario,todo esto se vera reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Roiser is 32 years old, lives with his spouse and a 2-year-old child. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials located in C.P.M. Condorhuasi. He was born and raised in C.P.M. Condorhuasi, Pimpingos dsitrict, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

The work that Roiser does is selling car parts and repairing motorcycles, work he does in his own house, and which he has done for 1 year. He has experience in the field because before he worked in a mechanic shop in the city of Jaen. In addition, he works raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and more). The loan will be used as working capital, to purchase spare parts and in this way increase his inventory, all this will be reflected in a larger volume of sales with the end of getting more income so to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and in this way increase his stock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a sari-sari store owner from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells batteries, toiletries, and school supplies like packaging tape, pens, paper and notebooks. 

Gloria is a 52-year-old woman and was blessed with a five-year-old son. Her husband is a fisherman and runs a passenger boat. Gloria is aiming to increase their income so she can buy another boat for passengers. 

She is asking a loan of PHP15,000 to buy additional school supplies and to buy plywood, paint and a new machine for their boat.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, plywood, paint and a new machine.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leslie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from running a coffee shop. Leslie has been sustaining her business activities through her four previous loans through NWTF.

Leslie is requesting a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Emily Pearl

texts.en:
Emily Pearl is married and runs a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been running her business for the past 10 years and she works hard to support her family.

Emily Pearl is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a fishing  business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Carmen has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net, gasoline and wood.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a food vending business.

Marissa dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Morena works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ma. Morena is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more coffee for her cafeteria business.

Ma. Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita works hard to support her family. Tita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline.

Tita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Tita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jona works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jona is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lorly

texts.en:
Lorly works hard to support her family. Lorly is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

Lorly has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lorly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area village of Kampong Cham province, Phea is 37-year-old and a mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and another one is too young to attend school. To support her livelihood, she has been doing rice farming for nineteen years. Her crops do not grow well and get low yields and this is the main challenge for her business. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and she has repaid her past loan completely. Her previous loan has helped her to improve her family’s lifestyle. She is now leading a group of three members to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is very thankful to Kiva for her previous 50,000 PHP loan that was granted to her to buy five sets of desktop computers and peripherals for the computer shop she has set-up in front of her house. Through today, Corazon’s computer shop has been doing well, with growing customers especially students who are working on research and printouts. She has one employee to operate her shop while she tends to her grocery store. For Corazon, the loan extended to her by Kiva not only gave her the chance to have an additional business but it also the increased her income and made it possible to employ a neighbor from her community. 

Corazon is requesting a 100,000 PHP loan to buy 20 sacks of rice, 50 boxes of noodles, 10 boxes of coffee, 25 boxes of laundry soap and powder, and other items to sell in her grocery store. She wants to restock her store and the item most in demand is rice. This will be her second loan. Corazon wants to maintain her growing business to save money for the future of her children and also to continuously help her neighbors through employment.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, coffee, laundry soap, and other grocery items

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene has been a taxi driver for over 30 years and needs a loan to do maintenance on his vehicle.  He has two adult sons who lives elsewhere with their families.  He owns his house, where the photo of him was taken.

In the future he would like to buy a new vehicle to continue doing his job.   He hopes that you can help him again.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Jacinta Susana

texts.es:
En el Barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta, conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Amazonas De Cuba.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacinta, tiene 60 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Jacinta es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, ella desde hace diez años tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale uno o dos días a la semana pero la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, de esta forma ella siempre se ha ganado algo por su cuenta que los han sacado de muchos apuros en tiempos que su marido no tenía trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva más de 5 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es tener un lindo almacén.
texts.en:
The credit group Amazonas de Cuba meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of Cuba in the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches, which are well visited all year round by national and international tourists and for having one of the most important ports in the country and America.

Jacinta lives in this place. She is 60 years old, lives in with her partner and has four adult and independent children from this relationship. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Jacinta is a woman who always liked to work. She has had her business of selling shoes for ten years and sells by going from door to door. She does this one or two days a week, but makes most of her sales from her home. This way she has always been able to earn something on her own which solved a lot of difficulties in times when her husband did not have work.

This loan is to buy shoes and sandals, because she has several orders. She has been in the credit group for more than five years and likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to own a lovely story.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Nestor Alejandro

texts.es:
En el Barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta, conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Amazonas De Cuba.
En este lugar vive el señor Néstor, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo de dos años que depende de él pero vive con la madre. 
Don Néstor es un hombre muy trabajador para darle lo necesario a su pequeño, el trabaja en una imprenta de la ciudad desde hace muchos años y recibe un sueldo mensual, pero él además de esto en su casa esta adecuando poco a poco una imprenta, el ya cuenta con ciertas maquinarias que le permiten realizar trabajos de forma independiente y le están dejando buenas ganancias, el elabora facturas, fichas y otros trabajos que sus clientes le piden, lleva más de 10 años trabajando en esta actividad pero con su negocio propio poco tiempo, el espera con la ayuda de los créditos comprar más maquinas que necesita y algún día tener su propia imprenta.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar hojas de papel, tinta y herramientas que necesita. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su propia imprenta.
texts.en:
In the Cuba neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited every season of the year by local and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports of the country and America, the Amazonas de Cuba Credit Group meets every 15 days. 

Néstor lives in this place. He is 32 years old, unmarried, and has a two-year-old son who depends on him but lives with the mother.

Néstor works hard to give what is necessary to his little one. He has worked in a print shop of the city for many years, and he receives a monthly salary, but in addition to this, little by little, he is creating a print shop in his house. Now that he has certain equipment that allow him to do independent projects that give him a good income. He prints invoices, cards, and other projects his customers ask him for. He has been doing this work for more than 10 years, but has spent very little time with his own business. He hopes that with the help of the loan he can buy more equipment that he needs and one day have his own print shop.

This loan will be used to buy sheets of paper, ink, and tools that he needs. He has been with the Credit Group for 4 cycles, and he likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful. His dream is to have his own print shop.

loans.use: to buy sheets of paper, ink, and tools.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Daisy is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Daisy has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bernadeth works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling crabs and selling rice and dry goods.  Bernadeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Bernadeth is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, and other products for her general store. She successfully repaid her previous loans. Bernadeth hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, noodles, and other products for her general store

loans.name: Laguenia

texts.en:
Laguenia is 61 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Laguenia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Laguenia has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for one year. 

In the future Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 45 years old, and one of her children is in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish and crabs to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish and crabs to sell

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najima is a 40-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of six children.
Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes he has to go out of city also. 
He has gotten a new contract for whitewash and oil paint of newly constructed house but he has no paint brush or rollers for providing services.

Najima has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.
His savings are very poor that is why he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc. for her husband's whitewash services.

loans.name: Domingo German

texts.es: Don Domingo, tiene 47 años de edad, esta soltero y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Ocotepeque, cerca al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la carpintería y hace 10 años decidió por dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijoles para la venta y consumo de su familia. Estos productos los vende en el mercado de la zona y es su fuente de ingresos. El prestamo que esta solicitando es por 7,000 lempiras para comprar abono y aplicarle al cultivo de maíz y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es cultivar más café y ser un gran caficultor para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Domingo is 47 years old, single, and lives in a village in the municipality of San Marcos Ocotepeque, near the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. Previously he worked in carpentry and 10 years ago he decided to work growing corn and beans to sell and for family consumption. These products he sells in the market in the zone and it is his source of income. The loan that he is asking for is to for 7,000 lempiras to purchase manure and apply it to the corn crop and be able to get a better harvest. His plan is to grow more coffee and be a great coffee producer to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and apply it to his corn crop.

loans.name: Oracio

texts.es: Oracio, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de Nueva, Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y últimamente al café que es la fuente de ingresos mayor. Esta producción de café la vende en pergamino, húmedo, en uva  y seco según se lo pidan. Ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago por limpieza de la finca de café, va ser de gran ayuda para darle buena asistencia al cultivo y sacar mejor producción. Su meta es seguir cultivando café para vender más y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Oracio is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives with his wife and children in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For over 20 years, he has worked growing basic grains and, recently, coffee which is his greatest source of income. He sells this coffee production in parchment, humid, in the berry or dry, as it is asked of him. He has decided to ask for a loan of 8,000 lempiras to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding of the coffee plantation. It will be a big help to give good assistance to the crop and get better production. His goal is to continue growing coffee to sell more and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín tiene 51 años, es un agricultor de la comunidad de Olanchito en Honduras vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde muy joven y también trabaja como capataz en una Finca lo cual le ayuda para el sustento  de su familia. Él sabe por experiencia lo bueno que es para él y su familia el uso de un  sistema solar, pues hace unos años  adquirió uno, esto le ayudo muchísimo ya que al ser energía limpia, ya no tenían problemas de salud los que son frecuentes cuando se ilumina con velas y lámparas a base de kerosén. Pero al pasar el tiempo se dañó la batería, uno de los componentes esenciales para el perfecto funcionamiento del sistema solar, por lo que Benjamín tuvo forzosamente que volver a adquirir velas y demás implementos para iluminación tradicional. Es por esta razón que está  solicitando un  préstamo a Soluz Honduras para la compra de la batería y el controlador para rehabilitar su sistema solar y que vuelva a darle la funcionalidad acostumbrada.
texts.en: Benjamín is 51 years old, is a farmer in the community of Olanchito in Honduras and lives with his wife and their three children. He has worked growing basic grains since he was very young and also works as a foreman on a farm which helps him support his family. He knows from experience how good the use of a solar electrical system is for him and his family since some years ago he got one. This helped him a lot since being clean energy they didn't have health problems anymore that were frequent when they used candles and kerosene lamps. But, with the passing of time, the battery was damaged, one of the essential parts for the perfect functioning of the solar electrical system, so Benjamín was forced to return to getting candles and in other things for traditional lighting. For this reason, he is asking for a loan from Soluz Honduras to purchase the battery and controller to fix the solar electrical system so it goes back to its accustomed functionality.

loans.use: to purchase a sustainable package (battery and controller) to reactivate the solar electrical system in his home.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Nhor is 55 years old living in Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of five children. Nowadays, she does rice farming as the main source of her family’s income. Meanwhile, she is also working for others for a fee to earn additional income. She has been involved in her job for thirty-seven years. The crops do not grow well, which is the problem for her business. 

She has never been with VisionFund before, and now she has decided to take this first Kiva loan. As the leader of four members, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a 40-year-old rice farmer with four children, who resides in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 2010. Her husband is a 41-year-old electrician and three of her four children are in school. 

Both Thea and her husband make approximately USD13 each day. Now she would like a loan because she is lacking the funds to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for rice farming. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for rice farming.

loans.name: Gift Kitunda Group

texts.en:
John, who in his mid 20s is married with one small child.  He has been growing and selling chicken for seven years now.  He works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be John's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds for his poultry business. He dreams of extending his business to be really big and popular.

He will share this loan with his loan group  GIFT KITUNDA which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds for his poultry business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucy is 23 years old. She is married and they have one child. She sells cosmetics and has been in business for two years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics for sale. She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her child. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 54 years old lady. She is married and has five children. She rears poultry and has been in the business for 10 years. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase chicken feeds for improved egg production. 

She will use the profit from her business to cater for family health and clothing as well as increase her savings account. Her hopes and dreams for the future is to big a big poultry farmer and buy incubator to sell chicks on top of grown chicken.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed to improve egg production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 55 years old.He has 2 children to support,he has been in the business for the last 10 years and the business has been earning him an income of KES 30,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds and add a dairy cow for milk production for sell to his clients.

He plans to use the gained profit to repay his loan and the surplus to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and add a dairy cow for milk production for sell to his clients.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 61 years old. She is married and they have two children. She operates a hair salon and has been in business for two years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to buy salon equipment. 

She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more produce of beans and maize for selling

loans.name: Bosco

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Bosco, tiene 53 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor tiene un negocio en su casa con el cual toda la vida a sacado adelante  a su familia, el es joyero y desde hace mas de 30 años se dedicas a la elaboración y reparación de todo tipo de joyas hechas en oro o plata, el viaja a Cuenca a comprar plata para luego ir a su taller y elaborar cadenas, anillos, aretes en muchos diseños, luego el exhibe en una vitrina que tiene en el lugar para la venta al público, allí mismo el también realiza arreglos y retoques en las joyas que sus clientes le lleven cuando necesitan de algún arreglo, su trabajo es muy apreciado por su distinguida clientela y de esta forma que se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar plata, oro y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar las joyas. Es fundador del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su  familia.
texts.en:
The El Nuevo Paraíso loan group meets every two weeks in the El Paraíso neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited frequently all year round  and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Bosco lives in this place. He is 53 years old, married, and in this relationship has two adult children. One of them still lives in his house. His wife is a homemaker.

This gentleman has a business in his house with which he has gotten his family ahead his whole life. He is a jeweler and for over 30 years has worked in making and repairing all sorts of jewelry made of gold and silver. He travels to Cuenca to purchase silver to later go to his shop and make chains, rings, many designs of earrings, and then shows them in a display case in the place for sale to the public. There he also makes repairs and retouches jewelry that his customers bring him when they need a repair. His work is very appreciated by his distinguished customers and in this way he earns his living.

This loan is to purchase silver, gold, and other materials necessary to make the jewelry. He is a founding member of the loan group and he likes it because the loans are quick and helpful. His dream is to give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase silver, gold and other materials.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 13  y 7 años de edad, todos estudian en un centro superior, colegio y escuela. Su marido  es electricista.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en una empresa atunera en la ciudad, pero para obtener mejores recursos también se dedica al comercio, ella  vende productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella vende en sus ratos y días libres y también a sus compañeras de trabajo ya que ellas son sus mejores clientes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a sus ventas lo cual le permite ganar algo extra por el bien  de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The El Nuevo Paraíso loan group meets every two weeks in the El Paraíso neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited frequently all year round  and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

María lives in this place. She is 40 years old, married, and in this relationship has three children, ages 18, 13 and 7, all of whom are students in a center of higher education, secondary school and primary school. Her husband is an electrician.

María is a woman who likes to earn her own income and, with this, contribute to the household expenses. She works from Monday to Friday at a tuna business in the city, but to get more income, she also works in sales. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories). She sells in her free time and her days off and also to her coworkers since they are her best customers. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week or two. She has been working in sales for over 5 years, which has allowed her to earn something extra for the good of her family.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. She is a founding member of the loan group and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she gets ahead. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
A local resident living in Dambae district of the Kampong Cham province, Chanty is 48 years old and a mother of four children. For her family’s living, she grows cassava on a four-hectares area as the single main source of her income. Her income was decreased because her cassava did not grow well.

For Chanty, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her cassava farm.

She hopes that her cassava can produce a good yield with a good income so she can improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Sainte Famille Group

texts.fr: Salimata est âgée de 39 ans. Vendeuses depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans l’activité et sa popularité dans la zone de commerce, la qualité  de sa marchandise et le bon emplacement de son lieu de commerce sont pour elle un atout pour réussir son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter du Maïs, mil, petit mil…) en quantité pour revendre. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 8 fois et a rembourser aux dates prévues, elle est une bonne cliente pour ACFIME.
texts.en:
Salimata is 39 years old and has been working as a vendor for over 10 years. Her experience and her loyal customer base in the commercial district, the quality of her goods and a good location of her sales stand contribute to the success of her business. 

Salimata is seeking this loan to stock up large quantities of  corn, millet, pearl millet etc for resale. She already received eight loans in the past and repaid all of them on time. She has been a good client of AFCIME.

loans.use: to buy corn, millet and pearl millet for resale.

loans.name: Santos Mardoqueo

texts.es: Santos es un hombre de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su madre que es una mujer de 60 años de edad a la que se siente feliz de apoyar en su vejez. Santos se gana la vida como vendedor de pan de forma ambulante, además se dedica a la pesca artesanal, lo que le permite siempre llevar el sustento a su hogar. Santos anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda, pero no logro terminarlo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, grava y hierro para terminar de construir el cuarto en su vivienda para brindar mayor comodidad a su madre.
texts.en: Santos is a 37-year-old man who lives with his mother who is a 60-year-old woman and whom he is happy to support in her old age. Santos earns his living selling bread as a street vendor in addition to working in traditional fishing, which allows him to bring sustenance to his home. Santos previously asked for a loan which he invested in building a room on his house but he wasn't able to finish it so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in brick, cement, gravel, and metal to finish building the room on his house to offer his mother more comfort.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, gravel and metal to finish building a room on his house and to offer his mother more comfort.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija mayor de edad y su nieta de 19 años de edad, la hija trabaja y ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Margarita se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado desde hace diez años, y las ventas de su  negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en su comunidad y sus alrededores, posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y al amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender. Margarita está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito para la compra de más ropa y calzado por mayor para surtir con más mercadería su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancia y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado ella invertirá en: faldas, blusas, ropa interior, sandalias, zapato cerrados para dama, etc.
texts.en: Margarita, 63 years old, lives in her own house with her adult daughter and her 19-year-old granddaughter. Her daughter works and helps with the household expenses. Margarita has worked selling clothing and shoes for the past ten years and she makes the sales as a street vendor in her community and in surrounding areas. She has many customers due to her good prices and her friendliness when selling. Margarita is asking FUSAI for a loan to purchase more clothing and footwear in bulk to stock her business's merchandise more and, so, to get more income and give her family a more stable economy without any limitations. For this reason, with the requested amount, she will invest in skirts, blouses, lingerie, sandals, close-toed shoes for women, etc.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, blouses, lingerie, sandals, closed-toe shoes for women, etc.

loans.name: Jazmin Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jazmín,  tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 8 años de edad, el menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.
Doña Jazmín es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y sabanas, ella sale a visitar a sus clientes uno o dos días a la semana aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, tiene mucha clientela ya que les da crédito y cobrar cada 8 o 15 días. Lleva más de 8 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y sabanas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y su  familia.
texts.en:
The El Nuevo Paraíso loan group meets every two weeks in the El Paraíso neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited frequently all year round  and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions. 

Jazmín lives in this place. She is 39 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, ages 19 and 8. The younger one is in primary school. Her husband works in a factory in the area.

Jazmín is a homemaker who, to earn her own income and with this to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and their children's education, works selling all sorts of clothing, sandals and sheets. She goes out to visit her customers one or two days per week although the majority of her sales she makes in her own home. She has many customers since she leaves the products on credit and collects every week or two. She has had this business for more than 8 years, which allows her to earn her own income.

This loan is to purchase clothing, sandals, and sheets, since she has many orders. She has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she finances her business. Her dream is to give her children and her family the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, sandals, and sheets.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gear and other fishing materials.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gear and other fishing materials

loans.name: Hector Mario

texts.en:
Héctor is just 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Cañasgordas, Antioquia. He has a son who is just 1 years old, and is the reason he decided to dedicate more to his business so it can grow and give him and his family everything that they need. He owns a store where he sells motorcycles parts and he repairs them too, so it’s an added value that he gives to his clients.

The new responsibilities that have arrived to his life have made him change the way he used to manage his business; now he feels a big need to improve and make it more successful and recognized, so it can attract clients and let the business last over time. This is the main reason why he asked for a loan, to buy inputs for his store and some tools that he needs.

Although Héctor is really young, now he has a family on his own, and he’s aware of the responsibility that he has, so he wants to give the best by working really hard. He dreams of being able to give them a house where they can live comfortable and be protected. He’s just a loan away to start building this dream, so help him and be part of this beautiful story of life.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his store and some tools

loans.name: Nohemy Isabel

texts.en:
Nohemy is 40 years old and lives in Envigado, a municipality located at the south of Medellín. She has had a business since 2009 that she started by herself because she loves working on her own. She raises cattle and especially pigs. She has found some problems doing her job because the inputs are really expensive.

Nohemy wants to improve her sales and increase her profits. To do so, she’s aware that she has to not only work really hard but also invest in the business so it grows and gets more successful. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs and some food for them. 

Nohemy has big dreams. She’s a strong woman that wants to be successful, and as a mother, she knows that her children are the most important thing. That’s why she hopes she can pay for her children's education because, for her, that’s the best thing she can do for her family. Help Nahomy with a loan and get her closer to her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields so they will produce good yields.

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en:
Rorn is 47 years old, living in a remote area village of Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of three dependent children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income to support her living conditions. She has been involved in these businesses for 29 years.

Drought and insects have destroyed her crops; these are the main challenges for her business. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six cycles and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. The previous loans helped her to have consumption to support her family condition.

Lacking funds, Rorn and her group member decide to request a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR for each. As the leader, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farmland and increase the productivity of her crop yields.

She hopes that this loan will help her to gain a timely, high yield to get more income to upgrade her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees to support her farmland and increase productivity of her crop yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sary is 50 years old and a mother of three children. To support her family’s living, she grows rice on a one-hectare area. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved this business for ages, and she can save, with her daily income, about 23,900 KHR per day.

For Sary, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. The previous loans have helped her to improve her lifestyle as well.

She leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for support her rice farm.

She hopes that this loan can help her to gain high yields to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Srey Roth's Group

texts.en:
Srey Roth, 22, is a young woman living in a remote area village of Kampong Cham province. For her living, she does rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to get extra income. She has been involved in her business for four years. 

Her rice has been destroyed by insects and it is a problem because her rice does not grow well. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the previous loan, she was able to get more income to improve her living conditions so they became better than before. 

In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to ensure her farmland will produce a good yield. She hopes that this loan can help her to get more income in order to expand her current business so it is better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed so her farmland will produce a good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: YACOUBA est celui qui  tient le bœuf par la corde aux cornes. YACOUBA est un emboucheur malien, courageux et dévoué. Il exerce cette activité il y a deux(02) ans. YACOUBA est marié, père de quatorze(14) enfants (07 Garçons et 07 Filles) dont trois(03) Filles et un(01) Garçon scolarisés ; et leurs âges sont entre cinq(05) à vingt-trois (23) ans. YACOUBA n’est pas instruit ; sa Femme fait la même activité aussi que lui. De nos jours YACOUBA a 46 ans. Il fait recourt à IMF parce pour acheter de bœufs et béliers.  Il s’approvisionne dans les milieux un peu reculés et vent dans sa localité. YACOUBA  achète des bœufs et béliers, les engraisse pour la vente. Son espoir pour l’avenir est  d’avoir une construction en dur et la réussite de ses enfants à l’école, cela est  sa préoccupation.
texts.en:
Yacouba is the one who is holding the cow by the rope around its horns. He is an emboucheur from Mali, hard-working and selfless. He has been in his business for two years.

Yacouba is married, the father of 14 children (7 sons and 7 daughters) of whom three girls and one boy are enrolled in school. Their ages are between 5 years old and 23 years old.

Yacouba did not get an education. His wife is in the same business as he is. At present, Yacouba is 46 years old. He has come to the microfinance institution to buy some cattle and rams. He buys his animals in the back-country and resells where he lives. He buys cattle and rams and fattens them before resale. His hope for the future is to have a permanent building for his house and to see his children succeed at school. Those are his main concerns.

loans.use: to buy animals for resale.

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en: Nazma is 30 years old. She is a responsible mother of one daughter. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of three persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching, and she provides stitching services to people at her house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Nazma requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, which issued her a loan. Nazma is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a 51-year-old civil servant with a child in her care. She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She and her husband, who is 55 years old, have fattened pigs and produced rice alcohol to sell since 1985, earning USD20 a day.

Sophal is lacking the money to buy pig feed for her pigs, so she would like to take out a loan. This loan will help her have enough funds to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finances.

In the future, she hopes to expand her pig fattening.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sockets, lamps, electric cables and more to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. Anita is married and has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill.

Anita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, is 43 years old, and a mother of three dependent children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in these businesses for 13 years and she can save, from her daily income, about 31,700 KHR per day.

This in not Chreb's this is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. Her previous loans earned her a good income to update her family's living conditions.

Now she is applying for a new loan of 3,000,000KHR. She will use her entire loan to buy a decent motorbike to drive to work so she will arrive on time. She hopes that she can get to work on time, so she can get more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to drive her to work on time.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en: Allah Rakhi, 45, is a house wife and mother of five children. Allah Rakhi is an optimistic lady, and she has full trust in her husband's capabilities. Her husband is also a hard working man, and he has a fruit shop in a nearby market with a great number of customers. All that he earns goes to the expenses of the family. He wants to renovate his fruit shop and to buy more fruit for reselling. Allah Rakhi applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR so that her husband can pursue what he has decided for his business. Allah Rakhi is thankful towards the KIVA team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to renovate her husband's fruit shop and to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a responsible mother of four children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been a taxi driver for the past five years and is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. Rukhsana’s husband needs to maintain his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires maintenance on a daily basis.  Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. 

Rukhsana is requesting a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan to maintain her husband’s taxi. Her loan will improve her husband’s business and increase her family’s profitable income. Rukhsana plans to save the profits from her husband’s business to meet her family's needs in future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married. With three children who are in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, etc.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Serghei

texts.en:
Serghei is a 20-year-old farmer from Buciumeni village, Ungheni region in Moldova. He is celibate. His mother is a widow and is disabled. Serghei supports his younger sister who is 14 years old. He takes care of his little farm and also occasionally works in Russia as a constructor.  

Serghei raises cereals on his one hectare of land, and also raises cows, pigs, chickens and one horse. Despite his young age he is serious and motivated.  Serghei wants to develop his farm to provide for his family’s needs, and be self employed and sell his own products.

Serghei will use the loan to buy animals and to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy animals and to repair his house.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 38-year-old woman who is a mother with two sons and one daughter. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Parveen is a housewife who looks after her family at home. Her husband provides construction services and makes shutters for buildings. Parveen’s husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding accessories, and iron rods and sheets to make shutters. 

Parveen is requesting a loan to buy materials for her husband’s manufacturing business. She will use her loan to help her husband generate more income to financially support their family. Parveen is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's manufacturing business

loans.name: Fidous

texts.en:
Fidous, a housewife, is need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant. 

Fidous is blessed with three children, and she aims at getting them educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture that can be bifurcated into tables and chairs, groceries that can be further divided into vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

Hence, this loan is pivotal for Fidous as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture and food items for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 40-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Rukhsana has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years; she also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e., creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Rukhsana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home. Her husband has been running a small printing press business for three years. Flex is a sheet of polythene widely used to deliver high quality digital print for outdoor boards and banners mainly printed by large color plotters. These prints are used instead of handwritten banners for their low cost and durability. He prints advertisement banners and logos on order. 

He wants to increase his current business but he does not have sufficient amount to buy more raw materials for his printing press and advertisement business. Therefore his wife, Shaheen, requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Shaheen is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more raw material for her husband's printing press and advertisement business

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is 33 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. Rashida’s husband wants to increase his business by purchasing a sewing machine and a variety of materials for his shop including threads, needles, cloth, and other items. This is very important for him to continue to work efficiently and professionally, but, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to make these purchases. 

Rashida is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine, needles, thread, and fabric to help her husband. She is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with her loan. Rashida is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, needles, thread, and fabric to help her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw material for sewing bags at home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак простая женщина из района Носири Хусрав. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Её муж занимается сельским хозяйством, а сама Муборак растениеводством. Муборак очень любит трудиться и рада, что своим ремеслом может помогать своей семье. Её дети любят и гордятся ей, так как, несмотря на трудности, их мать старается, чтобы они получили хорошее образование и выросли хорошими людьми. Муборак сейчас очень нуждается в кредите, так как для обработки посева и получение хорошего урожая, ей необходимо купить минеральные удобрения. Она надеется, что ей не откажут в помощи.
texts.en:
Muborak is a simple woman from the Nosiri Khusrav region. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in farming and she works in agriculture. She loves to work and is happy that her trade can help her family. Her children love her and are proud of her since, despite all difficulties, their mother tries to give them a good education so they will grow up to be good people.

Muborak is in great need of a loan, since she needs to buy mineral fertilizers to work into the soil so she receives a good harvest. She hopes that you will offer her support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 50-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has four daughters, ages 23, 21, 14 and 12 years old.

Leonila and her husband both sell fish. They work together to earn a living.

Leonila is asking a loan to buy more fish to sell and to buy a weighing scale for her business. She also asks a loan to buy food for consumption and for the school fees of her children.

Leonila’s dream is to increase her livelihood and to send all her children to school to get a degree.

loans.use: to buy fish, a weighing scale, food and school fees.

loans.name: Danny Monserrate

texts.es:
En el Barrio Cuba de la ciudad de  Manta, conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Amazonas De Cuba.
En este lugar vive la señora Danny, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres  hijos de 15, 14 y 11 años de edad, las mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa de seguridad.
Doña Danny es una mujer muy buena y trabajadora que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana y no cuenta con horarios fijos, en ocasiones su hija mayor la acompaña, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días, lleva más de 7 años con esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas y otras prendas sobretodo las que están de moda. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su  negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the loan group Amazonas De Cuba meets in the Cuba neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are heavily frequented by local and foreign tourists throughout the year, as well as for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America. Here is where Ms. Danny lives. She is 40 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children that are 15, 14 and 11 years old. The older two are studying in secondary school and the younger one in primary school. Her spouse works in a security company.
Ms. Danny is a kind and hard-working woman, who, in order to help her husband with their living expenses, works in commerce. She sells clothes of all kinds. Her form of business is door-to-door service. She works three to four days a week without a fixed schedule. Occasionally, her oldest daughter accompanies her. She sells on credit and gets paid every 8 to 15 days. For over 7 years she has been working in this business, which has provided her with a good income.
This loan is to buy trousers, shirts and other items of clothing, especially those that are in fashion. She has been part of the loan group for 7 years and she enjoys it because the loans help her in her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 22 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, personal care products, etc..

Annaliza has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling souvenir items.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and bamboo for her fishing business.

Belinda has been in this business for 4 years. Belinda earns more income from buy and sell process foods.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 51 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Clarissa has been in this business for one year.

In the future Clarissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 41, lives with family members in a rural village of Kandal province and is a mother of three children. Nowadays, she needs to support two schoolchildren. She earns income to improve her living conditions by rice cropping and duck raising to get more income. She has been involved this business for 21 years.

Drought and insects have destroyed her crops, which are the main problems in her business. This is not Sothea's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. Her past loan has earned her good income and decent household supplies.

She will use her loan portion in order to buy more ducks to support her duck raising. She hopes that this loan can help her get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to support on her duck raising business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: NANA est celle qui tient les habits .Elle est  commerçante malienne, mariée et  mère de deux enfants (un Garçon et une Fille) scolarisés dont leurs âges est   six(06) à neuf(09) ans. NANA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. De nos jours NANA a 37 ans. Son mari  aussi, un commerçant des céréales  l’aide très bien dans cette activité. Elle fait recourt à IMF  pour acheter beaucoup d’ habits. Elle fait ses achats d’habits prêts à porter en balle, des  voiles de chambre et des colliers  dans certains continents limitrophes  du Mali ; Elle effectue sa vente dans les marchés de la localité, soit par détaille ou la livraison à domicile. Selon l’avantage de son activité, NANA  aide son mari à prendre les charges de la famille et en préparant l’avenir de leurs deux(02) enfants. Elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela six(06) ans. La vente et le paiement immédiat de ses marchandises après l’approvisionnement  font son  plaisir. Elle espérerait construire en dure dans les jours à venir et la réussite des études de leurs enfants.   De nos jours, elle n’aurait  subi aucune influence du prêt sur son activité, sur sa vie personnelle ou celle de sa famille. Par contre elle se heurtait souvent aux charges que l’imposaient les autorités routières  lors de la traverse des frontières. NANA  souhaiterait investir pour sa nouvelle boutique de vente d’habits.
texts.en:
Nana is the woman who is holding the clothing. She is a small-scale retailer from Mali. She is married and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter), enrolled in school, whose ages are 6 and 9 years old. Nana did not have the good fortune to receive an education. At present she is 37 years old. Her husband sells cereals and helps her in her activity. She came to the microfinance institution to buy a lot of clothing to sell.

Nana buys ready-to-wear clothing by the bale, as well as curtains and necklaces, in regions bordering on Mali. She makes her sales in local markets, either retail or delivering to the buyer's home. According to how her business prospers, Nana helps her husband to support the family and prepare the future of their two children.

Nana has been in this business for six years. She hopes to build a permanent house in the future and to see her children succeed in school. Nowadays, she would not undergo any influence of the loan on her business, her personal life, or that of her family. On the other hand, the charges that the road authorities impose when she crosses borders are a stumbling block.

Nana would like to invest in a new shop where she can sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nizoramo

texts.ru:
Низорамо проживает в городке Куляб. Она замужем. Ей 41 год. Низорамо занимается выпечкой и продажей лепешек. Ее утро начинается очень рано. На каждом столе таджика на завтрак должно быть лепешка. Низорамо начинает работать рано, чтобы на каждом столе во время были лепешки.
