Потребность ее лепешкам растет (растет количество клиентов) и она решила увеличить производство. Она обратилась за заемными деньгами, чтобы купить дров для печки и муки для теста. Низорамо верит, что ей удастся получить кредит и совершить задуманный план.
texts.en:
Nizoramo lives in the town of Kulob. She is 41 years old and married. Nizoramo bakes flatbread for sale. Her morning starts very early.  Flatbread is a must at breakfast time in every Tajik household. Nizoramo starts her work very early to get flatbread ready for her customers' tables.

The demand for her flatbread is growing as she has more customers, and she decided to increase her production volume. She has applied for a loan in order to buy wood for her stove and flour for  the dough. Nizoramo trusts that she will be able to obtain this loan and realize her plan.

loans.use: to buy flour and wood.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her six sons and two daughters, her children are doing their studies. 

For nine years, Nasreen's husband has been running his own business, selling clothes. Her husband is soley responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to sell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Nasreen is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband by buying clothes for his business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Afi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne et le revend au marché deux fois par mois. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des détergents et savons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi va pouvoir répondre aux nombreuses attentes de ses clients et soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Afi is a married woman aged 40, living in Adidogomé. She resells foodstuffs. She stocks up and resells her goods at the market twice a month. She is requesting this loan to order some detergent and soap.

With the profit she will get, Afi will be able to respond to the demand of her clients and help cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 33 sacks of detergent and 16 cases of soap.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in village with her family, is married and has a child. Her husband is a carpenter. She is busy with keeping and selling livestock. She has a good condition to keep and take care about livestock. She likes her activity and well knows how to keep livestock. Her husband helps her to sell livestock at animal market. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial support to treat her sick husband at hospital. She is hoping to be treated and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to treat her sick husband at hospital

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in village with her family, is married and her husband is a carpenter. She has two children. She is an agrarian, with 18 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She plants vegetables and cereals and also keeps livestock. Her husband and son help her to keep and take care of the animals. This year she planted onions and tomatoes to harvest in September. 

Her son became sick. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her son’s treatment at hospital. She hopes to have healthy son and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s treatment at hospital

loans.name: Melissa Lisseth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Melissa, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. El marido  se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Melissa es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, cosméticos entre otros, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  sale tres  o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes, no tiene horarios fijos si no cuando pueda, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, cosméticos y  todo lo que ella vende. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de ayuda. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su bebe.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Nuevo Paraíso gather around every fortnight in the neighborhood El Paraíso of the city of Manta, a city known by its beautiful beaches that receive visits all year round, and for its unique beauty with a lot of tourist attractions. 

In this place lives Melissa who is 22 years old and has a 3-year-old daughter from a common law relationship. Her husband works in fishing. Melissa is a woman who enjoys working in order to help her husband to support the household. 

She works selling all kinds of clothing, like shoes, purses and cosmetics among others. She sells going from door to door 3 or 4 days a week, sometimes during the day and other times in the afternoon. She doesn’t have a fix schedule since she goes out to sell whenever she is able to. 

She also sells from her house when the customers go to buy a garment. She gives her products on credit and collects payments every 8 or 15 days. She has done this activity for 5 years and it allows her to get incomes for the wellbeing of her family. 

She will use this loan to buy clothing, purses, cosmetics and other products that she sells. She has had two loans with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and helpful. Her dream is to give her baby only the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, purses, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Hakitengya 11 Womens Development Ass Group

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking married woman with 8 children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. Her business is cocoa farming and selling on top of growing palm oil for supplementary income. She is in need of a loan to buy more cocoa for selling. She has a great desire of accumulating more capital and becoming a prominent cocoa dealer in her area, although she complains of the difficulty of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital. 

She is a member of Hakitengya 11 women's development association where members guarantee each other for loans as a group.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for reselling

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing necessities like fishing net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Jonese

texts.en:
Jones is 57 years old. He is married and they have six children. He operates a retail shop and has been in business for three years. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he will use it to buy more stock like cooking oil, toilet papers, sugar, salt etc.  

He will use profits from the expanded business to educate children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be a major distributor

loans.use: buy stock like sugar, cooking oil, salt etc

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old. She is married with 5 children. She has had a retail shop business which she has run for the last 26 years. 

She has requested for a loan which she will use to will be using the loan to purchase additional stock for her shop. such include cooking oil, milk, maize flour, sugar and porridge flour.

With the anticipated profits, Mercy will be able to pay school fees. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are have to a supermarket and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her shop. such include cooking oil, milk, maize flour, sugar and porridge flour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sometimes it’s the husband-and-wife’s partnership that makes a business successful. Elizabeth of Matina, Davao City finds it true. She and her husband, Virgilio, both sell street food at “Tsanggihan sa Katauhan” (translates as people’s market) located along a boulevard in Davao City. It’s a prolific place for their business since it’s a market cum people’s park. They sell softdrinks and self-prepared beverages, French fries, fried banana and sweet potato, and their specialty – “kwek-kwek”, a popular street food made from boiled egg covered with flour, deeply fried and skewered on a bamboo stick. It is usually dipped in vinegar with fermented chili and pepper. 

For now, their income suffices for their everyday expenditures because their children are still in high school and elementary levels. But Elizabeth’s forward looking mindset drives her to save early for the college education of her children. She plans to buy more street food ingredients and simultaneously, add fruits and vegetables as another enterprise that her husband can sell separately. She appeals for PhP 29,000 supplementary capital for this purpose. This will surely increase their combined profit. She hopes that their business will steadily improve so as to attain their dream of renovating their house, completing their children’s college education, and acquiring a multicab as family vehicle. 

Elizabeth is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more street food ingredients and add fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of products such as sugar, packets of tea leaves and cooking oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old,married and blessed with eight children; four are underage and the other four are adults.

Margaret sells assorted vegetables, a business she has done for several years now and it has been profitable. 

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase additional vegetables for sale

She hopes that this will help her generate additional income so as to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and expand the current business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables for sale

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is 61 years old and is married with 6 children. He has had a tailoring business for 40 years. He will be using the loan to buy tailoring materials such as fabric materials, sewing threads and buttons for use in his business and make more income to support his family. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are have a bigger business, make more income and be able to support his family.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials such as fabric materials, sewing threads, buttons and laces for use in his business and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is aged 57 years,married to Rael and he supports three children.He has been selling construction materials such as kokoto to clients for the last four years and the business earns him KES 5,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase wheelbarrow for transporting construction materials to the nearest areas so as to meet constructors needs. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and educate his children. 
His hope is to expand his business sector and be self reliant.

loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrow for transporting construction materials to the nearest areas so as to meet constructors needs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Nenita has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Kitojo Tukole Group

texts.en:
Milly is a member of Kitojo Tukole Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan facility from Hofokam. She is a hard working married lady with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. She sells fresh foods like tomatoes, onions,green peppers and oranges. In addition to this, she does farming that adds her more income. 

She has a vision of buying land to construct there a residential house for her family and expand her farming project on discovering a big market for her products. Milly has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets and iron rods for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima and her only son live happily in Taratumb, a village of the Vayots Dzor region. 

Her son is an army officer, and Rima has to take care of their family farm alone. Rima keeps two calves and two cows, six sheep and seven hens. She gets some milk, makes cheese and sells it to her customers in the whole region.

Rima works hard to manage all work on the farm and keep it profitable. She asks lenders to support her mower purchase. She needs it to prepare the land for cultivation and start growing crops next year. 

As this is Rima's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Rima get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Rima hopes to have your support.

loans.use: to pay for a mower needed for farming.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales de una marca muy reconocida, además de productos Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por encargos, ella sale dos o tres veces por semana, deja a créditos y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 12 años con este negocio razón por lo cual ya cuanta con mucha clientela. 
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales, cremas, perfumes, bisuterías  y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 5 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "El Nuevo Paraíso" communal bank meets every fortnight in the El Paraíso neighborhood of the city of Manta. This city is known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Rosa lives in this place. She is 42 years old is married and from this realtionship has two children aged 16 and 12 years old who study in secondary school. Her husband is a master builder.

Rosa is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She works in commerce selling natural products from a well-known brand as well as Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She sells door to door as well as by request. She goes out two or three days a week, selling on credit and collecting every week or two weeks. She has been in this business for more than 12 years which is the reason she has a large clientele.

She will use this loan to buy natural products, creams, perfume, jewellery and everything she sells. She has been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes it as the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy natural products, creams, perfumes, jewellery etc.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn is 45 years old and widowed. She is a rice farmer with four children who resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia and has been cultivating rice for over 25 years. Her two children are factory workers and other two children attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $17 per day. 

Now Khorn would like to buy lumber to renovate her house, but she is short of the money, so she needs a loan. With this loan she will have enough money to renovate her house and have a proper house to live in. 

For her future, Khorn hopes that she will be able to help her two children in earning bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Mazloom

texts.en:
Mazloom is 27 years old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan where her husband is a nuts and dried fruit seller by profession. 

Mazloom's husband needs to purchase different types of nuts and dried fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore Mazloom has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's nuts and dried fruit business

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 51-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small business selling clothes in his shop. He purchases clothes from the market at a low price and sells it at a high price in his community. The people of the town like his garment collection and selection a lot. 

The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather is coming to an end and people are demanding seasonal clothes. Kousar requested a loan so that her husband can buy more of a variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Kousar hopes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide them with a better education. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more garments to enhance her husband's clothing sale business.

loans.name: Ma. Alma

texts.en:
Fishing has been the source of income in most community in Bien Unido, Bohol. Ma. Alma and her husband have been doing this business for 20 years and they earn about PHP3930 per month enough for their daily consumption. 

She wishes to buy new fishing material such as fishing net, fishing rod and fishing weight to increase their livelihood. Ma. Alma is 45 years old. At her age, she has three children ages, 21, 14 and two years old. She plans in the future to increase her earnings to have a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing rods and fishing weights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cart, sauces, tomatoes, ham, cheese, and more and to meet customer demand for products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wooden raw material for repairing and making new chairs for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en:
Leam is a farmer living in Siem Reap province and is a 57-year-old mother of ten children. She has been growing rice and cassava to earn the main sources of family’s income for 40 years. Moreover, raising chickens and working for others for a fee have been her supplemental businesses for ages. Her crop was destroyed by insects and the chickens got ill. Thus, Leam can manage to earn only about 35,000KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee, purchase fuel, rice seeds and organic fertilizers. She hopes that she can get more yields and earn more income from her business to update the standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees, purchase fuel, rice seeds and organic fertilizers.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ramona Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Paraíso se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio El Paraíso en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona,  tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 9 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle.
Doña Ramona es una mujer que al ver las necesidades que hay en su hogar y que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que gana está decidida a empezar a generar sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a  su marido con los gastos que del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella con este crédito espera viajar a Guayaquil y comprar ropa de todo tipo pues hay muchos familiares y conocidos que la están impulsando a que venda este tipo de prendas lo cual va a hacer pues ya tiene varios pedidos para entregar.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez que le dieron el  crédito. Sus sueños son salir  adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "El Nuevo Paraíso" communal bank meets very fortnight in the El Paraíso neighborhood of the city of Manta. This city is well-known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited all year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Ramona lives in this city. She is 35 years old, married and from this realtionship has three children aged 10, 9 and 5 years old who all go to school. Her husband works on the docks.

Ramona is a woman who seeing the needs in her house and the money her husband earns not being able to cover them decided to start to generate her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children. With this loan Ramona hopes to travel to Guayaquil to buy all types of clothing as many acquaintances and family are urging her to sell this type of clothing. So she is going to do it as she has a number of requests to fill.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts and children's clothing. This is her first loan cycle in the communal bank and she likes it as the loans are awarded quickly. Her dream is to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is 41 years old and she comes from the  province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Banjai, a messenger and has four children of which three are still in the  Elementary Level and the eldest is in High School. A messenger's salary in the Phils. is not enough to support a family of four children so Leilani took the initiative to open a small general store to help her husband make a living.

She is humbly asking for a Php 50000 loan to fill her small general store with the grocery needs of her community such as rice, canned goods, bread, instant noodles and partly and to start a "Piso" net Shop. Leilani finds ways and means to augment their income which made her think of putting up a "Piso" net shop which is a combination of PC rental and Arcade rentals like the gaming arcades that can be found inside the malls. Customers can avail of their services by inserting Pesos coins. It offers a much more flexible rates than most internet cafes since the customers have the option on how much time and money they are willing to spend. 

Leilani's precious dream is to see all her children finish school and buy a house someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for some grocery items and initial capital to put up "Piso" net shop.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 40 years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

He needs to make repairs and do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good. On a daily basis more maintenance expenses are required. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Parveen's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Parveen also plans to build her savings with the profits from her husband's income in order to meet her family's needs in the future.

Parveen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is 39 mother of two daughters,living in a area of Lahore,Pakistan. Veronika is a responsible mother of two daughters and is focusing on their education and wants them to highly qualified .so she spend most of the money on their education.Her husband is also proud of his daughters and dreams the same as their mother do.He works hard day and night at his book store to give his children a better future.

Her husband wanted to buy a bulk of books and stationary items so to increase his profit and could well address the family expenses.but its not possible because the couple has no savings.Therefore Veronica applied for a loan amount of 50000 PKR.  

Furthermore she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more books and stationary for her husband book store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and married, with two children. With one child in school, Alma works very hard to provide for her family.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Alma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia is a 54-year-old woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elia has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

Elia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelinda is 47 years old and she has one child in school.

Emelinda has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Emelinda has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to  buy a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies for her internet cafe business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a mouse, keyboard, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in leafy greens, potatoes, squash, onions, peppers and tomatoes.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to him in the amount of PHP 150,000, which he used to buy paint, pipes and brushes, cement, steel, nails, and other hardware items to sell and deliver to his customers. His hardware store is doing well with more stock. Bryan retained his regular customers, and more customers are ordering and buying from him.

Bryan was able to pay his loan on time, and the loan extended benefits not to just him, but also the employees in his stores. Bryan employed another person to deliver his goods, as his orders are growing. More importantly, through the revenue of his income, he continuously supports his family and other people under his scholarship.

Bryan is on his third loan now, and is availing himself of a PHP 150,000 loan to buy 50 boxes of canned goods, 70 boxes of noodles, 50 boxes of bottled products, 20 boxes of coffee, 20 boxes of bar and powder soaps, and materials needed for the renovation of his store. He wanted to expand the store, accommodate more customers inside, and display his stock.

The loan will enable him to continuously expand and stock items that are in demand this rainy season, like noodles and instant soups.

Bryan has high hopes to expand more to become a wholesale distributor in his community. In that way, he will help his community to save on transportation, since he is nearer than others, and will generate more employment.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of canned goods, 50 boxes of bottled products, 20 boxes of coffee, 20 boxes of bar and powder soaps, and materials for the renovation of his store.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for eight years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi.

Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Shamim's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shamim also plans to make savings with the profit amount from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 47 years old. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Estrella has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.en:
Fidelina is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Fidelina has been raising chickens for 7 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Fidelina is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream: saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 47 years old, married and has a four children to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband as a fisherman in providing their children needs, she keeps a vegetable garden. She plants vegetables and sells them to the market and nieghborhood.  

She wants to give her children a better living and to achieve this she must increase her income, so she decided to take a loan to buy a fertilizer for the vegetable garden, so that she can produce a good quality of vegetables and can sell more vegetables in the market that will generate more income.

Julieta plan for the future to save money out from her business income to improve their family living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

location.town: Sapang Ama, Sapang Dala, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza de 45 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos de 16, 19 y 21 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa de dama, con el cual genera sus ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y brinda todos los insumos básicos para su familia además recibe el apoyo del esposo con algunas cosas del hogar. Lorenza desea reparar las paredes y poner el ladrillo de piso de un cuarto que construyo con su crédito anterior para que su grupo familiar tenga más espacio para vivir con más comodidad, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, puertas, balcones, etc., para la reparación de la habitación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 45 years old and lives in her own house in the company of her husband and her children aged 16, 19 and 21 years old. She is hard-working woman who works selling shoes and woman's clothing. Doing this she generates the income to raise her children and provide the basic goods for her family. She also receives help from her husband for some of the household things.

Lorenza wants to plaster the walls and install a brick floor on a room she built with her previous loan so that her family has more space to live and more comfort. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, doors, iron grills. etc. to finish a room of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, doors, iron grills. etc. to repair a room of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 36 years old woman, and mother of four children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is vegetable seller by profession. He sells onions, potatoes, tomatos etc. 

Saima's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore Saima has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items
. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Delia has a general store business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna, 24, is a married mother blessed with a dependent child in school. She lives in Siem Reap province where she grows rice and cassava to support her living. She is raises chickens and works for others for a fee to supplement her family’s income; they earn her about 35,000KHR a day. The crop, which was expected to produce good outputs, was threatened severely by pests and her chickens got ill. 

Sokna decided to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is her second cycle. The past loan was paid back completely and it enabled her to improve the standard of living better. She will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee, buy fuel, rice seeds and organic fertilizers. She hopes to get more crop yields and to improve the lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, buy fuel, rice seeds and organic fertilizers.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Erick Balmore

texts.es: Erick de 32 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 3 años a laborar en una institución nacional, prestando sus servicios en el área de recolección de basura. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad. Erick desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, clavos, polines y mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera proteger a su familia.
texts.en: Erick is 32 years old. He is a hardworking man who has worked for 3 years at a national institution rendering his services in the area of garbage collection. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two children, ages 12 and 11. Erick wants to change his house's roof, because it is in bad condition. For this, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy metal sheets, nails, poles, and to pay for hand labor to repair his house's roof and protect his family in this way.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, nails, poles, and to pay for hand labor to repair his house's roof and protect his family in this way.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan de 32 años de edad es un hombre trabajador y responsable y por tal motivo desde hace 10 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su localidad y es lo que le permite salir con los gastos y llevar el alimento a su familia. El habita en vivienda propia junto a su abuela, madre y su hermano. Juan desea mejorar el corredor de su casa ya que cuando llueve azota la lluvia y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, alambre y la mano de obra para poder mejorar el corredor de su vivienda .
texts.en: Juan is 32 years old. He is a hardworking and responsible man. For this reason, he decided to work selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. This allows him to pay for his expenses and support his family. He lives in his own house, together with his grandmother, mother and brother. Juan wants to improve the hallway of his house, because when it rains, it comes down in this area. For this, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: metal sheets, wood, nails, wire, and to pay for hand labor to improve the hallway of his house.

loans.use: to invest in: metal sheets, wood, nails, wire, and to pay for hand labor to improve the hallway of his house.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Héctor de 39 años de edad es un hombre que siempre demuestra su deseo de superación, actualmente habita en vivienda familiar junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 1 año de edad. Héctor desde hace un año presta sus servicios en una institución publica de su localidad como seguridad y ha sabido ganarse la confianza mostrando su responsabilidad. Él desea cambiar algunas duralitas de la vivienda ya que están quebradas y solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, pernos, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y proteger de esta manera a su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor, 39, is a man who always shows his desire for self-improvement. Currently he lives in the family home with his wife and his two children, ages 10 and 1. He has been providing security service in a public institution in his town for a year and he has been able to earn people's trust by being responsible.

Héctor wants to change some of the Duralita-brand roofing on his house. He's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy corrugated metal, bolts, beams, and pins to put a new roof on his house to protect his family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal, bolts, beams, and pins to put a new roof on his house to protect his family

loans.name: Hernanita

texts.en:
Hernanita is 56 years old and married. She has four children.

Hernanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Hernanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, cigarettes, and other groceries.

Hernanita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan.

Hernanita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, canned goods, cigarettes, and other groceries.

loans.name: Janice Marie

texts.en:
Janice Marie is 33 years old, single and has one child, who is in school.

Janice Marie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janice Marie has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Janice Marie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Janice Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is 43 years old and has one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Corazon has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling processed foods.

Maria Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, 55, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marietta has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marietta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Marietta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 30 years old and single. He lives at Piat.

He is managing a store for income. He sells feeds, rice and various commodities for income.

Ireneo wants to improve his earnings. That is why he is asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell. Additional commodities will help him gain more profits, too.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, biscuits and softdrinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a resident of Moalboal, Cebu. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 15 and the youngest is 8. Her husband works in their vulcanizing shop while Gaudiosa earns a living selling souvenir items such as printed shirts, bangles, pearl necklaces, wallets and bags in her shop near the beach of Moalboal.

Gaudiosa dreamed of improving her business profits and sales so that she can save and be able to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, wallets, shells, bags and accessories for her souvenir shop.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 53 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Maxima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maxima has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maxima requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Maxima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Perparim

texts.en:
Perparim is 29 years old and suffers from health related issues, as does his wife. 

However, despite all this, they have been doing rural activities to enhance their earnings since 2000. He and his wife live with his elderly parents and his brother's family of three members. Thus, all in all there are seven family members living under the same roof. 

They currently have 20 goats and 1 dairy cow from which they sell raw milk  and 1 calf, a year old. They also have goats, baby goats and produce homemade goat cheese. There are 100 olive trees from which they make and sell olive oil. 

Disability incomes for him and his wife and his elderly parent's retirement pension adds up to $496 a month.

Perparim wants to expand on the livestock by adding some more goats to the existing herd and your loan will help him achieve the goal.

loans.use: to expand on livestock by adding some more goats

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. In 2012, she decided to start her own job, so she opened a small grocery store in her town. Her shop is situated next to her house where she welcomes customers from different areas and villages to buy her fresh goods.

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her grocery store inventory. She states that the loan will surely help her extend her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store inventory

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old, married and lived at Amulung. She had three children.  Marilyn manages a retail store for income. She patiently sells grocery items so she can acquire good profits for her family.

She wanted to improve her sales and wanted to increase commodities to sell, so she is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap and noodles to sell. Marilyn will pay back her loan in full and will continue improving her income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soap and noodles to sell

loans.name: Alicia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Alicia, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos  mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Alicia es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre tuvo que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante sus hijos, ella prepara comidas y banquetes para fiestas y compromisos sociales,  por lo general todos los fines de semana tiene contratos, ofrece los mejores platos y bocadillos para que sus clientes estén contentos por lo cual tiene mucha clientela, de esta forma ella se gana sus propios ingresos y sale adelante  sola.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 6 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y salir adelante.
texts.en:
República del Ecuador Loan Group meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that tourists visit throughout the year and for its incomparable beauty and many tourist attractions.

This is where Alicia lives. She's 53 years old and the single mother of two adult children who support themselves. She's a very persevering woman who always had to work very hard to get her children ahead.

Alicia prepares food and banquets for parties and social events. She usually has contracts on the weekend. She offers the best dishes and snacks so her customers will be happy, and as a result has a large clientele. This is how she earns her own income and gets ahead on her own.

She's going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other provisions to make the food.

Alicia has been in the loan group for six years and she likes it because she gets ahead with the loans. Her dreams are to be healthy and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water pump for pumping water for domestic use and farming.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Zenaida requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina happily lives with her husband and son in Berdavan village of Tavush region. Nina's husband is retired and helps his wife on the farm. They organize land cultivation works in their family yard, near the house where they live.  Nina's son, helps his parents during harvesting and selling period. The family cultivates haricots, potatoes and tomatoes and also grow peach, cherry, plum, blood oranges, figs, walnut, apple and pear. They sell the harvest directly from the orchard and gather income for the living. 

Nina has now applied for this loan to purchase  4 sows needed to start hog breeding. They have already build a small pigsty near their house and are very enthusiastic with their new idea. 

 As this is Nina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Nina get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

 Nina and her family hope to receive lenders' support and build the farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for 4 sows needed for breeding purposes

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
Mayranush is from Lernants Village. Her husband is a migrant worker and her only son serves in the army.

Mayranush has been involved in farming for 15 years. She is mainly involved in sheep breeding. Currently, her farm includes 20 sheep, four calves and 35 hens. Mayranush also cultivates wheat and potatoes in the family yard.

Mayranush has applied for this loan to purchase two piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to enlarge her farm and make it more sustainable.

This is Mayranush's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to pay back, and she faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her family members were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Mayranush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.

The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Please support this enthusiastic farmer's efforts to have a profitable and sustainable farm.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets and  forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 26 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 5 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his scrap business. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more scrap, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to have a good business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 29-year-old single lady who started eight years ago working as a nurse to cover her needs and expenses. She really loves her domain for she believes that being a nurse is more than a job, although her limited salary is not satisfying all her needs.

Khadija is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has very professional skills in this domain and is really loved by her patients. She is also trying to improve her life. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to visit holy places she has always dreamed of. This loan will help her to achieve her dreams, enjoy her days and return to her job full of energy and power.

loans.use: to visit holy places she has always dreamed of

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past two years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells herbal medicine. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more materials, which will help her to generate greater profits and improve business. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Catherine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her shop

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 25 years old, and he supports a family of four children. He has been practicing farming for the last years and the business has been profitable; hence, earning him an income of KES 12,000 a month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more firm sites for better farming. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to improve on his farming. His hope and dream is to change his family’s life style.

loans.use: to buy more firm sites for better farming.

loans.name: Wyden

texts.en:
Wyden is aged 31 years,married to Mary and he supports three children.He has been offering motorcycle transport services to clients for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 3,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as chains, seat and tabulator so as to offer better and faster transport services to clients. 

He plans to gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sell to clients and repay the loan.His hope is to expand his business sector and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as chains, seat and tabulator so as to offer better and faster transport services to clients.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman, with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes, which she has been involved in for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to sell tailoring materials in wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Set is a resident living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children. The main sources of her family’s income are from cashew growing and rice farming. Her cashews do not grow well, so it made her income decrease.

This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. For her previous loans, it helped her with more income to update her living condition to get better than before.

Set leads a group of four members. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that her family’s members will have better health and she will be able to earn more income in order to expand her current business and update her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, 43, is a married father of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the other one is under age of school. He brings up chickens and works for others for a fee. Additionally, he is raising cows to earn supplemental income. These businesses earn him about 29,200KHR a day to support the living. The chickens got ill and it was the main challenge to him. 

Now, Sophal is leading a group of two members to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and it will be his seventh time. The past loan enabled him to send and support his children’s education so was good. For this new loan, it will be used to buy chickens, feeds and to build chicken cage. He hopes to expand his chicken-raising business bigger and earn more income to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feeds and to build a chicken cage.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man aged 32 years with four children who are 6, 5,3 and 2 years respectively. He lives in rural area with his family. He runs a clothes shop that sells ladies' wear.He works seven days a week and each day he works for 8 hours. He supplements his income with agriculture.

He started his business in 2008 due to experience he had acquired from his brother he grew up with. 

He has acquired this loan facility in order to restock his boutique
His clients are local residents and his dream is to open up another outlet. He says he still faces the challenges are lack of limited capital.
He describes himself as a hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy stocks of dresses and blouses to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 40 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past two years Fred has been working hard to manage his depot, which operates a beer depot business.

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beers, sodas, water, and juice, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and purchase more drinks.

Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock. He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, water, and juice.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three currently in school. For the past three years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his spare parts business. He sells spare parts for motorcycles and vehicles. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts and will help Patrick generate greater profits and increase his stock. Patrick hopes that in the future, he will be able to purchase more stock. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 50, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural produce to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 5.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support.
She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Huch

texts.en:
Huch lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day. 

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva  now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy:  corn, pork meat, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. in order to prepare delicious pupusas (traditional stuffed tortillas.)V

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 45, lives in a community of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland which is located near her house. Beside this she also involves with a fishery. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for more than twenty years. 

Recently, her fishing is running badly because she has not enough fishing material. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy some fishing materials. This loan will make a great contribution to develop her career as well as her living standard. She is thankful for the all lender for their kindly financial support.

loans.use: buy some fishing materials

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 53, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows cassava and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rosa Paula

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun vive en su casa así como también una nieta que tiene 12 años y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Doña Rosa para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que él hace no alcanza para cubrir los gastos, hace mas de 12 años empezó un negocio, ella se dedica a varias actividades, vende ropa de todo tipo los mismos que sale a vender puerta a puerta, también prepara bocadillos y alimentos para fiestas y recepciones de personas o instituciones los fines de semana, lleva 13 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
República del Ecuador Loan Group meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that tourists visit all year long and for its incomparable beauty and many tourist attractions.

This is where Rosa lives. She's 54 years old and married, and has five adult children with her husband. One of them still lives at home with her, as does a granddaughter who's 12 and attends school. Rosa's husband is a security guard.

Rosa started a business more than 12 years ago to help her husband with the household expenses, because what he earns isn't enough to cover them. She works various jobs. She sells all types of clothing, going out to sell door-to-door. She also makes snacks and food for parties and receptions for people or institutions on the weekend. She has done this work for 13 years and it allows her to earn something on her own.

She's going to use this loan to buy clothing and provisions to make her dishes.

Rosa has been in the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are helpful to her. Her dream is to get ahead improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and one child. He husband represents the main income source. His only target is to satisfy their family needs and improve their lifestyle.

Today, with the aim to help her children and to pay their study fees, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to help continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Naiila

texts.en: Naiila is a 35-year-old Lebanese married mother of six children who are all still attending school. Her husband provides the main income source to help her family meet the needs of life and enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans and help her children continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and happily married to Lesario, a garbage collector. They have one college-age child. A garbage collector's salary is barely enough to support a family so Evelyn thought of putting up a small general store to help meet the family's daily needs and send their offspring to college. Education is a top priority of Filipinos since it is a pathway out of poverty and to uplift the lives of their children. 

Evelyn is now humbly asking your help to lend her 15,000 PHP to fill her store with groceries, such as rice, canned goods and instant noodles, as well as beverages and toiletries to make her store more competitive and attract more customers. Although at times she has difficulty collecting her receivables, she maintains her positive outlook and faith that her family will have enough for their needs. She thanks God and you in advance for your financial assistance, which will help her store to grow.

Evelyn dreams of having a better life and growing her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries  to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children. Lorena is 39 years old and one of her children is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorena has a personal products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Lorena requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell.

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela, age 32, is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials including threads, needles, cloth to enhance in his business. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Raheela, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase the needed things such as a sewing machine, needles, thread and fabric with the help of the loan. Raheela is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring shop

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Khanjyan village where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little granddaughter.
Anahit's husband and son currently work as migrant workers, so Anahit has to manage farming activities alone. She perfectly manages to take care of the livestock of cow, calves, pigs, piglets and hens, as well as apricot, peach, plum and walnut. Anahit has also some cultivation of cabbage and potato which is for family use mainly. 

To be able to purchase  forage for feeding the livestock, Anahit has now applied for this loan. This is her second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions previously, was very difficult to return back, and Anahit faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her family were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Anahit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 
Anahit hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 59 years old, married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmela requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Carmela has been in this business for four years. In the future, Carmela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom in her home to improve access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Edisa has been working hard to manage her retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Edisa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy commodities such as sugar and posho (maize flour), which will help Edisa to generate greater profits and improve her business. Edisa hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Edisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy commodities such as sugar and posho

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair conditioner, canned food, cooking oil, sugar, soy sauce and detergent powder

loans.name: Marcos Vidal

texts.es: Marcos de 25 años de edad es un joven que siempre ha tenido deseos de superación, actualmente habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa. Marcos se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco el cual lo comercia junto a su esposa desde hace 11 años. Marcos desea encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que aún es de tierra y en época de lluvia se le filtra el agua y se le empoza el agua, dentro de la vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y evitar anidación de plagas.
texts.en:
Marcos is 25 years old. This young man has always been eager to improve himself. He currently lives in his own home with his wife. He and his wife work buying and selling fresh fish. He has been  doing this for eleven years.

Marcos wants to pour cement flooring in his home. They still have dirt floors, so water filters in during the rainy season, which causes water to stagnate inside the house. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel so that he can install new floors and prevent pests from nesting indoors.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to install new flooring in his house.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 48 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past 21 years Henry has been working hard to manage his welding business.

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another welding machine, and metals, and will help Henry to generate greater profits and buy basic needs. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to buy plot of land.

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy another welding machine and metals.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all currently in school. For the past three years, Ismail has been working hard to manage his shoe business. 

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Ismail generate greater profits and expand the business. Ismail hopes that in the future, he will be able to earn more income. 

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismail who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of shoes

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen 45 years of age. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.
