Her husband runs a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good customer relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Parveen gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is aged 38 years, married to Stella and he supports two children. He has been selling electrical appliances for the last 15 years and the business earns him KES 30,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more electrical goods and products such as televisions, radios and mobile spare parts and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use his gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients and educate his children.

His hope is to expand his business sector and eradicate poverty in his family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods and products such as televisions, radios and mobile spare parts and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 42-years old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small business of clothes selling from his shop. He purchased clothes from a market at a low price and sales it on profitable price in his community. The people of town like his clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because he has built up very good relation with his customers. 

Therefore he has decided to increase his current business. Shabana requested a loan so that her husband can buy more variety of clothes to fulfill the demand. Shabana wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing sale business

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
Gjyste is a widowed mother of one child. She is a villager in her 60s who has been doing rural activities for the past 25 years. She lives with her married son, his wife and their two children. She has two dairy cows producing approximately 30 liters of raw milk a day. Gjyste sells 11 liters per day and two calves per year. With the rest of the milk, she makes and sells cheese and butter. She's also got a young cow that is pregnant at the moment .From the two sows she has, she sells 10 piglets a year. Milk and babies from the goat are for personal use. In addition, she owns about 8 dynym (a dynym is an area of land 1,000 square meters or 1/10th of a hectare) of agricultural land where she plants mostly wheat and other crops to feed the animals. As a widow, Gjyste also receives a very small pension.
She is photographed adjacent to the animal stable that was built with wood planks. Now Gjyste wants to build a better stable where animals rest and sleep well,. She says: "I'm an animal lover and I do not want my animals to sleep in the cold as they do at the moment."

loans.use: to build a good stable where animals could rest and sleep well.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 50 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his charcoal business. 

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and buy another plot of land. Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 23 years, Resty has been working hard to manage her salon.

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy salon items, and will help Resty to generate greater profits and open up a training school. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

Resty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Resty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy salon items.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 3 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his milling & poultry business, which operates milling services. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a second machine and poultry feeds, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a second grinding machine and some poultry feed

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Michael has been working hard to manage his bar business. 

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks, and will help Michael to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Michael hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Michael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Michael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past 12 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her produce-selling business. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Grace generate greater profits and add income to the family. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her stock. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is aged 39 years old. He is married and supports a family of three children. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him 12,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay his loan and the surplus to open a wholesale shop. His hopes and dreams are to expand his agricultural sector and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market

loans.name: Yerem

texts.en:
Yerem is a constructor living in the Ararat region. He lives with his parents, wife and two little daughters. 
Three years ago, Yerem started to earn a living for his family by providing construction services to local people.
He now receives a number of orders during the month and provides both internal and external renovation services for houses. Yerem asks for this loan to purchase construction tools and materials needed for providing home renovation services and to complete current orders. Yerem has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Yerem and his work, so he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for construction tools and materials needed for providing home renovation work.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en: Zeina is a Lebanese married woman. She is 25 years old and has one child. She is really attached to her family. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He is a soldier in the Lebanese army and is able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Today, given that the new school year is coming, Zeina is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees. The family's only target and dream is to see him achieve a higher position.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old and supports a family of seven. He has been in this business for the last 10 years, and the business earns him an income of KES 8,000 a month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase tyres and tubes for better service to his motorbike. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production. His hope and dream is to change his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tyres and tubes for better service for his motorbike.

loans.name: Dukhik

texts.en:
Dukhik is from Sisavan village where she lives with her son, daughter-in-law and three infant grandchildren. 
Family's occupation is in agribusiness. The farm which they run produces eggplant, apricot, peach cultivation. They sell the gathered harvest of their farm in local open markets and that's how earn income for the family's living costs. 

Dukhik asks now this loan to pay for transportation costs, oxen and fertilizer for land cultivation. This loan will support her farm to be more profitable and she will be able to provide a better life for her grandchildren. 

 As this is Dukhik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Dukhik get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. 

Dukhik and her family hope to receive lenders' support and build a farm of their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for transportation costs, oxen and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Kov's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Kampong Cham province, Kov is 23 years old and a mother of a young kid. To support her living condition, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Moreover, she can get extra income via selling grocery items.

Because her cassava does not grow well, she can sell it for a low price. For Kov, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid back her past loan completely. With her past loan, she can get a decent income to improve her conditions as well.

In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family’s living and get good health. She hopes that she can update her family's healthy living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family’s living and to get good health

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. For the past five years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her cosmetics shop.

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, beads, necklaces and bags, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and gain profits. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to pay back the loan on time.

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics, beads, necklaces and bags.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 5 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Milton has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Milton has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread,juice,soda,soap,sugar,bananas, mangoes,avocados,tomatoes and will help Milton to generate greater profits and expand the business. Milton hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Milton is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milton who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread,juice,soda,soap,sugar,bananas, mangos

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Joy has been working hard to manage her retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho (maize flour), rice, groundnuts, sugar, and bread and will help Joy generate greater profits and improve business. Joy hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her business. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy posho (maize flour), rice, groundnuts, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Roger is 38 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past three years, Roger has been working hard to manage his retail shop.

To help expand his business, Roger has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho (maize flour),rice, and groundnuts, and will help Roger generate greater profits and increase his income. Roger hopes that in the future, he will be able to increase his stock. 

Roger is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Roger who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho (maize flour), soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Gertuda, who is in her mid 40s, is a divorcee with three children who are all in school.  She has been running a beauty salon for 10 years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Gertuda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet her customers' requirements..  She dreams of having an international salon.

Gertuda will share this loan with her loan group, Tumaini, which consists of four people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Sren, 38, is a married man from Kampong Cham Province. He has no children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primary grows rice and sell his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

Recently, some parts of his house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of fund, he has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for his house renovation. He and his family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for his house renovation

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda  is a married one, 58  years old and has 4 children to provide.  She put up a small sari-sari store in the front of her house. Despite the small income she gathered, it brought daily income which is just the family needed. But she aims to increase their daily income so she took a loan to buy more goods to sell to have more income.

Rosalinda  plan for her future is to raised small number of pigs to expand their daily needs and to save money to sustain the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren is a 26-year-old married woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She owns a sari-sari store business for a living. She works hard together with her husband to provide the needs of their family. Caren is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, toiletries, laundry soap, mosquito repellent, powdered juice. She hopes in the future to have a better life. With that, she is aiming to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy hips, biscuits, candies, noodles, toiletries, laundry soap, mosquito repellent, powdered juice and soft drinks

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Diana,  tiene 31 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de 6 años que estudia en una escuela de la localidad. Ella vive en casa de los padres. 
Doña Diana es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar para así salir adelante y darle lo necesario a su  hijo, ella trabaja en un almacén de la ciudad pero además de estos ella también se dedica a la comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer en sus ratos libres y también vende en el lugar donde trabaja, parte de este crédito lo espera utilizar en ciertos arreglos que ella quiere hacer en su casa y así tener más comodidad para ella y su pequeño. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y  materiales de construcción. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The loan group, Republica del Ecuador, gets together every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are highly visited during every season of the year, and a city with a beauty non-equivalent to many touristic places. In this place lives Mrs. Diana. She is 31-years-old, she is divorced and from that relationship she has a 6-year-old child that attends a local school. She lives in her parent's house. 

Mrs. Diana is a woman that has always worked to move forward and give her kid what he needs. She works in a city warehouse, but aside from that, she also makes a living from commerce, selling Avon and Label products by catalog (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and woman accessories). She goes out to sell during her free time, and she also sells in her workplace. She hopes to use part of the loan to do some fixes to her house, and that way have move comfort for her and her child. 

She will use this loan to purchase perfumes, imitation jewelery, cosmetics, lotions, and construction material. She is the founder of the loan group, and the loans are a great help for her. 

Her dreams are to give something better to her child.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, imitation jewelry, lotions and construction materials

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is responsible mother of two daughters and living with her husband in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last five years. 

Asma's husband needs to make maintenance of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires some maintenance charges to maintain his taxi car. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Asma has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance charges of her husband's taxi repairing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Romela is 37 years old and both of her children are in school.

Romela has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Romela requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Romela has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Romela would like to save money to expand her business continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is 35 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Farah has been doing her own business of clothes selling for past six years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Farah needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Farah is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her own clothes sale business

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 1 years, Clare has been working hard to manage her welding business. 

To help expand her business, Clare has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another welding machine, and will help Clare to generate greater profits and improve business. Clare hopes that in the future she will be able to improve business. 

Clare is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Clare who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy another welding machine

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 36 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is currently in school.  For the past three years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her produce business. 

To expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more stock of produce and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and expand her business.  She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become a big supplier. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Lydia, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of produce.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria de 30 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta licuados y panes con salchicha y es de esa forma que ella se gana la vida para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad. Gloria vive en casa familiar desde hace varios años. Ella poco a poco ha logrado construir su vivienda, pero aún le falta instalar el techo para poder ver cumplido su sueño de contar con una vivienda digna, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y alambre para instalar el techo de su vivienda y cumplir su sueño de tener su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is thirty years old. She is a hardworking woman who has been working selling blended drinks and sausage sandwiches for the past ten years. This has enabled her to make a living and support her two children, who are ages ten and five.

Gloria has been living in her own home for several years. Little by little she was able to have it built, but she still has to install the roof in order to achieve her goal of having decent housing. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, purlins, pins, and wire to install the roof and make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, purlins, pins, and wire to install a new roof.

loans.name: Digna Flor

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Digna, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad que estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es militar jubilado.
Doña Digna es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar,  desde hace mas de 20  años  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras y productos de  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella también tiene una distribuidora al por mayor de yogurt  y otros lácteos, en este negocio le ayudan sus hijos, en cuanto a la venta de mercadería lo realiza en su distribuidora o también sale a vender puerta a puerta cuando ella puede. A ella le encanta dedicarse al comercio y es algo que sus hijos también han aprendido esperando que ellos forjen también su propio negocio en un futuro.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y yogurt. Lleva 6 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito of Ecuador meets every two weeks in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are frequented in every season of the year, and known for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.
This is where Señora Digna lives. She is 56 years old and married with four adult children of the marriage who study at university and still live at home. Her husband is retired military.
Doña Digna is a woman who has always liked to work. For more than 20 years she has sold all sorts of clothing, shoes, purses, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories.) She also has a wholesale distributorship of yogurt and other dairy products; her children help her in this business. The sales of merchandise are made at the distributorship or she also goes selling door to door when she can. She loves working in business and it's something her children have also learned in the hopes of creating their own businesses in the future.
This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes and yogurt. She has participated in the Grupo De Crédito for six years and she likes it because the loans are fast and very useful. Her dream is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes and yogurt.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente  is 46 years old,  married and has raised 4 children.. He owns a farm and in order for them to live he decided to plant corn to be able to provide their daily needs. He delivers it to his loyal customers and he sells the remainder in the market. 

He decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn  so that he can produce more corn and deliver a good quality of corn in the market that will result a greater income.

Vicente’s  plan for the future is to save money and to improved their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labor for his farm and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gabriel Alberto

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Gabriel, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de un familiar, el estudia en una universidad de la localidad. 
Don Gabriel es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante y así irse forjando un mejor porvenir para cuando le toque forma su familia, el además dedicarse a sus estudios  también se  dedica al comercio, vende mariscos,  el tres o cuatro veces por semana se desplaza hasta las playas de la localidad y compra el camarón de la mejor calidad para luego enviar a Quito, Cuenca y otras ciudades de la sierra para que allá las reciban varios contactos que él tiene en estas ciudades y vendan al menudeo, de esta forma el lleva un año ganándose la vida y ganado lo suficiente para seguir en sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar camarón. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten  financiarse y no pagar muchos intereses. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The República del Ecuador Loan Group meets twice monthly in the town of Manta, known for its  beautiful beaches which are popular throughout the year, and for the beauty of the town itself with its many tourist attractions.

22-year old Gustavo lives there. He is single and lives in a relative's house. He is a student at a nearby university.

Gustavo is a hardworking young man who puts in a lot of effort to get ahead and make a better future for himself and any family he might have. He is a student and also holds down a job selling seafood. Three or four times a week he travels to the nearby beaches to buy high quality prawns and then send them on to Quito, Cuenca and other cities in the interior. Gustavo has several contacts there who sell the prawns. He has been doing this for the past year and has earned enough money to continue with his education.

The loan money will be used to buy prawns. Gustavo has been with his loan group for two cycles. He likes having access to credit with easy interest. His dreams are to finish his studies and to get a good job.

loans.use: comprar camarón.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a proud beneficially of the Kiva funding. His two previous loans funded successfully thanks to the generosity of Kiva lenders. He is a married man aged 26 years with one child who is young. He lives in rural setting with his child, a dependent and wife.

He is a business man who deals in back cloth trading and he supplements the income by doing agriculture. 
He works for seven days and each day he works for 6 hours. He started this business to earn a living since he never went to school. 

He has acquired this loan facility in order to re-stock his business so that he can meet his client's demand. His clients are traders from capital city.
His dream is to buy a car to help during transportation but he still faces the challenge of delay of payments by his customers who take goods on credit and lack of enough funds to run his businesses. He describes himself as a honest and hard working man.

loans.use: To buy bark cloth used to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fine flour for preparing vermicelli and then selling in the market.

loans.name: Herizon

texts.en:
Herizon is 44 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Herizon has been working hard to manage his clothing business. 

To help expand his business, Herizon has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of clothes and will help Herizon to generate greater profits and increase on his income. Herizon hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Herizon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Herizon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kijura, which is in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school.  For the past four years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more household items and will help Frank to generate greater profits and improve standards of living.  Frank hopes that, in the future, he will be able to start a building company. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Frank, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past four years, Judith has been working hard to manage her produce-selling business.

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy produce and will help Judith generate greater profits from higher sales. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her profits. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Judith who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more produce and flour to sell.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, who is 49 years old, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day. As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea.  

She wants to raise pigs for sale. However, her insufficient capital investment doesn’t allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy pigs. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her live standard. She would like to thank to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs to increase her income

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 59-year-old, single woman. She supports six children who are between the ages of 36 to six years old. She has been farming for over ten years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 11,000.

This is Mary's first loan with VFK (VisionFund Kenya), Kapsabet branch. She intends to buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay labour charges. The profits from her expanded business shall be used to pay fees for her two sons. She has a dream of living a financially stable life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: María Jose

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 8 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el muelle de la ciudad
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le gusto valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios ingresos gracias a su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, prepara almuerzos en su casa los mismos que entrega en el muelle de la localidad a marineros que llegan a esta ciudad, esto se le hace más fácil gracias a que su marido trabaja en dicho lugar realizando trabajos de carga y descarga de los barcos que llegan al lugar,  lleva 3 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella, sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Credit Group República Del Ecuador meets every fortnight in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by lots of people throughout the year and it is also known as a city with unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
María lives in this place, she is 26 years old, is married and has two children in that relationship who are 10 and 8 years old, they both study at school. Her husband works at the dock of the city.
María is a very determined woman who always likes to provide for herself and earn her own income thanks to her work. She has a business where she sells food. She prepares lunches in her house which she delivers to the local dock to sailors who come to the city. This is made easier for her as her husband works there carrying out work loading and unloading boats that come. He has been doing this for three years and it gives him good earnings.
This loan is to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies to prepare food. María has been in this Credit Group for four years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot, her dream is to move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 15  años  que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero. 
Doña Nelly es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y más en lo que ella le encanta que es la cocina, ella  tiene un restaurante  en casa de los padres,  allí  los fines de semana prepara deliciosas meriendas y también el resto de la semana entrega almuerzos en ciertas empresas de la ciudad, sus clientes siempre la prefieren por la variedad de platos que ella prepara y su sazón lo cual la hacen especial,  lleva más de  3 años en su negocio el cual le da para ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los crédito siempre le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
El Grupo De Crédito República Del Ecuador (Credit Group of the Republic of Ecuador) meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. It is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all seasons of the year, and for being a city with unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. 

Mrs. Nelly lives in the city of Manta. She is 39 years old, married and has one 15 year-old child who is studying in school. Her husband is a laborer. 

Mrs. Nelly is a a woman who has always liked to work, and what pleases her most is the kitchen. She has a restaurant in the house of her parents. On the weekends, she prepares delicious snacks there. Also, the rest of the week, she delivers lunches to certain companies in the city. Her clients always prefer her for the variety of dishes that she prepares and the flavoring which makes them special.

She has been involved in the business for more than three years. It allows her to earn a living. This loan is to purchase supplies to prepare the food. She has been in the Grupo de Crédito for 2 years and she likes it because the loan always helps her a lot. Her dream is to have a great restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is married and has one child.  He describes himself as loyal.  He operates a retail business, where he sells tomatoes, onions, oranges, and bananas.  He has been involved in this business for 4 years.  Harrison's business is located in a populated area, and his primary customers are locals. 

Harrison says that his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.  He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables.  His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.  He hopes that, in the future, he will have better living standards.  This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 15 years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her garments business. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase shirts, bedsheets, and coats to help Fatuma generate greater profits and personal development. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a boutique. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, bedsheets, and coats.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, John has been working hard to manage his fish vending business, where he sells fish.

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help John to generate greater profits and expand the business. John hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another outlet.

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 34-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, because her husband is the main income provider in the family and he is a soldier in the Lebanese army to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them for the coming school year. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them for the coming school year.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 37 years old and both of her children are in school.

Analyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Analyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shakira

texts.en:
Shakira is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children, 2 attend school.   They live in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. Shakira has  managed a retail shop for 6 years to sell bread, juice, soda, soap, and sugar. 

Shakira needs 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy bread, juice, soda, soap, and sugar and will help Shakira to generate greater profits and improve her welfare. Shakira hopes  to start a super market. 

Shakira is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shakira who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy  bread, juice, soda, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Emmy has been working hard to manage his furniture business.

To help expand his business, Emmy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy wood and polish, and will help Emmy to generate greater profits and expand the business. Emmy hopes that in the future he will be able to construct a bigger house by 2016.

Emmy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy wood and polish.

loans.name: Safiyan

texts.en:
Safiyan is a 38-year-old  married man with 4 school-aged children and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. Safiyan has  managed his retail shop for 2 years. 

To help expand his business, Safiyan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas,  mangos, avocados, and tomatoes. The loan will help him to generate greater profits and expand the business. Safiyan hopes to  operate on a large scale. 

Safiyan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Safiyan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas, mangos, avocados, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en:
Alaine is a married woman with three children ages 9, 4 and 2 years old respectively. For three years now, she has been engaged in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs. Her husband works in a private company.

Alaine is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed and material for pig pen renovation, such as cement, gravel, steel, galvanized iron, wood and to pay the labor fee. Her pigs will have a comfortable place to stay in a strongly built type of pen. She would be able to raise and sell high quality pigs. With these, Alaine's income will start to improve and she will be able to settle her finances.

She dreams of expanding her business to support the needs of her growing family including sending them a quality education for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and material for pig pen renovation

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 46 years old, married, and a father of four children.  He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.  Twenty years ago, he started planting vegetables to cover his family's needs and expenses.  He has gained experience in this domain from his parents; thus, he is well known in his region and has a good reputation among his customers.

Adnan is trying hard to develop his business.  To that end, he is taking a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy kidney beans and okra seeds to increase and diversify his production.  Adnan hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy kidney beans and okra seeds to increase and diversify his production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, and a variety of other items of clothing

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is a 41-year-old married man with five children. His children are 19, 17, 14, 10 and 5 years old. All of them are still attending school. 

Matia deals in agriculture, mostly growing tomatoes on a large scale. He supplements his income with rentals and a piggery. He works eight hours a day, six days a week.

Matia started his business in 2004 with the aim of getting money to increase his family income. He has requested this loan in order to buy herbicides for his tomato plantation. This will ensure the healthy growth of his tomatoes and therefore increase his output.

Matia's clients are traders from surrounding towns. His dream is to be the leading supplier of agricultural products in his area. His biggest challenge is limited capital, price changes for agricultural products, and long droughts.

He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy herbicides.

loans.name: Martha Stefania

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y no tienen hijos. Su esposo es chofer particular de una familia. Viven con los suegros.
Doña Martha es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, productos de Avon y productos chinos TIENS  (Suplementos Nutricionales, equipos para la salud, perfumería y cosméticos),  realiza las ventas de lunes a viernes por dos horas diarias, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días  y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende  perfumes, ropa y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para invertir en un nuevo negocio, va a criar cerdos en un espacio que hay en la casa de los suegros, con el crédito va a construir un corral y comprar cerdos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los requisitos son pocos. Su sueño es tener casa propia y que sus negocios crezcan.
texts.en:
Manta is considered to be the most important and popular of Ecuador's coastal towns because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches and its port with the deepest waters in Ecuador and South America.

24-year old Martha lives there. She is married and doesn't have any children. Her husband is a private chauffeur for a family. They live with their in-laws.

Martha looks after the home, but to earn money of her own and to help her husband with household expenses she sells clothing, Avon products, Tiens products from China (nutritional supplements, healthcare items, perfume, and cosmetics). She works Monday to Friday for two hours daily selling the products on credit and then collecting money weekly. All is going well. The most popular items are perfume, clothing, and cosmetics as they are good quality.

Martha is seeking a loan to start a new business raising pigs in a place next to her in-laws' home. She plans to use the money to build a corral and buy pigs. She is in her second loan cycle with her loan group and enjoyed being part of it because the loans are fast with few requirements. Her dreams are to have her own house and a successful business.

loans.use: Build a corral and buy pigs

loans.name: Ilse

texts.es:
Ilse es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella es una mujer que se esta sacrificando para poder ser una buena profesional y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su profesión. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ilse is from the town of Concepción. She is sacrificing a lot to achieve her goal of becoming a good doctor and being able to help others through her profession. She used her previous loan to pay for courses; the money was very useful for her.

Now Ilse is asking again for a loan to pay for her studies so she can continue as she has been doing.

loans.use: Pay for her university courses

loans.name: Emmamuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 42-year-old married man with 3 children ( 3 attend school) and lives in the town of Kiboga in the Hoima region of Uganda. 

 Emmanuel has managed his stationary shop for 4 years to sell pens, books, pencils, files, and flip charts. 

Emmanuel has requested 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to expand his business. The loan will be used to buy paper, books, pens, and generate greater profit.. Emmanuel hopes to become a stationary supplier. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy paper, books, and pens.

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.ru: Садафмо добрая женщина из не большого города под названием Куляб. Кулябцы славный и общительный народ. Садафмо в том числе отличается своим чувством юмора и чистой душой. Она занимается выпечкой и продажей традиционных лепешек. Садафмо печет лепешки и вывозит на продажу на рынок. Она решила расширить деятельность, путем увеличения количество товара. Она надеется, что для этой цели она получит кредит и расширить деятельность. На заемные деньги она собирается приобрести дрова и муку. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Sadafmo is a kind woman from a small town called Kulob. Kulob residents are fine and sociable people. Among them, Sadafmo is distinguished by her sense of humor and pure soul. She is engaged in baking and selling traditional flatbreads. Sadafmo bakes flatbreads and takes them for sale at the market. She has decided to expand her business by increasing her amount of goods. She hopes that she will receive a loan for this purpose and expand her business. She will buy firewood and flour with the borrowed money. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy firewood and flour.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread,juice,soda,soap,sugar,bananas, mangoes, avocados,tomatoes, and will help David to generate greater profits and improve business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to improve business. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas

loans.name: Sedress

texts.en:
Sedress is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sedress has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Sedress has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Sedress to generate greater profits and improve business.

Sedress is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sedress who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 35-year-old married man with 4 children ( 2 attend school)  living in the town of Kiboga in the Hoima region of Uganda.  Fred has managed his retail shop for 4 years. 

Fred has requested 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, rice, beans, maize flour, and basins. It will help Fred to generate greater profits and purchase a grinding machine. Fred hopes to have a maize grinding machine. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, beans, maize flour, and basins.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo is a 56-year-old married man with 6 adult children.  He has traded livestock  for ten years and earns 25,000 per month.

He requests 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya as his first loan  to purchase more cattle.  The profits will be used to expand his business and open a new one.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Chendaa

texts.en:
Chendaa is 29 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia.  She has no children.  To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of land, primarily growing rice and selling her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. 

She has been in this type of business for approximately ten years.  On average, she is able to earn $5 (USD) per day.  At this time, she would like to request a Kiva loan (via HKL) to buy a motorbike.  This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can travel conveniently.  She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 51-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has owned a cosmetics shop for the past 13 years. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. 

Tasleem's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics (such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories) for reselling. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not able to buy these items for business purposes. Therefore, Tasleem has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also help him earn a profitable income to fulfill the needs of his family.

Tasleem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to help expand her husband's cosmetic business.

loans.name: Oyniyaz

texts.ru: Ойнияз уроженка Кабадиянского района. Она интеллигентная и мудрая женщина. Ей 60 лет. Ойнияз работает учительницей. Она преподает химию и биологию в одной из школ своего района. Она очень хорошая учительница и все жители района очень уважают её. Её зарплата маленькая и, к сожалению, она не может, позволит себе многого. Но сейчас ей очень нужно отремонтировать свой старый дом, который находится в ветхом состоянии. Она хочет, закончит ремонт до наступления холодов. Однако её средств не хватает и поэтому она обращается к Вам за кредитом и верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Oyniyaz is a native of the Qubadiyon region. She is an intelligent and wise woman. She is 60 years old. Oyniyaz works as a teacher. She teacher chemistry and biology in one of the schools in her area. She is a very good teacher and all of the residents of the area respect her. Her salary is small and, unfortunately, she cannot afford much. But now she really needs to renovate her old house which is in a dilapidated condition. She wants to complete the renovation before the cold weather begins. However she does not have sufficient funds, and so she is turning to you for a loan and believes in your support.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 27 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her retail business.

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas, mangos, avocados and tomatoes, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and expand the business. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another plot of land.

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread, juice, soda, soap and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase: plantains, potatoes, yucca (cassava) salt, sweets, etc. to be able to continue with her sales

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Solomon has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Solomon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas, mangoes,avocados, tomatoes and will help Solomon to generate greater profits and increase capital. Solomon hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire more income. 

Solomon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Solomon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more bread, juice, soda, soap, sugar, bananas, mangoes,avocados, tomatoes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 33-year-old married woman with 1 school-aged child.  They live in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda.  Alice has raised poultry for 4 years. 

Alice has requested 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy poultry feed.  The profits and increased daily income will be used to build rental units. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children (2 attend school). They live in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. Edward has managed his produce business for 7 years. 

Edward has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy beans and maize. Edward will generate greater profits and provide basic needs for the family. Edward hopes to become a big supplier. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 28-year-old married man with 1 child who lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. Godfrey has managed his retail shop for 3 years. 

Godfrey has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy posho, rice, and groundnuts,  Godfrey to generate greater profits and earn higher profits. Godfrey hopes to finish the house. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy posho, rice, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn is a 53-year-old  married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. He has two children and makes a living growing rice. He earns 5.00 USD per day. 

He needs a loan to buy a construction materials to build a house. He is thankful to the lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies for university.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Genie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Genie requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Genie has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Genie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a teacher who works in a local village school in the village of Gyulibulagh in the  Shirak region.  Anna tutors her students in her house after school and provides  individual classes. She  has 7 students and is very proud of her work as teacher. Anna asks lenders for support to purchase a printer, PC, and big table.
 
Anna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Anna hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support and improve her work as a teacher.

loans.use: to buy a printer, PC, and a big table.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 37 years old. She is an honest person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling milk for many years and generating a reasonable income for his family. He makes every effort to provide comfort to his family members.

Kishwar's husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in his locality and bull calves to the butcher. He has a few buffaloes and cows. He produces milk two times a day from his herds. He provides door-to-door milk to his customers and takes money on a monthly basis. He found that he could produce more milk from buffaloes instead of cows, so he has a plan to buy an additional buffalo. 

However, the price of a buffalo is more than a cow and he does not have enough savings to buy a buffalo. Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy one buffalo for producing more milk.

Kishwar's husband wants to keep buffaloes instead of cows to grow his business. He wants to maintain his cowshed as well. He hopes that he will be able to buy a buffalo and increase his income.

Kishwar gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for her husband's milk selling business.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a responsible housewife who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing taxi service for the last many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Kaneez's husband needs to replace the tyres of his vehicle because they are in poor condition Therefore Kaneez has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help him make the purchases.

Kaneez is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to replace her husband's taxi car tyres

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es:
El Sr. Antolin es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio esta saliendo adelante y se gana la vida de una manera digna por medio de sus negocios, y con esto ayuda a su familia.Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en comprar embutidos y queso para la venta.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para la compra de queso en cantidad para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Antolin is a very hard-working person who sacrifices in order to move ahead.  He makes a living in a dignified manner through his business and uses it to help his family.  

He says that he used the previous loan to buy sausages and cheese to sell.

Today he is requesting a new loan to buy a large amount of cheese so that he can continue on with his sales activities as he has in the past and fight to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printed and embroidered cloth for her husband's embroidered cloth selling business.

loans.name: Joeven

texts.en:
Joeven is 41 years old, married  and has three child to provide for. For the past five years, the store, the family's only means of support, has been doing well. 

Joeven has requested a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. He plans to expand the store in order to gain more income for the family's needs. 

Joeven’s plans for the future are to sustain the family's daily needs and to save money for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 27-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons. Her husband owns an electronics shop in which he offers televisions and LCD TVs as retail and in installments as well. He sells brands of TVs and LCD TVs such as Sony, Samsung, LG, Nobel and Panasonic. He also offers one-year warranties for those electronics products. 
Her husband wants to grow his business and wants to offer more electronics to his customers but he does not have enough capital for investment. So Nargis requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan, her husband will buy more electronics to sell in installments and through retails as well.

 Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her husband's electronics shop business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Christine has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which deals in charcoal sales. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and will help Christine generate greater profits and educate her children. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to create more business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en:
Nemfa is 49 years old, married and has six children to provide for. For 26 years she has been running this sari-sari store that sells goods in their community to earn a living. Despite the small income they earn, they continue to work for it and gain more income to meet the daily needs of her children. She took a new loan to buy additional stock for her store to provide for the needs of her community by selling goods.

Nemfa's plan for her future is to earn more profit and expand her business to support her children's educational needs.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. The difficulties of life for Palestinians in Lebanon and the low financial situation of his family didn’t affect his will. He is still continuing his university studies as well as deciding to manage his father’s small grocery shop. It has allowed him to learn more about business rules, especially since the store is located inside his house. 
Now, he is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify his business merchandise with new products and special offers to satisfy his customers needs inside the camp. 
Mohammad hopes to improve his shop and gain more profit, which will help him build a better future.

loans.use: to increase and diversify his merchandise with new products and special offers.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 24 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her retail business, which operates out of a retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more retail materials for the shop and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and complete her house. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a supermarket. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more retail materials for the shop.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Since garbage, old materials, and scraps are being dumped in the Payatas Landfill, junk shops are a growing business in Payatas (located in the second district of Quezon City, Philippines).  Despite the competition there, Antonio calmly manages his business, putting God at the center of it. Antonio is very grateful to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for lending him a certain amount last year that helped him buy large amounts of scraps and used materials for his business.

Being a hardworking father, giving up is not an option for Antonio since he has children that he needs to support. He must provide daily needs for his family. That’s why he is contemplating ways of making his business more successful. The previous loan really helped him in his business. However, because of ongoing demands and price increases (even on scrap materials), Antonio is requesting additional capital of PHP 16,000 this year.

Antonio is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. They gain spiritual strength through members' life-changing testimony, share their own experiences of God’s love, pay micro-finance loans, and hear God’s word.

loans.use: to add up to his current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is 53 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of eight people, including three sons and three daughters. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop including threads, needles and clothing. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So, Kalsoom is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her stitching work.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es: Alma tiene 36 años, es soltera y vive en la Ciudad de México. Ella tiene una carrera técnica con una especialidad en administración de empresas, ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy activa, con muchos objetivos, su principal motivación es su familia. Hace cuatro años ella tenía un empleo relacionado con su carrera, sin embargo no cubría sus necesidades económicas y decidió renunciar. Con los ahorros que tenía en ese momento decidió buscar un lugar en renta, en el cual puso 4 computadoras y una copiadora, así  comenzó, posteriormente vendió artículos de papelería, accesorios para celular y computadoras y ofreció servicios como recargas telefónicas, líneas de captura, escritorio público y trámites oficiales. Hace año y medio tuvo la oportunidad de ampliarse y rentar dos locales, en los cuales metió 6 equipos más de computo e incrementó su catálogo de servicio a abarrotes y farmacia. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital, con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 ella podrá surtir completamente su negocio e invertir en  publicidad. A ella le motiva mucho satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y ofrecer una gama amplia de productos y servicios, está orgullosa de haber tomado la decisión de ser emprendedora, de nunca renunciar a sus sueños y de no tener miedo a sus competidores. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que le ayudaran con el préstamo,  para que siga expandiéndose y pueda abrir otra sucursal con el mismo concepto.
texts.en:
