Alma is 36 years old and single and lives in Mexico City.  She has a technical degree with a specialization in business administration.  She has always been a very active woman with many goals.  He principal motivation is her family.  

4 years ago, she had a job related to her degree.  However, it didn't cover her economic needs and she decided to resign.  She decided to look for a place to rent using the savings that she had at the time, where she installed 4 computers and a copy machine and started her own business.  She started out selling stationary shop items, cell phone accessories, and computers, and offered services such as recharging cell phone credit, OCR scan line service, letter writing, and official transactions. 

A year and a half ago she had the opportunity to expand and rent out two locales, where she installed 6 more computers and increased her catalog of services, groceries, and pharmacy items.  Her main difficulty is her lack of capital.  With a loan of 10,000 MXN, she will be able to completely equip her business and invest in publicity.  She is very motivated by the need to satisfy her customers and offer a wide range of products and services.  She is proud to have made the decision to become and entrepreneur, of never giving up on her dreams, and of not fearing her competitors.  She is very grateful to all of the people who help her with this loan so that she can continue to expand and be able to open another branch following the same concept.

loans.use: to completely stock her business and invest in advertising and publicity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soy sauce, cooking oil, skewers, catsup, chicken, and pork.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey, a 30-year-old married father of one, lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past six years, he has been working hard to manage his timber sales business. 

To help expand, Geofrey has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more timber. This will help him to  generate greater profits and business growth. He hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to expand the business. 

Geofrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more timber

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Binura, who is in her early fifties is single with five children; three of them are still in school and two of them are grown up. She has been selling clothes for eight years now. She works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Binura's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing her stock of clothing and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support. She used her profit to pay for school fees, build her own house, buy a TV set, radio, and cupboards, to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the latest styles on the market to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of building another house.

Binura will share this loan with her loan group Peacock, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the latest styles on the market and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is 46 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Janat has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which deals in selling spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts and will help Janat to generate greater profits and improve her business. Janat hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits. 

Janat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Janat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, tienen dos hijos que ya no viven con ellos, no tienen ayuda del extranjero, sus actividades económicas son la comercialización de ganado y venta helados, lo cual hace desde hace cinco años, así ha podido subsistir con su familia.
Con la idea de mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio solicita un crédito para comprar ganado, le será de mucha ayuda para atender a nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, sabe desempeñar sus actividades por lo que no representa riesgos.
Sus aspiraciones son resarcir su deuda, disminuir las necesidades de su hogar y lograr remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in his own home with his life partner. They have two children who no longer live with them, and they have no help from abroad. His economic activities are selling cattle and ice cream, which he has done for five years. That's how he and his family have been able to survive.

He's requesting a loan to buy cattle to improve the profitability of his business. It will be a big help to him in serving new customers and increasing his income. He knows how to do his job, so there are no risks involved.

Miguel's goals are to pay back his debt, reduce his household needs, and be able to remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy cattle.  It will be a big help to him in serving new customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old. She is married with two children. She has been in the cereal business for the last six years and the business has been earning her  an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Alice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000. She will be using the loan to purchase more cereal to sell to her clients in the market.

She plans to use the earned profits to repay her loan and the surplus to provide food to her family. Her hope and dream for the future is to have a better business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal to sell to her clients in the market.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 45 years old. He is married with seven children. He has had a maize-selling business for five years. He will be using the loan to buy more maize for resale and hopes this will enable him to earn more income in order to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business, make more income, have a better house and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, inicio a vender antojitos hace cinco años, ahorro para emprender su propio negocio, trabaja sábados y domingos, partir de las dos de la tarde en adelante, es así como puede generar ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar; ella vive en casa propia con su hija de 20 años de edad.
Solicita un crédito para comprar yuca, aceite, papas, condimentos, plátanos, etc., para preparar la venta de antojitos como papas fritas, tostadas de plátano, etc., el propósito de la inversión es aumentar la productividad de su negocio para aumentar sus ganancias y así tener liquidez para cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos permanente y salir adelante con sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Reina started selling appetizers 5 years ago.  She saved up to start her own business and works Saturdays and Sundays from 2 in the afternoon onwards.  Her business allows her to bring in income to pay for the household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her 20-year-old daughter. 

She is requesting a loan to buy yuca, oil, potatoes, condiments, and bananas, among other ingredients, to make appetizers to sell such as fried potatoes and banana tostadas, among others.  Her intention behind this investment is to increase the productivity of her business to boost profits and therefore have enough liquidity to pay back her debt.  

Her dream is to continue to expand her business in order to have a permanent source of income and get ahead with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy yuca, oil, potatoes, condiments, and bananas, among other ingredients, to make appetizers to sell such as fried potatoes and banana tostadas, among others.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hard working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past one year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in clothes.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her life style. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well stocked shop.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en:
Nazeer is a 58-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small business, selling clothes from his shop. He purchases clothes from market for low prices and sells them for a profitable price in his community. 

The people in town like his clothing collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because he has built up very good relations with his customers. Therefore, he has decided to increase his current business. Nazeer requested a loan so that her husband can buy more stock of clothing to fulfill the demand. 

Nazeer wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams of providing a better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing for her husband's business.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
PHOEUN, 37 years old, is living in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is hardworking mother of one child. She lives with her son and mother in Gyumri town.

Sona works as a waitress in one of the local restaurants. She also provides buffet service during special events and is very talented.

To be able to develop her buffet service, Sona needs some investment. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing supplies and materials (tables, tablecloths, special knives) needed for providing her buffet organizing service work.

Sona has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Sona and she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and materials (tables, tablecloths, special knives) needed for providing her buffet organizing service work.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gari Village. Murtala joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, he suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Murtala will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Murtala now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a 54-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte (Philippines). Her husband is a fisherman while she buys and sells salted and dried fish for a living. She has been doing this business for four years. She works hard to provide the needs of her eight children. 

Avelina is requesting a loan to continue running her business. She needs funds to buy salted and dried fish. In the future, she wants her business to become sustainable in order to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy salted and dried fish.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
28-year-old Rosita engages in freshwater fish cage culture for her livelihood.  She grows and sells fresh fish to the locals in the community. To have a supplemental income, she also engages in a firewood vending business. It has been four years now since she has been engaged in this kind of business.

Rosita hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol (Philippines).She is married and has two young children, ages seven and four years old. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fish feeds. With these, she would be able to sustain her current source of income. As a result, she could pay her obligation and roll out her capital.

With this loan, Rosita could begin expanding both of her sources of income and become more productive. Thus, Rosita could provide the basic needs for her children and improve her family's living conditions as well.

loans.use: to buy fish feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the first installment at a new locale where she will start her new fast food business  and to buy primary ingredients for making the food.

loans.name: Sofia Jeannette

texts.es: Sofía de 23 años es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por sus padres, una hermana y su hijo de 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones para dama y caballeros además helados como paletas y sorbetes desde hace dos años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación la cual está ubicada en un lugar muy concurrido de personas por lo que se ha hecho de una gran cantidad de clientes por la calidad de la mercadería y sus precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ayuda a solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan y además brindar a su pequeño hijo toda la ayuda necesaria. Sofía está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de ropa como: pantalones, ropa interior, licras, blusas, además lociones y helados como: paletas y sorbetes  por mayor para aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sofia is 23 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her family group, composed of her parents, a sister, and her 3-year-old son. She has been selling clothing, lotions for women and men, and, in addition, frozen treats such as popsicles and sorbets.

Sofia's business is located in her home, which is in a place with lots of foot traffic. That's why she has a large number of customers, plus the quality of her products and her low prices. What she manages to earn from sales, Sonia can help with some of the household expenses and, in addition, she can offer her little son all that he requires.

Sofia is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase clothing such as pants, underwear, lycra garments, blouses, and lotions, plus frozen treats such as popsicles and sorbets at wholesale, in order to augment sales and obtain better earnings and, thus, offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell, including pants, underwear, lycra garments, blouses, and lotions, plus frozen treats such as popsicles and sorbets for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her drugstore, which operates in human medicine. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs and will help Aisha generate greater profits and improve her welfare. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more drugs for her drugstore

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking woman. Ruth is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Ruth has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which deals in cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items, and it will help Ruth to generate greater profits and improve her restaurant. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to to return to school. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more food items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hard-working woman. Rebecca is 25 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy household commodities and will help Rebecca generate greater profits and educate her child. Rebecca hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy household commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergent, canned food, soy sauce, cooking oil, sugar, seasoning, biscuits, soft drinks, powdered fruit drinks and shampoo

loans.name: Dora Nelly

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 38 años de edad, una persona diferente, que le gusta innovar, es soltera y se vale de su negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento de ella y las personas que habitan en su hogar.
Guiada por sus gustos en la música y la preparación de Eventos, Dora, decidió comenzar un negocio que era ofrecer servicios de realización de eventos musicales y empeñada en el proyecto decidió invertir ahorros, prestar un dinero para comprar los implementos necesarios con los que comenzó su empresa en el  año 2005.
Con el firme propósito de mejorar sus ventas, cubrir eventos de mayor magnitud, ser competente y crecer como empresa, Dora, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos amplificadores que serán una herramienta muy importante en la presentación de sus eventos.
texts.en:
Dora is 38 years old and a unique individual. She likes to innovate; she's single and her business serves to generate the income necessary to support herself as well as the people who live in her household.

Guided by her tastes in music and event organization, Dora decided to start a business which was to offer event production services for musical events. Determined on this project she decided to invest savings and borrow money to buy the necessary equipment with which she began her business in the year 2005.

With the firm purpose of improving her sales, covering larger events, being proficient and growing as a business, Dora wishes to request a loan for the purpose of buying two amplifiers which will be an important tool in the presentation of her events.

loans.use: to buy two amplifiers.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 33-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children.  Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges from his shop.

Farina's husband is currently interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him increase his net income and savings. However, due to lack of money, he finds this difficult to do. Therefore, his wife Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can help her husband buy a greater variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. Her husband wants to use the profit to grow his business in the future. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for her husband's shop

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a hard-working young woman. Bridget is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Bridget has been working hard to manage her hair dressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Bridget has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase items for the salon, and will help Bridget generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Bridget hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Bridget is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase items for her salon

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is a hard working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; neither is currently in school. For the past three years, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in clothes.

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for the family. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to acquire land.

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a hard working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which deals in eggs and chicken.

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase feed and vaccines, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and improve family welfare. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse.

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wood, metal sheeting, cement, gravel and sand for construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Ivon

texts.en:
Ivon is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Ivon has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which deals in broilers.

To help expand her business, Ivon has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase poultry feed, and will help Ivon to generate greater profits and improve the family's welfare.

Ivon hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children.

Ivon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo is a hard working woman. Victo is 23 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Victo has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Victo has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Victo to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Victo hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve business. 

Victo is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng, who is 47 years old, is living in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

Yeng wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Chhoem is 53 years old and lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. Chhoem has been in business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $3 a day. Chhoem wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, Chhoem can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita engages in farming. She grows and sells watermelon. For almost 12 years now she has engaged in watermelon farming. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Aside from farming, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like soap, cooking oil, noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, soft drinks and seasonings.

She is a married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 8.
Her husband earns a living by being a habal-habal (motorcycle) driver.

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and supplies for the store, like energy drinks and soft drinks. The presence of these will enhance the contents of her store and attract buyers to shop.

Thus, Lolita could improve the yield of her farm and improve the earnings of the store as well.

She is hoping that, with proper management of her livelihood, she could also continue to finance the schooling of her children fora brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of his tricycle's main body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle such as tires and oil and to pay for maintenance such as vulcanizing

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Tonny has been working hard to manage his bar business, which deals in soft drinks, spirits and beer.

To help expand his business, Tonny has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase drinks for the bar, and will help Tonny to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Tonny hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

Tonny is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tonny who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase drinks for the bar.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 36 years old, single, and blessed with three children. She has a food stall in Kapsabet town and has been in this business for more than 4 years. She plans to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for use in her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to serve more customers and earn more income to support her family.

Stellah will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay for school fees. Her future hopes and dreams are to open a big hotel and earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for use in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:
Isyaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunkumi Village. Isyaku joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Isyaku suffered from poor yields, which crippled his ability to improve his farming skills.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isyaku will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isyaku now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Daphnie

texts.en:
At the age of 18, Daphnie is already married and has a one-year-old daughter. Her husband is a welder, while she sells barbecue in their place. She has been in this business for a year and works hard for the future. 

Aside from selling barbecue, Daphnie is engaged in a hog-raising business. For this business, she needs funds to buy additional piglets and feed. This will improve her livelihood. In the future, she wants to expand both of her businesses to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is a married man with two dependents. He lives in Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in a scrap material buying business for more than 5 years now.  He buys and sells scrap materials like empty plastic bottles, cans, a piece of iron, and other metals. He needs additional capital to finance his on-going livelihood.

Larry has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more scrap materials such as old chicken pens made of iron, tins, and other plastic materials. These will boost Larry's current livelihood and enable him to sell more and improve his income as well. Thus, he could start to handle his finances and be able to afford healthy diets for the whole family.

He is hoping that his business will be successful for him to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children. He has had a second-hand clothes selling business for 10 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. He hopes this will help him to get more income to support his family and to pay for school fees for his children. 

Paul's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow his business and open a boutique, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is engaged in rice farming in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children. The youngest is 10, and the eldest is 22. Marcosa is a hardworking woman who is also engaged in catching crabs for supplemental income.

Marcosa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and to pay for hand-tractor labor. She is confident in what the loan can do for her business. She hopes to increase her income from her business so her children can go to school. In the future, she plans to venture into other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for hand-tractor labor

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Con tan solo 18 años de edad, Maribel se encuentra solicitando un apoyo, un aliento económico para comprar un carro de comidas rápidas, la necesidad radica en que ella es madre soltera de un pequeño de 2 años de edad. 

Su principal propósito es tener una entrada de dinero para el manteamiento de su pequeño y mejora de sus condiciones de vida. 

Maribel quiere salir adelante esforzarse, darle un futuro prometedor a su pequeño, espera que le puedas brindar la oportunidad y que sea el comienzo de una vida como independiente llena de éxitos.
texts.en:
Just 18 years old, Maribel is requesting a loan, fincancial support to buy a fast-food cart. Her need is based on the fact that she is the single mother of a 2 year-old child. 

The main purpose is to have a source of money for the support of her little one and for the improvement of their living conditions. 

Maribel wants to get ahead, strive, and give her little one a promising future. She hopes you can provide her an opportunity and that this will be the beginning of a life full of successes as an independent worker.

loans.use: buy a fast-food cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of his tricycle and to buy a spare tire.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is shown in the photo with her husband, who has been providing flour-grinding services in their community. Her husband knows very well the techniques of grinding flour finely. He earns enough to support the family's needs.

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Shazia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 100,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). The loan will help her husband to cater to more customers, which will ultimately help generate more cash. Shazia wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Jennifer Alexandra

texts.es:
Jennifer es una hermosa mujer que ante la falta de oportunidades laborales, opto por volverse independiente e iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía, actualmente distribuye calzado, ropa y accesorios, su tenacidad, perseverancia y su mente ganadora la han llevado a convertirse en el pilar económico de su casa y a proyectarse hacia un futuro prometedor y más rentable, por ello en base a sus ventas aspira para principios del próximo año tener un local propio y expenderse a barrios   y pueblos.

Jennifer necesita apoyo es por esta razón que llega a la corporación Interactuar para encontrar un sí, un sí que significara progreso ya que con el capital solicitado comprara surtido de calzado, ropa y accesorios.

Jennifer, le explicaron que es  Kiva y se siente motivada de participar en una maravillosa alianza que tiene como finalidad apoyar a emprendedores con ganas de salir adelante como ella.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a beautiful woman who, given the lack of employment opportunities, opted to become independent and start a business selling merchandise. Currently she sells shoes, clothing and accessories. Her tenacity, perseverance and winning mentality have made her the economic pillar of her home and she is headed for a promising and more profitable future. Based on her sales she aspires to have her own shop by the start of next year and retail to neighborhoods and towns. 

Jennifer needs support and that's why she came to Interactuar, to find a yes, a yes that signifies progress, since with the capital she's requesting she will buy inventory of shoes, clothing and accessories. 

Jennifer was explained what Kiva is and she feels motivated to participate in a marvelous partnership whose aim is to support entrepreneurs like herself who are motivated to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy inventory of shoes, clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kunkumi Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Laazarus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Laazarus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Laazarus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 39 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two sons and one daughter and all are in school. Her husband has been running a business selling clothes for six years, Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Kousar is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help her husband purchase clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 
Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband buy clothing for his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Alex has been working hard to manage his hardware business which deals in hardware items like cement cables and wires.

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items, and will help Alex to generate greater profits and improve business.

Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to improve business.

loans.use: buy more hardware items,.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes estudia la carrera de enfermería porque le gusta ayudar a las persona y más aun a lo más necesitados y así también ayudar a mi familia.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y ser ejemplo para los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus metas y para cumplir con sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is studying for a degree in Nursing because she enjoys helping people, especially those who are in need the most. She also wants to help her family. Lourdes is a very determined individual who wants to get ahead and be an example for others.

She is requesting this loan so that she can pay the fees for her degree. This will allow her to continue toward her goals and to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is 42 years old, has four children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been working for a public sector organization for many years, He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Rizwana provides sewing services and earns income to help her husband with household expenses. 
She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business. Due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these sewing accessories and also help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a Babban Gona farmer from Katsalle Village. He joined Babban Gona to obtain better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Tukur no longer has to worry about having adequate income to purchase better inputs to increase his yields. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds, which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will increase his income considerably.

This season, Tukur has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Tukur now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Madaki Dutse village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm.

Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having adequate income to repair his house or move into a bigger home.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably.

This season Ibrahim has ambitious plans to harvest 60 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. Two years ago, she started selling clothes and scarves in an attempt to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. 
Fatima is a hard-working and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. She is trying desperately to develop her business. So now, she is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new, fashionable collection of clothes and scarves.
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new, fashionable collection of clothes and scaves

loans.name: Roerun's Group

texts.en: Roerun is 51 years old and lives in Battambang province. She is a mother of two dependent children. To support her family’s living, Roerun  grows rice and works on others' farms to get additional income. She has been involved in her work for 10 years. Roerun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan previously which she repaid completely. With her previous loan, she supported her children’s education and provided better support for her family. Due to a lack of funds, she decided to lead a group to apply for a new loan from VisionFund. As the leader of three, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide and to pay labor fees for supporting her rice farming. She hopes that this loan will help her get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide and to pay labor fees for supporting her rice farming.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 36 years old; she is a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. 

She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ramon está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una de las 30 integrantes esta con una meta fundamental, el cual es poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hermenegilda a quien se le practicó la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y ha mostrado una mejora bastante, ya que ella es una mujer muy entusiasta y por sobre todo activa. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas variadas y frescas, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas, como ser bananas, naranjas, manzanas, piñas, y otros, de manera a poder cumplir con sus clientes y también poder seguir ofreciendo los buenos productos a los que los mismos están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The group named “San Ramon” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program. All 30 women have set a fundamental goal, which is to provide their families with everything that they were not able to have.

One of the members is Sra. Hermenegilda, who took part in the poverty elimination survey. She has demonstrated quite an improvement. Hermenegilda is a very enthusiastic woman, but above all else, she is very active. Her business involves selling various types of fresh fruit. Through her sales, she has the means to provide her loved ones a decent life without hardships.

Hermenegilda is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh fruit such as bananas, oranges, apples, pineapples, and other produce so that she can satisfy her customers. In addition, she will be able to offer them good products like the ones that they are accustomed to purchasing.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, apples, pineapples, and other types of fresh fruit.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora estudia Nutricion ella  es casada vive con su marido y su hijo en su propia casa ella  realiza trabajo ocasionales cuidando enfermos, y comenta que su objetivo es terminar su estudio y abrir un consultorio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isidora is studying Nutrition. She is married and lives with her husband and child in a home that they own. Isidora finds occasional work caring for sick people. She says that her goal is to finish her studies so that she can open a practice of her own.

Isidora is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Samuel Isaac

texts.es:
Samuel, utilizo el crédito anterior para fortalecer el taller de estructuras metálicas y realizar los trabajos de agricultura de la temporada, tiene clientes más satisfechos y mejores ingresos con los que ha podido cumplir con sus obligaciones, además ha incluido la venta de helados, su familia mantiene su núcleo y todos tienen un estado de salud óptimo.
Los créditos son un apoyo para mantener su negocio funcionando, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar un comprensor que necesita para pintar las estructuras metálicas, equipara su negocio para brindar calidad en sus trabajos y puntualidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Samuel used the last loan to strengthen this workshop for metal structures and carry out temporary agriculture work. He has more satisfied customers and better income which he has been able to receive from his activities. Additionally,  he has also begun ice cream sales. His family maintains their closeness and all of them have good health.

The loan helps support and keep his business running, which is why he has decided to request a new loan to buy an air compressor that he needs to paint the metal structures. He will equip his business to provide quality in his work and punctuality for his customers.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor that he needs to paint metal structures.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business in her home. Her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Uzma is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a Babban Gona farmer from Rafin Tabo village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Bitrus no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season, Bitrus has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Km 66 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Km  66 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas las integrantes están luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona que se destaca es la señora Blanca, quien ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de Chipas que realiza, un alimento típico paraguayo. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que está luchando para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser harina, huevos, mantecas, sal, leche y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con la elaboración de sus chipas.
texts.en:
The group named “Km 66” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. This group is located in the city of Caacupé and all of its members are striving to improve their living conditions.

One member who stands out is Sra. Blanca, who helps to support her family by selling “chipas” (traditional Paraguayan cheese bread) that she prepares herself. She is an enterprising woman who strives to grow and improve her conditions in life.

Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing her food such as flour, eggs, shortening, salt, milk, and other ingredients. This will allow her to continue making cheese bread.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, shortening, salt, milk, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania proviene de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, es muy sacrificada y para seguir su anhelos está estudiando, porque quiere trabajar,  y ser una buena profesional.
Tania está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Tania comes from a very modest and hardworking family. She is self-sacrificing and wants to continue her dreams of studying so that she can work and become a successful professional.

Tania is studying for a degree in Accounting. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees, which will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de concubinos, es una pareja joven, con un hijo, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda  es rustica de adobe con techo de calamina, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva seis años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, haba, arveja, cebada  y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Virginia se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo económico para la compra de insumos, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia lives in a rural area with her partner, which they live in the same household. She is a young women with one child. She studied until primary education. Her house is rustic made out of adobo with a corrugated iron roof, which lacks some basic services. She is a hard-worker and with a lot of optimism, she works day to day with her husband to obtain income to support themselves.

She works primarily in agriculture. She has been working for approximately six years in agriculture, where she grows and sells her harvest. From what she is able to harvest, she sells in provincial markets of the region and adjacent towns. The main crops that she plants are potato in large quantities, beans, peas, barley and others in lower quantities generally for their own consumption.

Mrs. Virginia needs to request a loan to buy inputs, this way she can increase her production, continue with her sales and obtain income to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to buy inputs (seeds), this way she can increase her production and obtain income to improve the quality of her life.

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en:
Nazli is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three daughters. Her children are in school. 

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes-selling for five years. He is only responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore, Nazli is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nazli is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Taseer

texts.en: Taseer  is a 36-year-old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. A few years ago, she started her business selling animals to help her husband run their household activities. She is a mother of 4 children.  Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR20,000 to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She hopes to grow her business in order to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Yarmila Lisseth

texts.es:
Yarmila es una joven mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de odontología. 
Ella es inteligente, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, responsable y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en la zona de ‘Miraflores’,  zona residencial caracterizada por encontrarse el estadio de futbol donde se celebran grandes eventos deportivos así como eventos musicales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.  
Yarmila  es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia inglés y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan en la confección de ropa folclórica, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de odontología y se encuentra en 4 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los síntomas de las enfermedades, le interesa la salud bucal de sus pacientes, Su carácter es de servicio, “ya estoy finalizando la carrera y me encuentro realizando prácticas profesionales para terminar con éxito necesito comprar unas piezas dentales…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que ya se encuentra en la etapa final, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de piezas dentales para terminar de estudiar. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y abrir un consultorio,  ella desea realizar la compra de piezas dentales para finalizar sus prácticas profesionales y terminar de estudiar. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Yarmila solicita un préstamo para la compra de piezas dentales para finalizar sus prácticas profesionales y finalizar la carrera.
texts.en:
Yarmila is a young woman of 28 years of age. She is single, has no children and is studying dentistry.

She is intelligent, committed, steadfast, sweet, caring, responsible and sincere. She studies at the public university located in the "Miraflores” area. This residential area is known for having the football stadium where they celebrate large sporting events as well as music events. The climate is cold and dry with temperatures that vary during the day from 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Yarmila is short and dark skinned and has brown eyes, an average physical build and long black hair, fashionably styled. Her mother tongue is Aymará which she no longer speaks because she studies English and lives in the city. She lives together with her parents who work in traditional garment making. They live in their own home, built from brick and cement with a sheet metal roof and wood floors. It has electricity, potable water and a sewage system. She is studying for a degree in dentistry and is in year 4 of the 5 years that the degree lasts. She enjoys helping people. She likes to understand the symptoms of the illnesses. The oral health of her patients interests her. Her character is one of service. She notes “I am now finishing my degree and carrying out professional practice and in order to successfully finish, I need to buy some dental pieces.”

The advantage of her studies are that she is already in the final stage. The disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy the dental pieces to complete her studies. Her dream is to finish studying and open an office. She wishes to purchase some dental pieces to finish her professional practice and complete her studies. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years she has been dedicated to this professional study. It is for these reasons that Yarmila is requesting a loan to buy dental pieces to finish her professional practice and complete her degree.

loans.use: to buy dental pieces to finish her professional practice and to complete her degree.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 35-year-old, married woman running an animals purchase-and-sale business with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 4 children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Rosa Emelina

texts.es:
Rosa, de 63 años de edad, siembra granos básicos todos los años, vive con sus 5 hijos y lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia.

Rosa, tiene una gran experiencia en la siembra de granos básicos, ya que en todas las cosechas del año realiza sus siembras, para comercializarlos posteriormente.

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para preparar las tierras y darle el mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos.

Ella sueña con colocar una granja de pollos, para tener ingresos adicionales a los de las ventas de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 63 years old. She grows basic gains every year. She lives with her 5 children and strives day to say to get her family ahead.

Rosa has great experience in growing basic grains, considering that in each yearly harvest she is able to grow her sow in order to sell it later.

Rosa needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the land and give adequate maintenance to her crops.

She dreams of setting up a chicken farm to obtain income in addition to the sales of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the land and give adequate maintenance for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, spare tires and to pay for potpot repair

loans.name: Elenilson De Jesus

texts.es: Elenilson tiene 41 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 9 años y 2 años de edad a quienes siempre busca la manera de sacar  adelante, es por ello que hace nueve años decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar como: sillas, hamacas, colchas, cubre camas, sabanas, etc.,  obteniendo hasta la fecha una gran cantidad de clientes que visitan su vivienda en la cual tiene ubicado su negocio. Por lo que se siente feliz de tener su pequeño negocio ya que es el que le permite obtener sus ingresos económicos. Elenilson desea realizar una inversión en su negocio ya que con el capital propio no logra cumplir la demanda de productos con la que cuenta, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: cubrecamas, sabanas, muebles entre otros, para poder cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elenilson is 41 years old and lives in his own house with this wife and two little daughters of ages 9 and 2. He is always looking for a way to improve life for his family, so nine years ago he decided to begin buying and selling home products, such as chairs, hammocks, quilts, bedspreads, and sheets. 

So far he has obtained a great quantity of customers who visit his home, which is where his business is located. He is happy to have his small business, which is his source of income. 

Elenilson wishes to make an investment in his business. His own money is insufficient to keep up with the customer demand, and so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bedspreads, sheets, and other products. This will enable him to fulfill the product demand that his customers request and thereby obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to invest in bedspreads, sheets, and other products, enabling him to keep up with customer demand and obtain greater earnings.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermana y cuatro sobrinos de 9 años, 12 años, 18 años y 16 años de edad. Walter se ha caracterizado siempre por ser un hombre muy trabajador y que busca superarse en la vida. Desde hace un tiempo, Walter brinda sus servicios a una institución; en la cual realiza ventas de repuestos de motocicletas, es así como ha ido  mejorando sus ingresos y dar apoyo en sentido económico a su familia. Anteriormente, Walter solicito un crédito, con el que pudo mejorar el techo de su hogar por lo que su familia y él están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que se les ha mostrado. Nuevamente  Walter solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder instalar energía eléctrica en su hogar ya que no cuenta con este suministro el cual hoy en día es una necesidad en el hogar. El comprara alambre eléctrico, tomacorrientes, lámparas, etc.,  y además el pago del servicio de instalación de energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Walter is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his mother, sister and four nephews, which are 9, 12, 18, and 16 years old. Walter has also been described as a hard-working man who seeks to improve himself in life.

For a while now, Walter provides services to an institution, where he sells spare motorcycles parts. This is how he has been able to improve his income and economically support his family. Previously, Walter requested a loan, with which he was able to improve the roof of his house. He and his family are very appreciative for the support that they have received.

Now, Walter is requesting a loan to FUSAI to be able to install electricity in his home, considering that he does not receive this service and which today is necessary for a home. He will buy electrical wire, outlets, lamps, etc., and also pay for the installation service for electricity.

loans.use: to purchase electrical wire, outlets, lamps, etc., and also to pay for the installation service for electricity.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora Lucia  es viviente del trópico  de Cochabamba, es migrante de la  provincia de Quillacollo, tiene 2 hijos  dependientes, tiene un lote urbano, la señora está afiliada a un sindicato, desde hace 12 años trabaja como agricultora  con la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo y así fueron trabajando  independientemente, el año pasado sufrió una pérdida de su producción donde perdió todo por las inundaciones por el desborde del río, con sus ahorros decidieron   realizar una nueva plantación de yuca, juntos están sobresaliendo con mucho esfuerzo y mucha dedicación a su  actividad,  son personas responsables trabajadores, su actividad económica es  productora de yuca y arroz tienen en producción  1  hectárea ½  de producción yuca y 25 bolsas de arroz, la señora solicita un préstamos para ampliar más  la producción de yuca, dicha producción generar buenos  ingresos  y así solventar a su familia y darle una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the tropics of Cochabamba. She immigrated from the province of Quillacollo. She has two dependent children and owns an urban lot. She belongs to a syndicate. She has worked as a farmer for 12 years, with the help of her husband and children. They also work independently. Last year, she suffered when her entire crop was lost due to the floods when the river overflowed. With their savings, they decided to plant more yucca. She and her family are moving forward together, with great hard work and dedication. They are responsible, hard-working people. She produces yucca and rice. She produces 1.5 hectares of yucca and 25 bags of rice.
She is requesting a loan to expand her yucca production. This production will generate a good income and support her family, giving them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her yucca production and have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Rosa Claudia

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa,  tiene 52  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es pescador. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Rosa para poder ayudarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar hace dos años empezó un negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales de pesca, vende (anzuelos, nylon, redes, entre otros) y también productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).Trabaja con la ayuda de una hija  pero es la señora Rosa la que mas atiende el local.   Su negocio lo tiene más de 2 años en su casa y con los créditos de la fundación lo ha ido incrementando.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales de pesca (plásticos, grapas y pulperos). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace12  años  y le gusta por la facilidad de los pagos quincenales. Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un local más grande con más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and visited spa in Ecuador for its beautiful and cozy beaches. It is the first deep water port in Ecuador and South America. Rosa lives here. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 older and independent children. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in their own home.

To be able to help her husband with the household expenses, Rosa started a business 2 years ago. She makes a living selling fishing materials. She sells hooks, nylon, nets and others, as well as selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works with the help of a daughter but Rosa is the one who spends the most time with it. She has had her business for more than 2 years in her home and with the loans from the foundation, it has been increasing. 

She is going to use this loan to buy fishing materials (plastics, staples, pulp extractor). She has been in the loan group for 12 years and she likes it for the ease of the payments. Her goal is to keep going with her business and to have a bigger store with more variety of products to satisfy the needs of her purchasers.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María tiene 39 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus tres hijos de 21 años, 17 años y 10 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace 5 años el cual le permite tener el sustento del hogar. María solicito anteriormente un crédito el cual invirtió en la mejoría de su granja para pollos por lo que no logro comprar mayor cantidad de pollos que era su objetivo principal, gracias a la buena experiencia solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI que le permita continuar invirtiendo  en su granja por lo que ella piensa comprar: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas con el propósito lograr aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y poder darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a 39-year-old single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children ages 21, 17, and 10. Her children are in school. Maria raises and sells chickens. She has been doing this for five years, and it allows her to support her household. She received a previous loan which she invested in improving her farm. For this reason, she did not invest in buying a larger quantity of chickens, which was her main goal. Thanks to her good experience, she has requested a new loan from FUSAI which will allow her to continue to invest in her farm. She will purchase chickens, feed, and vitamins in order to improve her sales and income and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to invest in buying chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, actualmente vive en casa propia únicamente con su compañera de vida y uno de sus hijos, otro de sus hijos ya se independizo y ha formado su propio hogar, don Víctor es empleado de la alcaldía municipal de su localidad como barrendero, en su tiempo libre se dedica a cultivar maíz, con las cosechas abastece de alimento a su familia y vende otra parte para tener ingresos extras.
Solicita un financiamiento para comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas para la milpa de repasto, espera tener cosecha de maíz sin problemas de plagas y más abundantes, la esperanza de Víctor es mantenerse trabajando para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus sueños son aumentar su área de cultivo, tener mayores ingresos para cancelar su deuda y ayudar a tener un estilo de vida familiar digno.
texts.en:
Víctor currently lives in his own home with his life partner and one of his children. His other children are independent and have formed their own homes. Víctor is employed by the municipal mayor of his town as a street sweeper. In his free time he works growing corn. With the harvests, he supplies food to his family and sells another portion to get extra income. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for a cornfield. He hopes to have a more abundant corn harvest without plague problems. Víctor's wish is to keep working to get ahead with his family. His dreams are to increase his growing area, to have larger incomes to pay off his debt and to help his family have a dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for a cornfield. He hopes to have a more abundant corn harvest without plague problems.

loans.name: Yerlis Maria

texts.es:
Yerlis es una mujer con 27 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, que por necesidad económica se dedica a vender mercancía de segunda desde su casa, de allí se generan los ingresos suficientes para Yerlis cubrir las necesidades básicas que su hogar amerita.
Su deseo es formalizar su negocio, abrir nuevos locales y generar empleo a las personas que mas lo necesitan.

Actualmente presenta una dificultad, cuenta con unos pedidos los cuales no ha podido cumplir por falta de capital, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara, estufas y ollas los cuales venderá a precios altos.

Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprarse una vivienda propia, poderle brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Yerlis is a 27-year-old woman who is hard-working and very humble. Due to economic necessity, she sells second-hand merchandise from her home. From this, she generates enough income for her family's basic needs.
She wants to form a business, open new storefronts, and generate employment for those who most need it.
She currently has a challenge: she has some orders that she has been unable to fill due to a lack of capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of cookers and pots to re-sell at higher prices.
Yerlis wants to work to achieve her dream of buying her own home. She wants to be able to offer her child a better quality of life and good economic stability.

loans.use: to buy cookers and pots to re-sell.

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
Vyacheslav is a taxi driver from Kapan town. He lives with his wife and two children who are 19 and 17 years old.

Vyacheslav earns a living for his family by driving a taxi. The car that he drives is old, but due to his nice professional attitude, people prefer to use his service. The loan is vital for this kind driver to be able to renovate the car and continue his work as a taxi driver.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Vyacheslav and he hopes to receive support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car to continue providing taxi service.

loans.name: Hernán Darío

texts.es: Hernán es un emprendedor hombre de 23 años de edad, que día a día en su tienda de víveres abastece a los habitantes del sector donde reside, ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla.  Él inició este negocio por sugerencia de su madre, quien consideró que existía la necesidad puesto que en la periferia no había negocios de este formato suficientes para la demanda del sector.  En la actualidad es una de las tiendas más concurridas por clientes, en ella ofrece un buen servicio y productos a precios de oportunidad.  Con dos años de experiencia ha logrado fidelizar a sus vecinos y como cada vez más su base de clientes se está expandiendo,  está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con víveres como aceite, arroz, enlatados, legumbres y demás productos de alta rotación.
