Con excelentes resultados, los cuales ha logrado conseguir por su esfuerzo y compromiso, Carlos está convencido que esta inversión obtedra descuentos por compras de contado, lo que le beneficiará en su promesa de buen servicio y precios de oportunidad.  Su meta a futuro es remodelar su vivienda y duplicar las ventas para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Hernán is a 23 year old entrepreneur, who supplies the people in the area where he lives day-by-day in his grocery store, located in the town of Barranquilla. He started his business as a suggestion from his mother, who thought there was a need for it because in the periphery there were not enough of these types of businesses for the demand in the area. 

Now it is one of the most popular stores for customers. It offers a good service and low priced products. With 2 years of experience, he has managed to build loyalty with his neighbors and his customer base is expanding every time. 

He is asking for his first CrediKiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a supply of provisions such as oil, rice, canned good, vegetables and other high turnover products. With excellent results, which he has achieved through effort and compromise, Carlos is convinced that this investment will get discounts for cash purchases, which will benefit him in his promise for good service and low prices. His future goal is to remodel his house and duplicate sales for next year.

loans.use: to buy a supply of provisions such as oil, rice, canned goods, vegetables and other high turnover products.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. She will use the anticipated products to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Alexandra Maria

texts.es:
Alexandra es una mujer con 37 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, un almacén con variedad de producto para diferentes tipos de personas.
Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, logro superar una crisis económica la cual vivió luego de separarse de su esposo, quien era el sostén del hogar.

Debido al poco surtido en su almacén, Alexandra se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual hará la compra de mercancía como perfumería, bisutería y ropa para dama, caballero y niño.
Con esto espera mejorar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener su vivienda propia, la cual le brinde una mejor estabilidad económica y una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a 37-year-old woman. She has recently started her own business, a store with a variety of products for different people.
She has had great success thus far. She overcame an economic crisis when she separated from her husband, who supported the household.
Because her store is not well-stocked, Alexandra is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as perfume, jewelry, and clothing for men, women, and children.
With this, she hopes to improve her sales and her income.
Her dream is to continue working until she achieves her goal of having her own home to provide better economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like perfume, jewelry, and clothing for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Erika Marisol

texts.es:
Erika, es una mujer trabajadora, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 8 meses de nacido, su esposo posee una moto-taxi con el cual trabaja.  

Erika, tiene negocio de destazo de res y cerdos, este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, quien se dedica a este negocio; cuando se casó decidió colocar su negocio en su casa y una de sus hermanas es quien le ayuda, pero ahora quiere colocar otro negocio de venta de comida a 600 metros de su casa.   

El préstamo que Erika, está solicitando será invertido para comprar cerdos para el destazo y para comprar insumos para la elaboración de la comida, porque cuenta con una plancha y con el local.   

Erika, desea que su hijo crezca sano y con buena salud, además desea incrementar su familia.
texts.en:
Erika is a hard working woman.  She studied until the 9th grade.  She lives with her husband and her 8 month old child.  Her husband has a motorcycle taxi business.  

Erika has a business butchering cattle and pigs.  She learned this business from her mother who works in the same field.  One of her sisters helps her.  When Erika married she decided  to set up her business in her house.  Now Erika wants to open another business selling food 600 meters from her house.   

The loan that Erika seeks will be used to buy pigs to butcher and to buy supplies to make food, as she already has a griddle and a locale.   

Erika hopes that her son grows up healthy.  She would also like to expand her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher and to buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Verónica Margarita

texts.es:
Verónica, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijas, las cuales todas estudian y su esposo trabaja como encargado de una casa de recreación infantil.

Verónica, tiene una tienda desde hace 2 años, fue por iniciativa propia que la coloco porque no habían muchas cerca de su casa, a parte de eso también tiene un pequeño puesto de comida, en donde vende almuerzos y sus tres hijas le ayudan a vender.

Verónica, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda y poder ofrecer más variedad, ya que de esa manera habrán mas ventas y eso significa mejores ingresos.

Verónica, sueña con que sus tres hijas lleguen a ser profesionales y que las ventas en su tienda aumenten.
texts.en:
Verónica went to school until the 8th grade. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 daughters, who are in school. Her husband works as a manager of a children's recreation home. Verónica has had a store for 2 years and it was by her own initiative that she started it because there were not many near her home. Apart from that, she also has a small food stall where she sells lunches, and her three daughters help her to sell. 

Verónica needs the loan to buy more products for the store and to be able to offer more variety. This way, there will be more sales and that means more income. Verónica dreams of her three daughters becoming professionals and that the sales of her store increase.

loans.use: to buy more products for the store and to be able to offer more variety.

loans.name: Claudia Nancy

texts.es:
Claudia es una trabajadora mujer de 50 años de edad, ella con sus habilidades manuales en la fabricación de hermosos accesorios para dama (ver foto), genera su sustento.

Claudia es una mujer solitaria, no tiene pareja, no tiene hijos, es por ello que trabaja fuertemente para no pasar necesidades, pero ella tiene un sueño que ha perseguido toda su vida el cual es comprar una vivienda propia y está noble mujer no descansará hasta alcanzarlo.

Solicita un apoyo financiero para la compra de materiales con los que fabricara sus bellas piezas 100% artesanales.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working 50 year old woman who with her hand crafting skills making beautiful accessories for women (see photo) generates her living.

Claudia is single and has no partner nor children. For this reason she works hard to have what she needs. But she has a dream that she has chased all her life which is to buy her own house and this noble woman won't rest until she achieves this.

She is requesting financial assistance to buy the materials she needs to fabricate her beautiful 100% handcrafted pieces.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials to make the marvelous items you can see in the photo.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 19-year-old single woman who covers her needs and expenses by working as hairdresser from her home. She learned this profession from a training institution. She is well-known among her customers and has a good reputation in her region.
 
Mona is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car, which will facilitate operating her business and allow her to visit her customers more easily.

Mona hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car, which will facilitate operating her business.

loans.name: Erika Isabel

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer con 31 años de edad, casada y madre de una menor con 7 meses de edad, debido a una situación económica bastante dura la cual vivió luego de su esposo quedarse sin empleo por 3 meses, Erika se dedicó a vender mercancía desde su propia casa.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos, pero su dificultad es que no cuenta con un buen capital de trabajo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niño, bolsos y bisutería.
Con esto espera seguir cumpliéndole a sus clientes, y que la sigan buscando por su buen servicio, calidad y economía.
Su deseo es seguir adelante con su trabajo, más adelante abrir nuevos locales y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesitan.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Erika is a 31 year old woman. She is married and the mother of a 7 month old baby. Due to the very hard economic situation that they lived in after her husband was without work for 3 months, Erika began to sell merchandise from her own home. She works every day for 8 hours a day. 

Currently, she has a large quantity of orders, but her difficulty is that she does not get a lot of money from her work. For that reason, she is asking for a loan to invest into buying women's, men's and children's clothing, bags and imitation jewelry. With this loan, she hopes to keep serving her customers and that they keep seeking her for her good service, quality and economy. Her dream is to keep going with her work, later opening new stores, and providing employment to the people who need it most. For this, she needs help from Interactuar and the collaborations of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothing, bags and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is 37 years old and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Sakeena provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute along with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sakeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 61-year-old farmer from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband farm rice for a living. This business existed when their children were still young. She is asking for a loan to finance her farming needs. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor.

Juana hopes to have an abundant crop and an increase in her yield in four months time. In the future, she hope to expand her land, to cultivate more and to be more sustainable in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Knight

texts.en:
Knight is 29 years old. She is married with two children. She has been in the cereals business for the last 10 years and the business has been earning her an income of KES 12,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000. She will be using the loan to purchase more cereals to sell in the market to her increased number of clients.

She plans to use the gained profits to repay her loan and the surplus to provide food to her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals to sell in the market to her increased number of clients.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 36 years old. She is married with two children. She has a second hand clothes selling business, which she has been runnning for three years. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of second hand clothes to sell in her shop and hopes this will enable her to make more income to educate her children and also buy them school uniforms.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income and thereby have a bright future with her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand clothes to sell in her shop. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 35 years of age and a responsible mother of two children, living in a small town near Lahore, Pakistan. Nasreen's husband had a job as a driver in a factory near the city, but they were paying him very low wages relative to the workload on his shoulders. Out of frustration, he decided to start his own transportation services business in the city by buying a new auto rickshaw. This business is very popular in the city. 

With his new business, Nasreen's husband hopes to fulfill the family's growing needs. Nasreen applied for a loan of 70,000 PKR to buy a rickshaw for her husband's business. She is very grateful to the Kiva team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this ray of hope in their dark times.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a 63-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She has been engaged in a manicure and pedicure business for 15 years. She also has another business selling food (snacks). Florencia works hard to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, cooking oil, food coloring and sugar. In the future, Florencia wants her livelihood to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, food coloring and sugar

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en:
Araqsya is from Mkchchyan village in the Ararat region. She lives with her mother-in-law and two kids because her husband and father-in-law are migrant workers.

To help her family earn their daily bread, Araqsya started her own business last year. She started to sell clothing. To be able to purchase new stock of summer collection clothing, Araqsya asks lenders for their support. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Araqsya and her newly started business activity.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of summer collection clothing.

loans.name: Diana Yudiely

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer con 25 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, dedicada a vender mercancía desde su casa, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del que hoy en día depende su familia conformada por sus padres y un hermano menor.
Trabaja solo en semana durante 5 horas diarias.

Actualmente cuenta con una gran cantidad de pedidos, pero debido al poco capital no ha podido cumplir con estos, es por ello que pide un auxilio económico con el cual comprar mercancía como jeans, blusas y camisetas.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de comprarse una vivienda propia, brindarle a sus padres una mejor estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de los colaboradores y prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Diana is a hard-working and very humble 25 year old woman who works selling merchandise from her house. She started the business out of economic necessity and today her family composed of her parents and a younger brother depend on it.

She works five hours per day during the week. Currently she has a large number of requests but due to limited capital she has not been able to fill them. So she is requesting economic assistance to buy merchandise like jeans, blouses and t-shirts.

Her dream is to continue working until she achieves the dream of purchasing her own house, providing her parents greater financial stability and a higher quality of living. To do this she is counting on the support of the contributors and lenders at Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like jeans, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred, 30 years old, is a single mother of one child. She has run an embroidery business for 10 years. Winfred will use the loan to buy thread, fabrics and other embroidery materials so as to serve more customers and make more income to provide for her family and expand the business. She will use the profits generated from her expanded business to educate her child and to provide basic needs such as food. Winfred's hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, be successful and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabrics and other embroidery materials to serve more customers and make more income to provide for her family and expand the business.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is 48 years old and is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman with two grown children. She has been engaged in a peanut butter business for four years now. This business allows her to earn PHP 8,000 per month. Her business is thriving because of the demand from people who like peanut butter for their bread.

She is asking for a loan to buy sugar, peanuts, and cooking oil. Jinna can anticipate an increase in her production and profits with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to have her own grinder to lessen her expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old. He is single and operates a motorcycle transport business, and it has been profitable. He has been in the business for 2 years. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he will use the loan to buy a motorcycle to serve more customers and hopefully make more profits to expand his business. 

He will use the profits generated from his expanded business to build a house. His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more motorcycles, make more income and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to serve more customers and hopefully make more profits to expand his business.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.en:
Luz Dary is 50 years old and is an independent businesswoman. Through her business selling food, she wants to change her economic reality and build a promising future for her children.

To improve her business and make it more attractive to customers, she needs to inject capital, but since she is a humble businesswoman with few earnings she does not have sufficient money. That is why through credit she is seeking the resources to build a nice restaurant.

Luz Dary asks for your help to buy materials: land, sand, adobe brick, cement, paint and wood. This will give her the opportunity to have a more lucrative business to build a future for her three children and perhaps someday buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy materials (land, sand, adobe brick, cement, paint, wood) to build her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renovate the school classes in order to attract more parents to bring more students.

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba, who is in her early 30s, is married and has three children. Two of them are at school and one of them is still small. Sahiba has been running three projects: selling charcoal, running a salon, and selling water for six years now. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Sahiba's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more salon products and sacks of charcoal and to fill her water tanks with water to sell. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. Sahiba is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. She used her profits to pay school fees and to buy a TV set, radio, and cupboards, as well as to repay her loans and cover household expenses. She dreams of owning a catering business.

Sahiba will make sure she pays back this loan within the scheduled timeframe.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment, sacks of charcoal, and more water to resell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which operates a retail shop. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, rice, groundnuts, sugar, bread and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and increase capital. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy posho, rice, groundnuts, sugar, bread

loans.name: Danfas

texts.en:
Danvas is aged 22 years old and supports two school going children . He has been in this business for the last four years, and the business earns him an income of KES.16,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase tires and tubes for better services to his motorbike. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production.His hopes and dreams are to change his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tires and tubes for better services for his motorbike

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 32 years old. She is a single mother of one child. She sells fruits, and has been in the business for ten years.

She will use the loan to buy more oranges and bananas to sell. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to provide for her family's needs.

She will use the generated profits from her expanded business to educate her child and expand her business, as well as service the loan. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a grocery store, make more income, and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more oranges and bananas to sell; she hopes this will enable her to make more income to provide for her family's needs.

loans.name: Zuleima Esther

texts.es: Zuleima laboró durante varios años en almacenes de ropa y calzado, experiencia que le permitió forjar su propio negocio; ella quedo desempleada y gracias a sus habilidades para las ventas, decidió ofrecer a sus amigos y referidos, prendas de vestir, calzado y bolsos.  Hoy en día su fuente de ingreso está representada en su actividad comercial, con la que ha podido aportar económicamente a su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad.  Zuleima no pierde detalle para fijarse en cualquier oportunidad de negocio que se le presente, ella ofrece algunos productos de consumo masivo a sus vecinos como carnes frías; salchichas, jamones y demás.  Su meta a largo plazo es abrir un local al público donde pueda surtir con mucha más variedad, sin embargo su capital es insuficiente para esta propuesta, aún necesita incrementar sus utilidades para poder hacer realidad su sueño de prosperidad y para acercarse más a su meta, ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir, calzado, bolsos y carnes frías.
texts.en:
Zuleima worked for various years in clothing and footwear warehouses.  This experience enabled her to build her own business.  She was unemployed but based on her sales skills decided to offer articles of clothing, footwear and handbags to friends and referrals.  Today her source of income is based on this business activity, which has allowed her to financially support her family, made up of her partner and two young children.

Zuleima misses no detail in focusing on whatever business opportunity presents itself to her.  She offers certain products of mass consumption to her neighbors such as processed meats, sausages, hams, etc.  Her long term goal is to open a public locale where she can stock much more variety.  However, her capital is insufficient for that proposal.  She still needs to increase her profitability in order to realize her dream of prosperity and to move closer to her goal.  She is applying for her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to invest in a new assortment of articles of clothing, footwear, handbags and processed meats.

loans.use: to invest in a new assortment of clothing items, footwear, handbags and processed meats.

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She operates a cafe and has been in the business for 4 years now. 

She will use the loan to buy more rice, maize flour, cooking oil and cereals for use in her cafe to serve more customers and make more income. She will use generated profits from her expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and make more income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, maize flour, cooking oil and cereals for use in her cafe to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María opta por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad que le dan de contar con capital para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para abastecer su negocio, la visión de María es mantener la variedad de sus productos para atraer más clientes.
El crédito anterior le ha permitido tener un negocio surtido, con lo que sus ventas están mejorando así como también sus ingresos, su familia continúa con el mismo número de miembros y le dan apoyo incondicional para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria is applying for a new loan because the access to capital will allow her to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to supply her business. Maria's vision is to maintain a variety of products to attract more customers. 
Her previous loan has enabled her to have an assorted business, improving her sales and also her income. Her family continues with the same number of members and give her their unconditional support to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to supply her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 36 years old, married and has one child.  

She attended a sewing courses in her municipality and started sewing. She sewed for her neighborhood, and now is making a living out of it.  With the help of her second loan from Maya, she will buy bolts of fabric.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Fatima Hanım 36 yaşında evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Belediyenin açmış olduğu dikiş kurslarına giderek bu konuda eğitim almış ve bu eğitimi ek iş fırsatına çevirmiş.  Çevresine dikiş dikerek para kazanmaya başlamış.  Maya dan 2.kredisini kullanan Fatima Hanım kredisi ile toptan kumaş aldı.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith comenzó a ser comerciante desde que era niña, pues iba a vender con su mamá al mercado, sin embargo, cuando creció vio la necesidad de ser independiente y que mejor forma de serlo que poniendo su propio negocio. Por ello, decidió comenzar vendiendo frutas en las afueras de un colegio, con el tiempo comenzó a ganar clientes y pudo ampliar sus ingresos, ofreciendo más productos. 
Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar mangos, jocotes, sandias, melones, naranjas, y demás productos. De esta forma podrá vender  frutas frescas y de calidad, en consiguiente,  aumentará sus ingresos económicos, los que planea  ahorrar para adquirir otro local más grande y seguro.
texts.en:
Judith began working as a merchant since she was a child, since she accompanied her mother to the market to sell goods. Nonetheless, when she grew up she saw that it was necessary to be independent and that the best way to do that was through starting her own business. That is why she decided to start selling fruits outside of a secondary school. With time, she began to win customers and was able to increase her income, offering many products.

For this reason, she requests a loan to buy mangos, jocotes [a local fruit], watermelons, melons, oranges and other products. In this way she will be able to sell fresh and quality fruits. As a result, she will grow her income, which she plans to save in order to acquire another locale which is bigger and more secure.

loans.use: to buy mangos, jocotes, watermelons, melons, oranges and other products.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kauser is a 32-year-old married woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Her husband is an auto rickshaw mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw repair workshop in the market. He also carries spare parts in the workshop. 

Kauser's husband needs to purchase some tools for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the required inventory. Therefore Kauser is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband buy workshop items such as tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Kauser is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy tools and spare parts for his auto rickshaw repair service

loans.name: Martha Group

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman, aged 45. She is a housewife and mother of three children. Martha is a very loving and caring woman and takes responsibility for her family. Her husband is the only bread winner for the family and works hard to make his family comfortable as much as he can, but they were facing some hard times so he was unable to buy fresh fruits for his shop for reselling.

Martha applied for this loan so that her husband could buy the stock for his shop. She is thankful to the Kiva team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es:
Flor, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, ambos son comerciantes y tienen 3 hijos de 9, 5 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian.

Flor, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 12 años, pero además con su esposo tienen una pequeña granja de cerdos. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar más frutas y verduras para el negocio y así poder salir a vender a los cantones cercanos. 

Ella sueña con tener un vehículo para vender frutas y verduras e incrementar sus ganancias y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor earned her high school diploma, is married, both she and her husband are merchants, and they have three children of 9, 5, and 3 years old. The two eldest are in school.

Flor has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for 12 years, but in addition, her and her husband have small pig farm.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more fruits and vegetables for the business, and thus be able to go out and sell to the nearby districts.

She dreams of having a vehicle for selling fruits and vegetables and to increase her income and give a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for the business

loans.name: Madeeha

texts.en:
Madeeha is 25 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a Murabaha loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.en:
Dilbarniso is a generous woman. She is 41 years old and lives in the district of Qumsangir with her husband and children. Her husband is a builder. Dilbarniso is a seamstress and she has engaged in this activity for the past three years. She sews national women's dresses and window curtains. 

Now Dilbarniso wants to expand her business, but she does not have enough money. Her husband's work is not good now. For this reason she applied for a loan. She will spend the money to buy different fabrics. Dilbarniso hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and expand her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 5 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which deals in spare parts items. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts and will help Rose to generate greater profits and increase capital. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail business, which deals in retail items. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household items, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and increase stock. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to increase sales. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more household items

loans.name: Moureen2

texts.en:
Moureen 2 is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Moureen 2 has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which operates in retail items. 

To help expand her business, Moureen 2 has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essential household items, and will help Moureen 2 to generate greater profits and business growth. Moureen 2 hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Moureen 2 is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moureen 2 who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy essential household items.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is an 18-year-old, single, Palestinian man. 

Due to the poor financial and social living conditions of Palestinians living in Lebanon, he left school at an early age and started working with his father selling potatoes and onions. 

He is now providing for the needs and expenses of his five member family. 

Ashraf is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is now managing his father's business. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his inventory of potatoes and onions.

Ashraf hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 54-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She earns a living by doing sari-sari store business. She has been in this business for 15 years. Aside from this, she also engages in other business like rice retailer. Delia’s husband helps her in doing this business. They work hard for the future to make a better living. In the future, 

Delia wants to expand her sari-sari store business and to raise a pig for additional earnings. As for now, she is requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice to sell and to buy additional grocery items such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, biscuits, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, chips, biscuits, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice and rice

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en: Hassane, a 42-year-old single Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian Refugee camp. He owns his own dental laboratory. He has been working in that field for the past eight years. Hassane is getting married and needs some financial support in order to prepare for the wedding and furnish his apartment. In order to do that, he needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. This support will allow him to start a family, as well as expand his work at a further stage by opening another laboratory.

loans.use: to prepare for his wedding and furnish his apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a variety of plant seeds, manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tricycle body repair

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, consiente que su clientela ha aumentado y que su inventario no le da la facilidad de cubrir las demandas de manera inmediata, hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos de la canasta básica para surtir la tienda ($ 400), pollos recién nacidos ($ 340) y el resto lo utilizara para remodelar las galeras de la granja, podrá seguir trabajando, dando un excelente servicio a sus clientes y brindara mejores cuidados a sus animales.
El crédito anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para fortalecer su negocio, con lo que sus clientes han ido aumentando, así como también sus ventas e ingresos, no ha enfrentado problemas para mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria, knowing that her clientele has grown and that her inventory does not cover her immediate needs, has applied for a new loan to buy staple goods to assort her store ($400), newborn chicks ($340) and the remainder to remodel the farm yards. She will be able to continue working, providing excellent service to her customers and giving better care to her animals.

The previous loan has greatly helped her to strengthen her business, through which her customers have been growing as well as her sales and income. She has not encountered any problems in keeping herself busy with work.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to assort her store ($400), newborn chicks ($340) and the remainder to remodel the farm yards

loans.name: Jooro

texts.en:
Jooro is a young entrepreneur from Tigbauan, Iloilo. He buys dried fish from suppliers then sells it per kilo to his neighbors and other contacts. His live-in partner, Juliet, assists him in his business by taking a turn to sell their products while watching over their child. Jooro can then drive his pedicab (a bicycle with an attached compartment for passengers) to boost his income. The pedicab doesn’t use gasoline or diesel to run; the pedicab driver is amazing because he uses his mere strength in transporting his passengers just to earn some money.

Jooro hopes that someday he can be a wholesaler of dried fish because it would give him a higher income for his family’s growing needs. To take another step towards this dream, he wants to take out a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy assorted dried fish in volume. This will enhance his buying power this rainy season when the price of fish gets expensive.

Jooro is an enthusiastic member of CCT, where he gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their lives and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish in volume

loans.name: Glorimel

texts.en:
Glorimel is 33 years old and has two children. She plans to increase her earnings to meet the needs of her children and give them a better life. She works hard for them. Glorimel earns a living through buying and selling ready-to-wear (RTW) items. She has been engaged in this business for three years.  

Glorimel she is seeking a loan to buy RTW items such as shoes, clothes, and beauty products like lotion, powder, and makeup. She also buys and sell rice for additional income.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, and beauty products like lotion, powder, makeup, as well as rice

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is shoemaker from Kapan town. He lives with his wife and two children. Armen works in his small workshop in the center of the town. He receives many orders from locals and is high quality shoe maker well known in the town.
 
Armen wants to open his own shoe store and sell shoes which he makes. He has applied for this loan to purchase supplies and materials needed for that. 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Your help is very important for Armen to make his dream to come true and he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and materials to open a shoe shop and sell the shoes that Armen sews himself

loans.name: Sisak

texts.en:
Sisak is an auto repairer from Ayntap village. 

His working process is as follows: he purchases damaged cars, renovates them and resells them. He is experienced and qualified in his work, and so he works with many clients during a month. Sisak is the main worker in his family of four. He has two sons who help him with his business. 

The loan will allow Sisak to purchase a damaged car and cover its renovation costs. 

Sisak has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Your help is very important to Sisak because he will be able to sell the car and get income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a damaged car and its renovation costs.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 27 years old, married woman. Her husband(also shown in the photo) has been running a food stall selling fresh juices for many years. He makes enough money to run their household activities. Sana is a mother of 2 children; one of her children is also shown in the photo. 

Sana is eager to provide them a better standard of living. In order to improve her husband's business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and has availed Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR to purchase another juicer machine with the packs of sugar and flavors.

 It would help him to cater to more customers for earning good amount of income.

loans.use: to purchase another juicer machine with the packs of sugar and flavors.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 41 years old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband who has been successfully running a small general store. He is good in dealing with customers and counts a good client list.  They have  4 children and are motivated to provide them with a better standard of living. 

For husband's business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of customers efficiently.

loans.name: Vergine

texts.en:
Vergine and her husband have been selling clothing supplies for 15 years. They organize sales in nearby villages and, most of the time, exchange clothing with food products. 

Vergine has asked for this loan to purchase the new stock of summer collection clothing for children, men and women. She is planning a trip to nearby villages and wants to have new stock to offer to her customers. 

Vergine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Your help is very important for Vergine and her husband to develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for the new stock of summer collection clothing for children, men and women

loans.name: Sayime

texts.en:
Sayime is 50 years old and a mother of two. One of her children is blind so she makes handicrafts at home to make money and take care of her child. Sayime is making lace and embroidering scarves to sell to her neighbours. With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought scarves in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sayime Hanım 50 yaşında evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Çocuklarından biri görme engelli olduğu için Sayime hanım evinden el işi yaparak hem çocuğuna bakıyor hem de evine ek gelir sağlıyor. Sayime hanım dantel ve yazma oyalayarak çevresine satış yapıyor. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan yazma aldı.

loans.use: to buy scarves in bulk.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Anna from the town of Sisian in the Syunik region. Five years ago, she started her retail business selling cosmetics and other home supplies. After she began earning a profit, Anna expanded the variety of items she sold and gained more customers. Anna lives with her husband and two kids and the income she earns is very important for her family's living.

Anna has requested this loan to purchase new stock of cosmetics and home supplies to resell to customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with reasonable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. Your help is very important for Anna and her start-up business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics and home supplies to resell to customers

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa, a 38-year-old Syrian citizen, is married and the father of one child. Three years ago, Alaa rented a store in a Palestinian refugee camp to sell shoes. He has 16 years of experience in this domain. Alaa needs to replenish his store and add more items, diversifying his inventory. In order to do that, he needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. This support will allow him to have more customers. Alaa also hopes to expand later on by having a bigger store.

loans.use: to replenish his store and add more items, diversifying his inventory.

loans.name: Friendship 2 Group

texts.en:
Meriam is the featured borrower of Friendship 2 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been dear friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines and came to work as housekeepers in Lebanon.

Meriam is the second lady from the left with a light pink top. She is a 34-year-old married mother of one child. She works as a housekeeper to support her family in the Philippines in their living.

Meriam is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing her family's living and responding to their needs. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her child's higher education costs in the Philippines.

As for the other group members, Janet is the second from the right, Jovice is the first on the left, and Paula is the first on the right.

loans.use: to pay for her child's higher education costs in the Philippines.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto sells vegetable out from the harvest in his farm. He has been doing this business for fifteen years. Aside from vegetable farming, he is also proficient in raising pigs. 

Crisanto works hard for his family. He has five children to support and dependent on him financially. With this, he is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm.

 In the future, Crisanto hopes to send all his children to school so they could have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tyres and tubes for better services for his motorbike.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 29 years old. She is married and they have two children. She makes dresses and has been in business for 10 years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy textile materials, sewing threads, buttons and tape measures for use in her business so as to make more dresses and make more income to support her family. She will use the generated profits from the expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her tailoring business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy textile materials, sewing threads, buttons and tape measures for use in her business so as to make more dresses and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
María, manifiesta que en esta temporada las ventas han mejorado y no cuenta con la mercadería suficiente para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar cebollas, chiles, plátanos, repollos, etc., así mismo repara el canopy, la idea que ella tiene es ofrecer productos frescos y mejor la vistosidad de su negocio, espera que las ventas se mantengan.
Ella utiliza los créditos como herramientas para ir ampliando su negocio y generando los ingresos que tanto necesita para subsistir con su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Maria says that in this season her sales have improved and she does not have enough merchandise to cover all her customers' demands. She is asking for a loan to buy onions, chilis, bananas, cabbages, etc., and to repair the canopy of her stand. Her idea is to offer more fresh produce and to improve the visibility of her business, and hopes to sustain her sales.

She will use the loan as tools to expand her business and generate the income that she needs to support her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, chilis, bananas, cabbages, etc., and to repair her stand's canopy, in order to offer more fresh produce and improve the visibility of her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking 54-year-old woman from Tigbauan, Iloilo. She has been buying and selling dried fish for 10 years now. She buys directly from producers and suppliers near the seashore so as to take advantage of lower prices. In this way, Leonila can earn higher profits which helps her meet her usual expenditures. It’s her way of supplementing her husband’s irregular income as a carpenter. Leonila and her husband have five children, two of whom are still studying in college. It is indeed pocket-draining, which is why the couple works hard to complete their children’s education. 

This rainy season, Leonila knows that there are times when dried fish will be scarce. But there are also favorable days when it will be abundant and cheap. She plans to seize those favorable days to buy assorted dried fish in high volume. She needs PHP 8,000 to keep her business running during the rainy season. The income from her business will help her meet her family's everyday needs and cover her children’s educational expenses. Two to three years from now, her children will graduate from college and she will be relieved of a huge expense.  

Leonila regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion, which she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish in high volume when prices are low

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 39 years old, married lady. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested for a Murabaha loan of 15000 PKR  to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to get boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for sewing up more dresses on time

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia  is 42 years old, married woman, with 3 children. She deals in a business of selling animals with the help of her husband(who is also shown in the photo). Nazia is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri lives with her 5-years-old son in Kapan town, of Syunik region. To be able to sustain her living, Mersi started her retail cosmetics business two years ago. During the month, Meri collects orders from her customers, after which she brings needed cosmetics supplies from the wholesale market. 

To be able to purchase new stock of cosmetics for covering current orders of her customers, Meri asks your support. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Your help is very important for Meri and her family's only source of income:cosmetics sales.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of cosmetics to satisfy customers' demand

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 40 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. with her 2 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years.  
She needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Juliana Tsotsoo

texts.en:
Juliana is a second-year student at the Accra Polytechnic Institute, pursuing a three-year course leading to an award of HND. The loan is to help pay for her school fees.

Her mother is her inspiration because she has always seen to it that Juliana’s siblings are catered for in her own little way ever since their father died. She looks up to her mother to attain higher heights in her education.

Her profession interests her because it would help put food on the table in the near future, and it would afford her the opportunity to provide for the family and the needy in the society.

“In the next few years to come, I hope to be in a procurement department, and without this education, I can never achieve my aim.”

She has no other alternative than to stay at home until her mother gets some financial assistance elsewhere to support her, and this would affect her academic performance.

“My country is a lovely place to be, and so would want more investors to invest, especially in the areas of education, women, and childcare.”

loans.use: to pay for her tuition and hostel fees.

loans.name: Flor De Retama De Rumira Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FLOR DE RETAMA DE RUMIRA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nadia ella es soltera y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales menores.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “FLOR DE RETAMA DE RUMIRA” communal bank which is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, belonging to Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

Nadia is one member. She is 28 years old, single and has two children. She works in her business raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. Through her business she wants to open a grocery store as it is her dream to have her own business. She also wants to have a larger space so she can sell her animals. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and also feed for the animals.

The member in the attached photo had his photo taken after the meeting. He asked permission to be late for the due to his work. The other members work in their businesses selling food, in agriculture, a grocery store and raising small animals.

Nadia is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the installment payments within the established time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a rice farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She also owned a sari-sari store for a living. Lolita has been in the farming business for 9 years now. She works hard in order to provide support to her husband. She barely earn PHP3000 per month from her business while supporting nine dependents ages one to nineteen. 

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and merchandise like chips, seasoning, toiletries and canned goods . Through this loan Lolita will be able to improve the productivity of her farm which will increase her harvest and yields. In the future Lolita hopes to see her children finish school and be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and merchandise like chips, seasoning, toiletries and canned goods

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This young entrepreneur is Liza from Calumpang, General Santos City, South Cotabato. She is married to Florante, a fish broker, and they are blessed with a child. She is artistic in nature and she has a passion for cross-stitching. She uses her hobby as an income-generating venture, aside from her direct selling business. It gives her a sense of productivity and fulfillment, and it helps sustain their daily needs. However, it takes several weeks before she can finish one cross-stitched art. Therefore, she aims to give extra time and attention to her direct selling business and her husband’s fish enterprise. She is requesting PHP 20,000 additional capital to buy more stocks of toiletries and hygiene products. She will also allot some money to purchase a volume of tuna for her husband’s business. It will increase their combined profit and will boost their savings for the future. They can also extend financial help to their parents who are already in their old age. They aspire to continually improve their business to support the education of their child until completion.

Liza gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of toiletries and hygiene products

loans.name: Ingrid Cristina

texts.es:
Ingrid, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos. 

Ingrid, hace 2 años comenzó a vender ropa, no tenía un lugar estable, comenzó trabajando para una amiga y ahí se dio cuenta que el negocio era bueno, tiempo después solicito un crédito el cual le sirvió para independizarse  y tener su propia venta de ropa, después de un año, el hermano de su pareja viajo a otro país y les dejo una panadería; su pareja tiene mucha experiencia en hacer pizza, por esa razón decidieron tener ambos negocios en el mismo lugar; ahora tienen personas trabajando para ellos y cada vez les va mejor, ya que muchos clientes los han recomendado y el negocio crece. 

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar harina, tomares, queso, entre otros insumos para hacer la pizza y para la panadería; además quieren remodelar el local, para mayor comodidad de sus clientes. 

El sueño de Ingrid, es sacar adelante a sus hijos, comprar su propia casa y abrir más locales de su negocio de pizza.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 34 years old and went to school until the 7th grade. She is in a relationship and has four children. Two years ago, Ingrid started selling clothing. She didn't have a stable place so she started working for a friend and there she realized that the business was good. Some time later she requested a loan which helped her break away and have her own business selling clothing. After a year, her partner's brother left for another country and left them a bakery. Her partner has a lot of experience making pizza which is why they decided to have both businesses in the same place. They now have people working for them and they keep doing better since many customers have recommended them and the business is growing. 

She needs this loan money to buy flour, tomatoes, cheese and other supplies to make pizza and for the bakery. They also want to remodel the premises for the convenience of their customers. Ingrid's dream is to raise her children, buy her own home and open more pizza shops.

loans.use: to buy flour, tomatoes, cheese and other supplies.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is importing and selling special leaves for making wreaths. He has agreements with different flower shops and is their loyal supplier for many years.  Hamlet lives in Jrvezh town, near Yerevan with his wife and two children.

He asks this loan to purchase new stock of leaves for continuing his business activity. The business is relatively new, but first income started to appear, making Hamlet to work harder.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Your help is very important for Hamlet and his business and he hopes to receive your faith.

loans.use: to pay for special leaves for making wreaths

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y actualmente todos están estudiando, mientras que su esposo reside en Estados Unidos.

Gloria, tiene una pupusería desde hace 5 años, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en la pupuseria y para colocar una tienda en su casa, ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y aportar para los gastos del hogar.

Ella desea ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios básicos y poder aportar para que estudien una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old.  She went to school until the sixth grade.  She is married with 3 children who are all currently in school.  Her husband lives in the United States.

For 5 years Gloria has had a pupusería (a shop that makes and sells stuffed tortillas).  Prior to that she devoted herself to running her household.

She seeks a loan to invest in her pupuseria and to establish a store in her house, since she has always liked to work and contribute to the household expenses.

Gloria hopes to see her children complete their basic schooling, and to be able to support them in pursuing university degrees.

loans.use: to invest in her pupuseria (a shop that makes and sells stuffed tortillas), and to open a store in her house.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is married and lives with his wife in Vanadzor town. He works as a distributor of a bread. Currently his car is seriously damaged and it is very difficult for Erik to complete current orders. That's the reason he has applied for this loan.

Erik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with reasonable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. Your help is very important for Erik and he awaits and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car, which he uses to transport his bread to stores

loans.name: Abizerwa Cb Group

texts.en:
Epiphanie is a group leader; aged 36 years.She is married with 3 children age between 5 and 12 years. The group is called ABIZERWA means “the trusted” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, banana,cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, banana,cassava for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary. She is 58 years old and married to Bonifacio, a retired worker. They have children whom they love so much and who are the source of their inspiration. Mary raises hogs in their backyard as a practical enterprise that provides food for the community. One of her sons ventured into fishing to earn extra income for the family. But the family's fishing boat and nets are already deteriorating due to long time use. Mary wants to repair their fishing boat and buy additional fishing nets to continue the business. She also plans to buy additional piglets to raise. 

A PHP 12,000 loan would be very helpful for Mary and her whole family. She hopes you are willing to assist her so she can increase her profits and boost her savings. Mary strives hard to meet her family’s everyday needs. She also aims to save enough for the processing of her son’s seaman’s requirements. If he succeeds in his application as a seaman, that will be another effective way to improve their living conditions. 

Mary is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for her hog raising business

loans.name: Leonidesa

texts.en:
Leonidesa is a 58-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. For three years now, she has been operating a sari-sari (or variety) store business and raising hogs for a living. She would like to continue her business and make improvements but lacks capital. 

Leonidesa is seeking a loan to buy more piglets and merchandise such as cooking oil, soy sauce, canned food, biscuits, candies, beverages, soft drinks, and coffee. She hopes to make her business more profitable by increasing her inventory and increasing the number of hogs that she is raising. 

In the future, Leonidesa hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and merchandise such as cooking oil, soy sauce, canned food, biscuits, candies, beverages, soft drinks, and coffee

loans.name: Hatoum Group

texts.en:
Hind is the featured borrower for the Hatoum Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hind is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She started eighteen years ago selling clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. 

Today, Hind is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers needs. Hind is the first lady on the right, Yosour is the lady sitting in the middle and Fatima is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove, cooking utensils and tables to provide better service in her snack shop.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus dos nietos de 9 años y 1 año de edad que son su mayor alegría y les brinda su apoyo para que estudien. Manuel se dedica a prestar sus servicios de transporte haciendo viajes en su pick-up  al interior del cantón de su localidad, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante y sostener la economía de su hogar. Manuel desea hacerle unas mejoras a su vehículo el cual es su herramienta de trabajo por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mano de obra para realizar ajustes a su vehículo y de esta manera garantizar la seguridad de sus clientes y familia.
texts.en: Manuel is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two grandchildren, 9 and 1 year old, who are his greatest happiness and whom he supports in their education. Manuel works rendering transportation services by making trips in his pick-up car to the interior of the canton in his region. This has allowed him to move ahead and support his household's finances. Manuel wants to make some improvements to his vehicle which is his work tool. For this, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: hand labor to make adjustments to his vehicle, and in this way to guarantee the safety of his customers and family.

loans.use: to invest in: hand labor to make adjustments to his vehicle, and in this way to guarantee the safety of his customers and family.

loans.name: Marycel

texts.en:
“I want to help others. I dream of giving employment to my friends, neighbors, and relatives.” This is Marycel’s aspiration. She is not only concerned about herself but wishes to succeed together with others. Marycel owns two pedicabs, also known as trisikads. A “trisikad” is a three-wheeled vehicle just like the tricycle, but it doesn’t use gasoline or diesel to run. Just the power of “sikad” or kick makes it run. Simply put, it is a bicycle with an attached compartment for passengers. A trisikad driver uses his strength to transport his passengers. Patient and hardworking men are the usual trisikad drivers. One of them is Marycel’s husband, Emelecio. He drives one of their trisikads and he rents out the other one to his friend. When their trisikads break down, two families suffer the loss of income. 

As of now, Marycel hopes to borrow PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts to efficiently maintain her trisikads. She wants to purchase another unit to boost her income and to employ another friend as trisikad driver. Part of the loan will be used as seed money for this new unit. Marycel is doing this endeavor for the future of her child who is still in elementary school. She wants to save as early as possible for her college education.

Marycel is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her pedicabs

loans.name: La Casona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA CASONA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes ella es casada y tiene 54 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprenddora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the Communal Bank “LA CASONA”. This bank is located in the district of Mollepata, belonging to the province of Anta and department of Cusco. The member Mercedes is married, 54 years old and has 3 children. She works in her restaurant business. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and meat stews. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She is an enterprising woman, who wants to move her family ahead through this business. She has many years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables and chicken. The other members work in businesses selling animals, selling cereals, grocery store business and selling food. The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream, and through this means she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married father of four children. He started 23 years ago working as a mechanician to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his region for his professional skills.

Ali is always working hard and trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions and guarantee their future lives, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's university tuition fees.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his children's university tuition fees

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 49 years old, widow doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale. She is shown in the photo with her nephew. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers
